2:40.race_name: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Rosebery Handicap (London Middle Distance Qual') (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Real Dream
runners.comment: Ended 2024 with two poor runs; left Stoute yard for 30,000gns; good first-time-out record
runners.spotlight: 1m4f win here on handicap debut in May 2023; that was his last AW race and he was smart at his best afterwards on turf, but ended last term with two poor runs; sold out of Sir Michael Stoute's for 30,000gns in October and he does have a good first-time-out record.

quotes.race: Ascot Racecourse Supports Children Heard And Seen Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a nice sensible gallop and once we've picked up into the straight Real Dream responded well. He's lightly-raced and hopefully he can continue going the right way. It's up to Sir Michael Stoute but I think the Ebor could be a race that suits him nicely - Richard Kingscote, jockey.

quotes.race: Unibet Extra Place Offers Every Day Handicap
quotes.quote: He stuck his neck out well. It probably turned into a bit of a sprint and then he had to respond. He's a very laid back character and takes his racing well - Richard Kingscote, jockey speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Max Mayhem
runners.comment: Won this race in 2023; 8lb rise since recent Meydan win takes him to a career-high mark
runners.spotlight: Won twice over C&D in 2023, in this race on first occasion; has run on turf at Meydan on last four starts and won stylishly 15 days ago at 1m4f, which demands respect, but 8lb rise since takes him to a career-high mark.

quotes.race: Longines Spirit Flyback (Handicap) (Turf)
quotes.quote: There was plenty of pace. I was a bit worried when I lost my cover on the backside, but I was pretty confident once we turned for home - Adrie de Vries, jockey.

quotes.race: Racing TV London Middle Distance Series (Final) Handicap (Series Final - Qualified Horses Only)
quotes.quote: It's a nice prize to pick up. Max Mayhem's win here in the Rosebery suggested that he was in for another good run today and fair dos to Kevin and his team, they've pulled up stumps midsummer and waited for this. Kevin's very good at targeting races and getting horses spot on to fire on those days, and he's proved that again today - Daniel Muscutt, jockey.

quotes.race: Racing TV Rosebery Handicap (London Middle Distance Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Max Mayhem is new to the yard, but he's a good-ground horse so we decided to come here. He showed a good attitude to win having gone wide with no cover. He's showed some good form at home and will probably go for the nice handicap over a mile and a quarter at Epsom on Derby weekend. He'll have more of a busy summer than busy spring and I think he's a mile-and-a-quarter horse - Kevin Philippart de Foy, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF "Northfields" Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Max Mayhem was very good and tough. He travelled into the race with ease, he lengthened and he was good and game - Mikey Sheehy, jockey.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Race (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Max Mayhem is a nice horse. He quickened up well and coped with the ground lovely. It was a nice performance and he was never really in any trouble. He has a nice future - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Balmacara
runners.comment: 8-1 when mid-division in the Cambridgeshire; progressed at 1m2f going into that; AW debut
runners.spotlight: Free-going front-runner (hooded on last three starts) who is unraced beyond 1m2f and unraced on AW, but his dam was a 1m5f winner on Polytrack and her previous foal was a dual 1m4f AW winner; just 8-1 when only mid-division in the 1m1f Cambridgeshire on final start but progressed well at 1m2f going into that and no surprise if better is in store this season.

quotes.race: Town Moor Business Club Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We came here today to find out whether we've got a handicapper or a Group horse. That's for the trainer to decide now. But I imagine she's going to look for something flashier - Balmacara could do a bit of damage on soft ground in a Group race.  He's done extremely well from his first run to this, he's come in his coat and he's strengthened up. He did it well last time but he was keen and got tired, today he had a stronger bit in his mouth and raced properly. He loves the ground, I don't think he's dependent on it but when he does get it it will be more of a disadvantage to the others than it will be to him - Charles Bishop, jockey.

runners.name: Teumessias Fox
runners.comment: Won one of last 14 starts; however, that win came in good style here (1m4f) last January
runners.spotlight: Has won only one of his last 14 starts; however, that win came in good style over 1m4f here in January 2024 off just 1lb lower than today and this is his first appearance at Kempton since; ended last term out of form but it's hard to rule out him returning here with a bang.

quotes.race: Howden Handicap
quotes.quote: Teumessias Fox lost his way a little last year. He was gelded before his break and we found that he wants his races spaced out. Hopefully he can keep on progressing and hopefully he doesn't go up too much so he can get into one of the Ascot handicaps. I'd have thought it would be a mile and a half but we'll probably put him in the Copper Horse as well - Andrew Balding, trainer.

runners.name: Paradias
runners.comment: C&D win in January in a blanket finish; just 1lb higher now and he has never been better
runners.spotlight: Scored at Glorious Goodwood (1m1f) last summer and arrives today on a hat-trick after wins at Wolverhampton (1m4f) in December and Kempton (1m3f) in January; the latter was in a blanket finish among the first four but he's just 1lb higher now and has never been better.

quotes.race: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Handicap
quotes.quote: We're not going to give hurdles another go at the moment. There are two pretty valuable mile-and-a-half handicaps coming up, the first of which is in about a month's time, so we'll look at those. It was a lovely performance. I'm delighted with Paradias and I don't know why he's not run on the all-weather until recently, but we tested the waters last time and that was strong form, so we thought we'd roll the dice again. He's not been over raced and he's learning to relax better. The step up in trip has helped him too - Alan King, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a good summer on the Flat, winning at Goodwood and finishing second at Epsom, and has a very workable mark back over hurdles so could be interesting. He won't want any further than two miles and he'll handle good to soft ground but not heavy. 25-10-24

He could be interesting in handicap hurdles. He had a good summer on the Flat, winning at Goodwood and finishing second at Epsom, and has a very workable mark. He won't want any further than 2m and he'll handle good to soft ground but not heavy. 07-11-24

runners.name: Mr Alan
runners.comment: Best known for 1m2f/1m4f handicap performances in the mud but he won't lack for fitness
runners.spotlight: Last five starts were in Bahrain, placed in two of his last three; they wouldn't be near his best form (much better is needed today) and he's best known for 1m2f/1m4f handicap performances in the mud, having run just three times on AW, but he won't lack for fitness.

quotes.race: Watch Irish Racing On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: It's hard work out there and Mr Alan hit the front early enough. It was a brave performance and he goes well in these conditions - William Buick, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He did well to win his maiden last year over a mile on good to soft ground at Ayr and followed that up with a creditable fourth at Deauville on heavy in October. I ran him back at the Craven meeting where the ground was too fast for him as he is much better with give. You live and learn and this fellow will never run on decent ground again. He will get 1m2f or possibly further and I feel he will win a nice race somewhere when he gets his conditions. 27-04-22

runners.name: Mount Atlas
runners.comment: Second in valuable 1m4f contest in October; gelded since; lightly raced with potential
runners.spotlight: Third in 1m4f novice here last July was good at the time, followed by markedly better in 1m4f handicaps at Ascot 16 days later and Newmarket (second in valuable race) in October; gelded since; makes plenty of appeal judged on the latest performance and he's lightly raced, with potential.

quotes.race: John Guest Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: Mount Atlas stays well, has a nice attitude and is learning all the time - he's going the right way. He's quite immature at home so it was difficult to know what to expect. He can be a little bit lazy in his work but he does it on the racecourse, which is the most important thing - Hayley Turner, jockey.

runners.name: Grey Cuban
runners.comment: Doncaster 1m2f win under Jamie Spencer on penultimate start puts him in the picture
runners.spotlight: Usually front-runs or races very prominently; AW experience amounts to one race but he hacked up in that Wolverhampton novice (Tapeta) on reappearance last term; below form on both attempts at 1m4f but two of last season's four wins came over the extended 1m2f at Chester; Doncaster win under Jamie Spencer on penultimate start puts him in the picture.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Handicap
quotes.quote: Grey Cuban is an honest, straightforward horse. He needs to be ridden up with the pace. He's an amazing horse for the syndicate. He continues to improve and this ground suited him - Mike Edwards, head of Roudee Racing.

stable_tour.quote: By the sire of the moment Havana Grey, this colt made a very satisfactory debut when second to Les Bleus at Newmarket last month and then was runner-up again at Nottingham last week. It's not often I'm happy finishing second but I had to be pleased with the way he ran at Nottingham. He finished like the proverbial train and in another dozen strides would have won. That was over 6f again but having witnessed that effort you'd be stunned if he didn't get further as he looked to be crying out for a longer trip. It was an eyecatching run and hopefully his turn is very close. He's a smashing colt who was a Goffs UK purchase and we've been kind of targeting him at the sales race at York next week. He's also in the 6½f sales race at Doncaster's St Leger meeting next month. In time I see him doing well over a mile. He was bought very cheaply as he was a very big horse. Basically, he looked like a giant but he isn't at all and I think his owners have bought very well. I liked him from the word go and would be very disappointed if he didn't win this year. 17-08-23

runners.name: Forceful Speed
runners.comment: Competitive for new yard (same owners) if starting this term where he left off last season
runners.spotlight: Regular winner in three campaigns with George Boughey, for whom he ended last June with a win at Pontefract (1m4f) and good second on Newcastle Tapeta (1m2f); unraced on Polytrack; hood joins his now usual tongue-tie and he'll be competitive for new yard (same owners) if starting this term where he left off last season.

quotes.race: Betfred Play Fred's 5 Million Apprentices' Derby Handicap
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with that. Forceful Speed is just getting better and better and he's shown that one and a half miles is no problem now. I do not have anything else in mind for him, but I am hopeful he can stay ahead of the handicapper for a little while yet - George Boughey, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Handicap
quotes.quote: Forceful Speed was very brave. He really battled on gamely, they were coming thick and fast late on but he really stuck his head out. It was all smooth for him and momentum is key at this track - William Buick, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He went on a bit of a run last season with three victories after being beaten on his first start. He's a fun handicapper and he's versatile in terms of trip. We'll see him in the next few weeks. 04-04-24

runners.name: Ambiente Amigo
runners.comment: Minor honours in two 1m4f Listed races last summer; needs Flat return to be a career best
runners.spotlight: Sole AW race was an easy win as 2yo on Lingfield Polytrack; took minor honours in two 1m4f Listed races last summer; won hurdle debut last October but she didn't really take to that game, having only two more forays, and needs this Flat return to be a career best.

quotes.race: Quinnbet Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Juvenile Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Ambiente Amigo is a lovely filly and did well on the Flat. I hold her in high regard and she did it the right way while learning on the job. We'll probably go for something low key with her next time but we'll assess our options. We have a few juveniles who have won and are going down a similar route but it's a nice problem to have - James Owen, trainer.

quotes.race: Follow @attheraces On Twitter EBF Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C & D) (Qual') (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ambiente Amigo has come on leaps and bounds and the team has done a great job in keeping her relaxed. She has some lofty entries in the autumn and I'd imagine she'll step up in class next. She was a little keen early and we didn't go overly quick, so for her to pick up and quicken like she did was quite impressive - Hector Crouch, jockey.

runners.name: Andaleep
runners.comment: This might be bit too competitive for win purposes; cheekpieces (tried once in 2022) back
runners.spotlight: Only two of his 12 wins were on AW (from 29 AW attempts) and both were at Southwell but he has run well on occasions here; second off this mark at Wolverhampton on Boxing Day last time but this race might be a bit too competitive for win purposes; cheekpieces (tried once in 2022, no show) return.

quotes.race: BetUK. Home Of The Acca-Fenwa Handicap
quotes.quote: Andaleep was a pleasure to ride. The idea was to sit handy and tough it out, and he was a very game performer - Callum Hutchinson, jockey.

quotes.race: Imber Court Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought a mile and a half would be his trip but I was wrong! Andaleep likes proper quick ground and a mile and a quarter suits him really well. We'll look for another similar race on a stiff track - Graeme McPherson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: When he was sent to us, we thought he'd win a couple because he was well handicapped, but not eight! He just keeps finding more, but this winter I think we've learned more too. Before, he was bullying lesser horses, but he's now at a level where we've had to work out exactly how to ride him, while there's a style of race that suits. He likes to come through horses, but seems suited to 1m2f and 1m4f races, where they don't go hard and it's a sprint. I think that's why he did well on the all-weather over the winter because they seem to walk in plenty of those races. He's won of turf, though, and should be out again in May. 02-05-24

runners.name: Killybegs Warrior
runners.comment: Made most when second in this race last year off 11lb higher, the last of three AW runs
runners.spotlight: Made most when second in this race last year off 11lb higher, the last of only three ventures on AW; that has to catch the eye and he also has a chance on turf form for Charlie Johnston as recent as September; fit from placed efforts in Bahrain for new yard this year and a case can be made.

quotes.race: 6 Horse Challenge At bet365 Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Killybegs Warrior has been set some tough challenges in the likes of the Dante and the Hampton Court, with his only real disappointment being in the Silver Bowl at Haydock. We spent a lot of time debating whether a mile or a mile and a quarter is his trip, and it's definitely this trip today. His owner, Mick Doyle, loves Newmarket and York so we always try to target races there. I might see if I can get him to let us run him at Goodwood in between - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

runners.name: Lieber Power
runners.comment: 2yo winner here; did well over about 1m4f last summer; player if he returns in top form
runners.spotlight: 2yo win was easily his best return from three visits here; best form came over about 1m4f on turf last summer, with two wins (York and Chepstow) and three close seconds, the latest at York Ebor meeting (3lb higher today) when he once again finished with gusto; 1m5f in the mud did not work out on final start; player if he returns in top form.

runners.name: Calumet
runners.comment: Half-brother to high-class Giavellotto and, after just four races, surely has potential
runners.spotlight: Carries his head rather high; started his career with two seconds at this track early last year; ran away with a maiden at Windsor in July and good third on handicap debut at Yarmouth in August, both 1m2f; half-brother to high-class Giavellotto and, after just four races, surely has potential.

3:15.race_name: Virgin Bet Snowdrop Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)

runners.name: Crimson Advocate
runners.comment: Group 2 winner as 2yo; down in grade but stamina a doubt on first outing beyond 5f
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo, US-trained when winning Group 2 Queen Mary as a 2yo and stakes event at Gulfstream Park last May; came up well short in Group 1 contest at last year's Royal Ascot; drops in class here but has stamina to prove after an absence on first outing beyond 5f.

quotes.race: Queen Mary Stakes (Group 2) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: We'll probably let the dust settle and come up with a plan. We'll see whether Crimson Advocate races in Europe again or we bring her home. We've a few days to think about it and are scheduled to fly back on June 28, so we'll make a plan between now and then - George Weaver, trainer.

runners.name: Gaiety Musical
runners.comment: Three handicap wins in 2025 but has plenty to find on form in this higher grade
runners.spotlight: Three AW handicap wins so far this year include two over C&D; has a fitness advantage over some of today's rivals but she has plenty to find on form and would be a surprise winner.

runners.name: Mercury Day
runners.comment: Beaten in handicaps last four 3yo starts and now up in grade after six months off
runners.spotlight: Won over 1m at Newmarket last summer but looked held by the handicapper in four subsequent outings and is now up in grade after six months off.

quotes.race: Durcan Bloodstock Pat Smullen Memorial Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: We were gutted Mercury Day was balloted out of the Sandringham Handicap at Royal Ascot as we've always liked her and she's from a good Juddmonte family. She's in a mile and a quarter handicap at the July Festival but Jim said to stick at a mile for now - Conrad Allen, trainer.

runners.name: Muddy Mooy
runners.comment: 2-3, latest win in Wolverhampton novice; more needed but may have more untapped potential
runners.spotlight: Successful in two of her three races, most recently a novice at Wolverhampton (8.6f) in February; will need a chunk of improvement to follow up but she's going the right way and may have more untapped potential.

runners.name: Queen Of Atlantis
runners.breeder: D Farrington, P Gately, T Killarney
runners.comment: Balance of form suggests she'll come up short but the return to the AW is a positive
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 campaign with good seconds in two 1m handicaps at Ascot; those runs suggest she'll come up short in this higher grade but she goes well on the AW (three wins from five attempts) and it would be no surprise if she posted a career best on her return from seven months off.

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: Peter (Chapple-Hyam, trainer) was confident once again and told me Queen Of Atlantis had come on a lot for Wolverhampton. She's a filly that takes a while to get going but she's small and nibble and was able to get through the gaps. She gives it everything - Callum Hutchinson, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Romanova
runners.breeder: Lofts Hall Stud, B Sangster, New England
runners.comment: Impressive winner as 2yo; might have needed reappearance after long absence; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Impressive 7f winner as 2yo; out of the frame both starts since but she might have needed the run after a long absence when sixth of 11 in Lingfield handicap four weeks ago; possibilities if building on that and her pedigree offers hope that she'll stay this far (pulled hard when tried previously).

quotes.race: Byerley Stud British EBF Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Bands B/C/D) (Qual') GBB/IRE Inc' Race)
quotes.quote: I put Romanova in at Sandown because the entries looked light. There was a lot of rain forecast and I thought it would cut up, and there'd be the chance of some black type. That was a tough ask on her debut, but she's a nice filly and it was a nice springboard into today. She's a good-moving filly with a nice action, but I'd say she's versatile with regard to ground and we'll see what we do. Hopefully she'll improve with her racing and it's fairly early for a Golden Horn filly. If the right race came along, I'd see no problem stepping her back up in grade - Ollie Sangster, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's by Golden Horn so you wouldn't expect her to be that forward, but she has been. She won nicely in maiden company at Salisbury and is going to run in the May Hill Stakes at Doncaster on Thursday. It looks like a good race for her and she'll be suited by the track and the step up to a mile so we're looking forward to it. We may be pitching her in too deep - we'll find out on Thursday! 12-09-23

runners.name: Rose Prick
runners.comment: Third at 50-1 in this race 12 months ago; consistent afterwards; each-way hopes
runners.spotlight: Third at 50-1 in this race 12 months ago and held her form well afterwards without winning; has a solid record fresh and likely to give her running again; each-way hopes.

quotes.race: Benchmark Designs Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Rose Prick is a nice filly, but she didn't have much luck today. Saffie extricated her from a couple of situations - particularly when the field closed up on her. She appreciated the give in the ground and I think the extra furlong helped her too - David Ward, owner.

stable_tour.quote: She's another who's done very well and she ran a huge race in the Snowdrop Stakes at Kempton. She's going to head for the Nottinghamshire Oaks next week. I think she'll be competitive in Listed races and we might chance our hand with her in North America later on. 25-04-24

runners.name: Rubies From Burma
runners.comment: Bred to be smart; progressive in three 3yo runs; very interesting contender up in grade
runners.spotlight: Improved markedly in three outings last season, making all in 1m Cork maiden on third of them by a wide margin (runner-up went one better next time); bred to be smart (out of a half-sister to Derby winner Anthony Van Dyck) and looks a very interesting contender in this higher grade.

runners.name: Shuwari
runners.comment: Second in Fillies' Mile; leading claims if ready to do herself justice after 17 months off
runners.spotlight: Very useful form as a 2yo, winning 7f Listed race at Sandown (beat subsequent Irish 1,000 Guineas winner Fallen Angel) and finishing a close second in the Fillies' Mile at Newmarket; may still be capable of better and has leading claims if ready to do herself justice on AW debut after 17 months off.

quotes.race: bet365 Fillies' Mile (Group 1)
quotes.quote: Shuwari saw out the trip well but I think we just got outstayed in the last 50 yards by Ryan and obviously that is a very good filly. I think she liked the ground as it wasn't that soft. Everything went well apart from the fact we didn't win. That will be her for the season and I suppose we will work back from the 1,000 Guineas. I wouldn't be afraid of pitching straight up into a 1,000 Guineas as she is a straightforward filly to train - Ollie Sangster, trainer.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai Rockfel Stakes (Group 2) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: I was very happy, and Shuwari ran great. She came home very strongly. We will see how the next week goes but we could think about coming back for the Fillies' Mile. She had been off for 64 days and she will come on again so will definitely think about the Fillies' Mile - Ollie Sangster, trainer.

quotes.race: European Bloodstock News EBF Star Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Shuwari will probably want a mile and her dam is by Sir Percy, so I suspect there's a bit of stamina in there and her speed just comes from class. I was originally going to start her over six because she's so speedy. I was really on the fence about running her when we saw the weather report last night but we thought we'd take our chance. Oisin was thrilled, he said it was probably not her ideal ground but she was very tenacious. We'd think about the Rockfel and maybe the Fillies' Mile, but obviously that's ambitious and there's a lot of grass between now and then. She's not going to have tons of racing this year but another few starts. She's got a great attitude and is very straightforward to train, she's at the top of my two-year-olds at the moment - Ollie Sangster, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: At the moment, she seems to be the best we've got and she's always looked good, but when you have small numbers and don't have too many others to compare them with it's hard to know. Her debut at Newbury went well then she did it nicely in a Listed race at Sandown. That form could hardly have worked out any better as the filly she beat was Fallen Angel, who won the Moyglare last weekend, although it looks like she has improved a lot. I imagine Shuwari will improve for some better ground. She had a little setback which meant she missed the Prestige at Goodwood, but it was nothing untoward and we're looking forward to running her in the Rockfel at Newmarket. If she runs well, she could always go on to the Fillies' Mile. She may be a Guineas filly - we'll see after the Rockfel! The dam is by Sir Percy so there's a bit of stamina in there and she could stay further. 12-09-23

runners.name: Soprano
runners.comment: Fine 2024 included Royal Ascot and Deauville wins; the pick on ratings and the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Had an excellent 2024, winning Sandringham Handicap at Royal Ascot and Group 3 event at Deauville, both over 1m; down the field at the Breeders' Cup when last seen in November; probably needed the run on her only previous AW start; she's the pick on ratings and the one to beat.

quotes.race: Prix de Lieurey - Fonds Europeen de l'Elevage (Group 3) (3yo Fillies) (Round Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Soprano has always promised a lot and I think that being ridden differently today was the key to her success. William [Buick] got her out smartly from her wide draw and it enabled him to get that good position. She's a strong stayer at the mile and now she's a Group 3 winner as well as a Royal Ascot winner. She was littered with black type as a two-year-old and it was good to get that Group-race win. She's always been well entered and she's in the Matron. She'll probably fly the flag at Group 1 level at some stage but it was really all about today - George Boughey, trainer.

quotes.race: Sandringham Stakes (Fillies' Handicap)
quotes.quote: Saying that this filly has been unlucky wouldn't quite quantify it, but huge credit has to go to Harry [Herbert] - we had a long phone conversation in the office the other morning. I wanted to go to Carlisle and Harry wanted to come to Ascot! She's been a filly we've always held in really high regard. Leaving Epsom, I called Harry and said we're going to the Sandringham - we've got to go, we've got to try the mile. Soprano hit the line so strong at Musselburgh. Again, huge credit must go to Charles Eddery - he's ridden her since she came to us as a yearling, and she'd been difficult. She's been a bit keen and a bit numb, and Billy did a great job settling her there but she's taken a while to relax at home, and just as I was saddling her today, as a two-year-old she was mauling me and today she stood there quiet as a lamb. She's coming of age now, just like her jockey - George Boughey, trainer.

quotes.race: Albany Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: I am delighted with Soprano. She looked like she was probably drawn on the wrong side unfortunately, but we are thrilled. She's a filly that is always going to get further. She's out of a sister to a Breeders' Cup Mile winner and that's where her future lies, probably up in trip. They just had a little bit too much toe for her and sprinted away, but she hit the line strong - George Boughey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She was impressive in France last time and the change in tactics to ride her prominently has really been the key. She had some really good form last year behind Fallen Angel when ridden that way. She goes to the Matron Stakes with a lively each-way chance. 11-09-24

A lovely filly who was quick enough to win on her debut over 5f at Newmarket on Guineas weekend. She's in good shape and has been training good and the 6f of the Albany would suit her well. Her work has continued to impress since Newmarket, and I believe the track next week will suit. She is very relaxed at home and took the crowds well on the Rowley Mile. I'm hopeful she will have a big shout next week. 14-06-23

2:05.race_name: Virgin Bet Queen's Prize Handicap (London Stayers' Series Qualifier) (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Metier
runners.comment: Easily best known for his exploits on soft/heavy; sole AW race when last over C&D in 2023
runners.spotlight: Easily best known for his exploits on soft/heavy ground, on the Flat winning 2022 November Handicap and 2023 Chester Cup; the latter was off same mark as today but he did not fire on all cylinders last March-July and he's run only once on AW, when finishing last over C&D in 2023; enough doubts.

quotes.race: tote Chester Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: We had a plan to sit as far forward as we could and it was probably further than we wanted to, but Saffie didn't panic and she slotted Metier in where she could and she gave him a lovely ride - Harry Fry, trainer.

quotes.race: BetGoodwin November Handicap
quotes.quote: We thought Metier felt great this year, we've never had him so well at home. He's most likely to go back over hurdles now, it just depends on the ground, he has to have proper National Hunt ground. He keeps galloping, he's relentless - Carrie Fry, wife of trainer Harry.

quotes.race: Sovereign Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We knew the conditions would suit Metier. He ran a good race at Ascot on good to soft ground. Sean was great there. He went his own tempo and he just loves that ground. He went a good even gallop and kept going. I'm delighted to see him back in the winner's enclosure. Sean said he wasn't doing masses after the last. The handicapper gave us a serious chance. We'll be looking for soft to heavy ground and might go up in trip on better ground - Harry Fry, trainer.

quotes.race: Play The Coral 'Racing Super Series' 'Introductory' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Metier had form on the Flat and we knew that he'd jump and gallop as he'd won over further last time. What we didn't want was to be stuck on behind off no gallop. He was still showing signs of inexperience, as he's entitled to, but what I liked was that when Sean asked him to lengthen he pinged the final two hurdles. He's very exciting and a horse to really look forward to. It is a nice dilemma to have where we go next. Do we come back here in a month for the Grade 2 (Kennel Gate) or maybe go for a Tolworth. We will see, but it's a nice position to be in. - Harry Fry, trainer

stable_tour.quote: I saw it was soft and decided to run him in the November Handicap. He won nicely and was given a fine ride by Saffie Osborne. We might shelve the novice chasing plans because there may be more races for him on the Flat, including the Chester Cup. In the meantime, he can run in valuable hurdle races, such as the one at Lingfield he won last season. He needs conditions in his favour and is best when the mud is flying. 11-11-22

He's reinvented himself as a Flat horse and we're looking at the Group 1 Prix Royal-Oak. We feel that's a good target because he'll be pretty much guaranteed his ground. It'll be competitive but potentially not as hot as the Prix du Cadran and Long Distance Cup. After that we'll see. 04-10-23

runners.name: Golden Rules
runners.comment: Just two runs in more than three years with this yard but they were career bests in 2023
runners.spotlight: Eight races overall and only two in more than three years with current yard, when making all over C&D in March 2023 and going close in the Northumberland Plate (2lb lower today) that July; the first of those came after 638 days off and this time he's had 637, with his trainer's five wins this year including two at 66-1, so it may well be dangerous to write this 8yo off.

runners.name: Tritonic
runners.comment: 8yo; creditable fifth in this race last year after another winter break; 5lb lower today
runners.spotlight: Can front-run; infrequent winner nowadays, last scoring in a four-runner chase in November 2023; ran badly over C&D in December on latest Flat start but runner-up here the previous month and he was a creditable fifth in this race last year after another winter break; 5lb lower today.

quotes.race: Kingwell Farm Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tritonic has jumped super and it's opened up a lot more doors for us. We'll have a bit more fun with him. He's been a great horse. He's versatile but he's got that bit of class too - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Adonis Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We wanted to get a bit more experience into Tritonic and he'll have learned plenty on the inside today. Once or twice he goes to sleep, but as soon as Adrian gives him a squeeze he's back on the bridle - I couldn't be more pleased with him. We gave him a proper holiday after the last Flat season - he was gelded and had six weeks in the field. He was only just ready to start at Ascot, but I felt we had to get two runs into him if he was a Triumph horse. We were going to come straight here, but I thought that wasn't right and he needed more experience. He's the highest class Flat horse I've sent jumping. He's not slow and will have the gears to hold a position at Cheltenham. I loved the way he went away from the last - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tritonic was quite keen with me early and just over racing for the first mile. I had to sit and suffer a bit going up the hill and the eventual runner-up ended up getting quite a stretch on me but I was confident from the turn in I was going to reel in the two in front of me, albeit it was a little harder work that I expected. He showed plenty of grit and determination and I'd say it rode like a fair race. He only missed one hurdle and he was brave up the home straight and I'd say he got the better of a very tough rival - jockey Adrian Heskin.

stable_tour.quote: He stays well on the Flat but I don't think he gets two and a half miles over hurdles; jumping seems to light him up and he almost travels too well. He had a difficult task with 12st in the Silver Trophy at Chepstow, but we're probably going to give him one more run then take him back to Ascot just before Christmas for the big 2m handicap he won three years ago. He retains plenty of ability and seems to have got sharper. 25-10-24

He had a difficult task with 12st in the Silver Trophy at Chepstow anyway but we're probably going to take him back to Ascot just before Christmas for the big 2m handicap he won three years ago. Although he's seven, he retains plenty of ability and seems to have got sharper. He stays well on the Flat but I don't think he gets 2m4f over hurdles - jumping seems to light him up and he almost travels too well. 07-11-24

runners.name: Jabbar
runners.comment: A rare disappointment last time; never better than Dundalk win (2m, Polytrack) time before
runners.spotlight: Last of six when 6-5 favourite at Dundalk in February latest; however, that's almost his only disappointment in more than two years with current connections; never better than for Dundalk win (2m, Polytrack) in February and although there is a bit to prove off his revised mark, he needs respect.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Rated Race
quotes.quote: Jabbar won well. I wondered with the weather would he be fit enough but he clearly was. We won't go back over hurdles until April maybe but we'll stay on the AW until then - Ger O'Leary, trainer.

runners.name: Whos Glen
runners.comment: Progressive on Tapeta (unraced on Polytrack) before two encouraging 1m6f runs on turf
runners.spotlight: Progressive on Tapeta (unraced on Polytrack) before winning by a wide margin at Chester (1m6f, heavy) last September; ran creditably off this 12lb higher mark at York in October, which was good enough for only fifth of seven but he seemed caught out by a steadily run race and showed promise for this longer trip; better looks highly likely moving into just his second season.

runners.name: Youthful King
runners.comment: Some positives but peak AW efforts are at Lingfield and he's never raced beyond 1m4f
runners.spotlight: In good form this time last year, won under Jack Dace last September and has a run under his belt for 2025; however, peak AW efforts have been at Lingfield rather than Kempton and never having raced beyond 1m4f means that plenty of guesswork is required for this 2m race.

runners.name: Kamboo
runners.comment: Dark horse reappearing at 2m but his family and style of Newcastle 2m AW win give hope
runners.spotlight: Won here as 2yo; opened his 2024 campaign in the Derby and a Royal Ascot handicap, before sights were lowered when justifying favouritism in a Racing League handicap at Newcastle (1m4f, Tapeta; 4lb higher today) in August; heavy defeats in major 1m4f turf handicaps on his two subsequent starts, since which he's been gelded and had wind surgery; dark horse reappearing at 2m but his family and style of the Newcastle win give significant hope.

stable_tour.quote: The heavy ground caught him out the other day at Ascot. We were bitterly disappointed because he's a talented horse but doesn't want it firm or too soft. He'll be staying in training next year and he'll be a proper two-miler type. 18-09-24

runners.name: Cool Party
runners.comment: C&D double last autumn; a notch below best last three starts; 1lb below last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Can front-run; completed a double over C&D last autumn; has come up short in his five starts since (three here) and was a notch below his best on last three occasions, but no fitness concerns and he's 1lb below his last winning mark.

runners.name: Alrazeen
runners.comment: Clearcut C&D win in February for hat-trick under L Morris; could bounce back from last run
runners.spotlight: Disappointing favourite five weeks ago, denting his good records both on AW surfaces and at 2m; won his three starts going into that, all under Luke Morris and on third occasion doing so in clearcut fashion over C&D for a career best; 3lb higher today but a player if bouncing straight back.

stable_tour.quote: He'd be my star horse of the lot. I bought him for 8,000gns at the breeze-ups last year. He was a big, backward horse. People think that when you buy a horse at the breeze-ups they're ready to run, but they don't have to run. He won over 1m3f at Southwell in January and 1m4f at Wolverhampton in February, but we're going to drop him back in trip to 1m2f on his next run- in a 0-78 at Newmarket on May 18- because Hayley [Turner], who rode him to his wins, and I both agree we've probably been going a bit too far with him. He's such a big, long-striding horse that you'd think he'd need a trip but he's actually out of a fast mare, and he's by Galileo Gold, who's obviously a miler. I'd like to target him at Royal Ascot but we may be running out of time as it comes around quickly. He'll certainly be an even better four-year-old. 08-05-24

4:25.race_name: Virgin Bet Best Odds Daily/British EBF Conditions Stakes (Colts & Geldings)

runners.name: Glittering Legend
runners.comment: Steadily progressive as 2yo, winning nursery on final start; open to further improvement
runners.spotlight: Steadily progressive in four races as 2yo, signing off with narrow win in four-runner nursery at Doncaster (1m, soft; led over 1f out and did just enough) in October; has to concede weight all round but is open to further improvement this term.

runners.name: Obsidian Dream
runners.comment: Bath scorer last term; faces stiff task on the ratings and would be a surprise winner
runners.spotlight: Won a sprint maiden at Bath last term and finished the campaign with a good fourth in 7f York novice; will probably stay 1m but he faces a stiff task on the ratings and would be a surprise winner on his reappearance.

runners.name: Cavallo Bay
runners.comment: Useful and consistent last term; the pick on form and probably the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Useful and consistent last term, winning twice over 7f and finishing fourth in a US Grade 2 (8.5f) in October; gelded after final start; shaped well on only run at Kempton; the pick on form and probably the one to beat.

quotes.race: ODL Queen Of The North EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Cavallo Bay is learning on the job. He's a big 2yo who's very honest and gallops. The wind is hard up the straight and he's a bit raw, but he tries - Dougie Costello, jockey.

runners.name: Hawksbill
runners.comment: 1m winner as 2yo; good fourth in Listed race next time; may still have untapped potential
runners.spotlight: Sole juvenile win came over 1m at Haydock in August; good fourth in Listed race next time and might have been unsuited by soft ground when well held in Group 2 Royal Lodge at Newmarket final start; may still have untapped potential and must be considered on AW debut/reappearance.

runners.name: Local Lad
runners.comment: Plenty of promise in three 2yo outings; rare British raider for in-form Irish stable
runners.spotlight: 0-3 last term but he showed plenty of promise, finishing fourth in 6f Group 3 on debut and arguably unlucky not to win 1m maiden at Naas on final start; well up to winning races this season and he's a rare British raider for his in-form Irish stable.

3:50.race_name: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places/British EBF Fillies' Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: American Gal
runners.comment: Knuckled down well to finish well on top in 2 AW novice events at about 1m, including here
runners.spotlight: Late foal who is closely related to six winners, two of them very useful; knuckled down well to finish well on top in AW novice events at Kempton (1m) and Wolverhampton (8.6f; at 8-15) in the autumn; something to find on form (giving at least 3lb all round) but she's promising.

runners.name: Bermuda Longtail
runners.comment: 2nd and 1st in novice events here (6f/7f); shapes as if 1m will help with further progress
runners.spotlight: 220,000euros breeze-up buy who ran in two novice events here last October, finishing a close second on first occasion (6f) and fighting off her market rival to make all 19 days later (7f); she shapes as if 1m will help with further progress.

runners.name: Ellaria Sand
runners.owner: B V Sangster, Mrs P Shanahan, Mrs M V Magnier
runners.comment: 7 runs, has best form in this thanks to Newbury Listed win (7f, heavy; 14-1) final start
runners.spotlight: 1,000 Guineas entry; with seven runs, she's seen far more action than these rivals but she brings the best form thanks to her Listed win at Newbury (7f; 14-1) on final start last term; that augurs well for 1m but was registered on heavy ground; this is AW debut.

quotes.race: Highclere Thoroughbred Racing Stakes (Registered As The Radley Stakes) (Listed Race) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: We knew Ellaria Sand would like the ground, so when conditions are like they are then it's a big feather in the cap - Ollie Sangster, trainer.

runners.name: Glittering Surf
runners.comment: 11-8 favourite for C&D maiden (7 ran) in December and made virtually all, hugely on top
runners.spotlight: 100,000gns yearling by Oasis Dream out of once-raced half-sister to 1m4f Group 1 winner Kitesurf; 11-8 favourite for seven-runner maiden over C&D in December and made virtually all, hugely on top through the final 2f; faces much more daunting opposition but that was a striking debut.

runners.name: Qarlyga
runners.comment: Newcastle win (7f, Tapeta) on second start; similar form to most of these and potential
runners.spotlight: Second foal of a 1m and Listed 1m1f winner; starting 11-10 favourite on debut at Newmarket (7f, soft) last October was not reflected in any way in her performance, but she was nevertheless 5-6 for a novice at Newcastle (7f, Tapeta) one month later and came from off the pace to win in tidy fashion; similar form to most of these and, like them, brings potential.

runners.name: Rhapsody
runners.comment: 14-1 for Yarmouth novice (1m, good to soft) in October but passed all of her eight rivals
runners.spotlight: 110,000euros yearling by Ghaiyyath out of Listed-placed 1m4f/12.5f winner; 14-1 for novice at Yarmouth (1m, good to soft) in October but passed all of her eight rivals in the last two and a half furlongs, finishing much the strongest; Irish Oaks entry and further than this will presumably be ideal in due course but she has stacks of potential.

runners.name: Elizabeth Bay
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs B V Sangster & J Chapple-Hyam
runners.comment: Two 6f races; the only maiden in this, with work to do, but she should improve this term
runners.spotlight: Late foal; 7-1 and 3-1 when showing fair form in 6f maidens at Newbury (good) and Yarmouth (good to firm) last summer; she's therefore the only maiden in this field, with work to do, but she should improve this term.

5:00.race_name: Virgin Bet Fives Handicap (London Sprint Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Walbank
runners.comment: Only ran to form in one of four runs in Bahrain this winter; reduced mark back in Britain
runners.spotlight: Placed in Group races at Royal Ascot and Glorious Goodwood as a 2yo; only win since came in Dubai (6f, good; stable debut) in January 2024; he's been in Bahrain this winter, only running to form once; on a reduced mark back in Britain and William Buick booked so can't be discounted, for all he isn't a solid option.

quotes.race: AZIZI Venice (Handicap) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It was actually Kia's [Joorabchian, founder, Amo Racing, owners] plan to have a runner in Dubai and this horse fitted the bill. My team here have done a great job. Walbank had an issue or two as he got fitter but they seem to have been ironed out now. He could go to the Blue Point Sprint or the Listed race over six furlongs - George Boughey, trainer.

quotes.race: Markel Molecomb Stakes (Group 3) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: It was good. I had to do the donkey work on my own side, but I was a step slower away so that didn't help. Walbank has run well and he's a real, true five-furlong horse, he just gets it. He should win his black-type race. I would be disappointed if he doesn't - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Walbank is a proper animal, an absolute bullet. He has a lot of ability but he's still not fully street-wise about racing. He'll come on again for that. He'll have entries in the Norfolk Stakes and Windsor Castle - David Loughnane, trainer.

quotes.race: Jemima Howden Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a good run from Walbank. I knew he was quick but what we've learned today is that he's still a bit of a baby. I think that was a good race today but I'd have no problem coming back up against the winner. We'll look to win our maiden with him next time and then, all being well, come back here in five weeks - David Loughnane, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He came from David Loughnane's, where he had a very good year last year. He was just struggling to find his form for him a little bit. He'd had a little bit of a knee issue as a two-year-old but it's settled down nicely and he's moving well. We've had him gelded and we'll hopefully find him a race before too long. He's quite highly rated so it won't be easy to find him an easy target but he could do with a confidence booster. He's a horse we like. 21-09-23

runners.name: Amazonian Dream
runners.comment: C&D win in December off 1lb lower; solid 3rd when last seen; Oisin Murphy knows him well
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 with a pair of AW wins, the second over C&D off just 1lb lower; solid third at Southwell when last seen in January; wouldn't look any more than averagely handicapped but Oisin Murphy has a good record on him and his presence in the saddle is an obvious plus.

stable_tour.quote: He was a very good two-year-old but unfortunately he got cast one Sunday afternoon and shattered his pin bone. His pin bone is about four inches down his leg and we were lucky not to lose him. If he hadn't done that he'd have been a very good horse, and it's taken a  few years for him to get going again really but he's back in good from again now, winning the sprint qualifier at Windsor last week. He can be difficult to get on in the paddock, but changing the chute at Windsor to a new entrance further around the bend has made it easier for us to mount him, which is why we go back to Windsor as much as we can. He'll run in the sprint final there on August 12 all being well. He was a close fourth in it last year, but he's in better form this year. 11-07-24

runners.name: Cajetan
runners.comment: C&D winner; not at best since emphatic Newcastle win in December but had an excuse latest
runners.spotlight: Looked good when winning over C&D last May and again when winning by a wide margin at Newcastle in December; the latter performance saw him clobbered by the handicapper and he has finished well held twice since; wouldn't judge him too harshly on latest run though as those held up were seriously inconvenienced; stable won this race last year.

stable_tour.quote: He was 2-2 on the all-weather in the spring, winning at Newcastle and Kempton. He then had a few issues this summer, so he only started his winter campaign on Saturday at Ascot, where he finished eighth behind Alcazan on his first run since May. He'll now go on to the all-weather for the winter. I really like him and I've made him my trainer's pick for the next few months. 10-10-24

runners.name: Aramram
runners.comment: On the up last autumn before a poor run on heavy; has the potential for better this year
runners.spotlight: Got stuck in the Newbury mud when last seen in October but he'd been in fine form beforehand, winning 6f handicaps at Doncaster and Wolverhampton either side of a good second in the Ayr Silver Cup; still has the potential for better and rider's claim useful too.

runners.name: Al Barez
runners.comment: C&D winner who goes well fresh and is on a winning mark; stall 12 the main concern
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; back to his last winning mark and he has a good record fresh; he'll need to be at his best if he is to defy the widest stall though.

quotes.race: Read Harry Cobden's Blog At Planet Sport Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Al Barez was push-button to ride and I loved his attitude. He didn't win very far but I probably got there early enough because the pace collapsed - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Best Odds Daily Handicap (London Sprint Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Jack did well from that draw and it's nice to get a win on the board. The turf season is around the corner so I hope Al Barez is shaping up well for some nice handicaps this summer. He's still quite an unexposed horse and has a lovely pedigree - Tom Clover, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A relatively lightly raced colt who was a smart two-year-old, winning two of his three races before a brief campaign last year when he won his only start. He underwent wind surgery after that and it was just under a year (361 days) later that he returned to action when a good fourth at Newmarket. He is a lovely horse and I feel if we can unlock the key to him he could progress from where he is. He has a lovely pedigree and I would be surprised if he did not go on from here. 06-07-23

runners.name: Rohaan

prev_owners.owner: Chris Kiely Racing Ltd & J Tomkins

runners.comment: Retains ability and finished 2nd on latest run; he'll need a good pace around here though
runners.spotlight: Not the force of old and his losing run stands at 17; runner-up twice at Southwell in recent weeks but that course perhaps more suitable for him than this one; sure to be popular but he'll need them to go hard early.

quotes.race: Ascot Iron Stand Handicap
quotes.quote: It's great to get Rohaan back. I was under a bit of pressure today because I told his owners he was on his way back and they've come over from Ireland, so it's great. He's a horse of a lifetime for me and he'll come back here for the Group 1 on Champions Day. He finished fourth last year so we might as well have a go - David Evans, trainer.

quotes.race: John Guest Racing Bengough Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Rohaan loves Ascot and loves cut in the ground and I hope he'll come back for Champions Day - Adam Kirby, rider.

quotes.race: Wokingham Stakes (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Rohaan fell on the gallops and we thought his career was over. He bombed out at York but David got him back to his best. This horse was done in March but he has just won on the bridle - Chris Kelly, joint-owner.

quotes.race: Wokingham Stakes (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Rohaan is a serious horse, but now he's being taken seriously. He's so easy to train and it's great having a nice horse. I was confident, but you never know what the draw is going to do and where the action will be. It wasn't the ideal race for him, but it's worked out well - David Evans, trainer.  It took Rohaan a while to warm up and get going and I was a little bit worried initially but the further he went the better he was and he won well in the end - Shane Kelly, jockey.

quotes.race: Casumo Bet10Get10 Sandy Lane Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: I don't know why Rohaan was such a big price as the form was there. He's a class horse but nobody seems to realise it, though, and he goes on any ground. As a gelding he's not qualified for the Commonwealth Cup. He'll get a penalty for the Wokingham and there's the Jersey over seven furlongs, but I don't really know. - David Evans, trainer

quotes.race: Qipco British Champions Series horseracinghof.com Pavilion Stakes (Commonwealth Cup Trial) (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Rohaan is a nice horse and Dave has done very well with him. I think a level track helps him. He's been in great form all year and has a super attitude. He's a very honest horse with a good turn of foot. Fair play to Dave and the owners for putting him in here and they got their just rewards - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Watch Racing Online For Free Handicap
quotes.quote: Rohaan has done well to win from his draw but I got a nice tow into the race and he finished off well in the straight - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Get Your Ladbrokes Daily Odds Boost Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I was at the sales and had a look at Rohaan because I trained his half-brother Dougan. He's got size and scope and you can't fault him really. I've heard he had wind issues but I haven't found a problem and he's now won on three different tracks, one straight and stiff, one right handed and now one left handed. I'm pretty sure he'll go on improving for a while, and I think he'll be fine on grass, but I'm going to take it steady - David Evans, trainer.

runners.name: Change Sings
runners.comment: Flawless record at the track but absent for 293 days and he'll need a career best to win
runners.spotlight: 3-3 at Kempton, the latest win coming off 3lb lower last May; absent since a low-key run at Goodwood 293 days ago; career best required.

runners.name: Ararat
runners.comment: Three 7f wins for D Simcock; sold 35,000gns last October; tricky draw for prominent racer
runners.spotlight: Most of his racing for David Simcock (including his three wins) was at 7f and he was no match for Aramram over this trip at Wolverhampton last October; sold for 35,000gns later that month and new yard likely to find the key to him sooner rather than later; not ideally drawn for a prominent racer.

quotes.race: Turners Handicap
quotes.quote: Ararat is a talented horse who has underachieved but he's capable on his day - David Simcock, trainer

quotes.race: Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: Ararat has promised to win in the past so it was nice he could get his head in front. We've tried him on soft ground as he's German-bred, but he likes it quicker-Bruce Raymond, owner's racing manager.

stable_tour.quote: He's been an underachiever. He's always been talented but lets us down more times than not. He looked very good and produced a very good time figure at Chelmsford. That was a nice prize. We'll look to run him on fast ground or on the all-weather between now and the end of the season. He's entered at Ascot on Friday, a seven-furlong classified race, so he might go there. 04-09-24

runners.name: Tiger Crusade
runners.comment: Retains ability but might find some of his younger rivals having his measure this time
runners.spotlight: 4lb higher than for his Wolverhampton win in January; in and out since and others make more appeal for win purposes.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: Tiger Crusade has a lower mark on turf as he has not won for a long time but he stays seven furlongs and on that slightly tacky ground he was always going to finish off six furlongs well. He has been running on quicker ground on the turf, but I think he likes to get his toe in a little bit. That trip today on that ground was perfect for him - Bryan Payne, part owner.

stable_tour.quote: He's in great form and has come down the weights. I think he's ready to win as he's in that sort of area. He's another No Nay Never who enjoys the synthetics, but he's very capable on turf. He could finish only a never-dangerous sixth at Goodwood on Tuesday following a slow start. 04-09-24

runners.name: Monsieur Beaulieu
runners.comment: Two Lingfield wins at a lower level this winter; in good form but no margin for error
runners.spotlight: Two Lingfield wins at a lower level this winter and he has performed with credit since the last of them; whether he is well enough treated for a race of this nature is a moot point though.

quotes.race: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap
quotes.quote: The only slight worry was that Monsieur Beaulieu jumped the gates really good and I was just looking for a bit of cover, so I'm just thinking we're dependent on Ross [Coakley, jockey] there but he did everything right - apart from win a bit too far! - Nick Littmoden, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Habooba
runners.breeder: T Frederick, C Frederick & C Potter
runners.comment: Progressive last year and conditions suit; had an excuse on her return; not fully exposed
runners.spotlight: Progressive last year, winning twice on AW (once over C&D) and ending that campaign with two solid placed efforts; not at her best at Wolverhampton on her return to action three weeks ago but there were mitigating circumstances (drawn 3 but got involved in a tussle for the lead with stalls 1 and 2 and ended up a bit wide); shouldn't find it so difficult to dominate this time and she remains capable of better.

runners.name: Harry Did
runners.comment: Made all to win at Newcastle (6f; form franked) this month; good mark but up two grades
runners.spotlight: A switch to front-running saw him gain his first handicap success at Newcastle 25 days ago (6f), form boosted by the two subsequent wins of the runner-up; a 3lb rise still leaves him feasibly treated but it won't be so easy dominating in this higher grade.

quotes.race: Dennis Barnett 80th Birthday EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Harry Did is a nice big horse.  There was a lot of leg changing over the first 2f going downhill, but he finished off well.  He'd prefer a generous, level course, which might be why he got a bit lost on the undulations at Newmarket last time - Trevor Whelan, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Arqoob
runners.comment: Last Flat win 2022 but beaten a nose over C&D on latest outing, coming from last of seven
runners.spotlight: Placed on the first and latest of his four starts back on the Flat this year (stayed hurdling in 2024); his last Flat win was in 2022 but he went down by a nose over C&D on latest outing, coming from last of seven, so returns to calculations despite going back up 3lb.

quotes.race: Sri Lanka - The Jewel Of Asia Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I was a bit surprised Arqoob went off favourite. We thought he had an each-way shout, but it is tough out there as the ground is testing. He was probably not in love with it, but he does like that hill. Bryony just waited a bit longer than normal and I think that was pretty key. He winged the last and that really sealed it. He is so consistent that you could set your watch by him. We will go home and look what there is for him, but I suppose we might be thinking about the Imperial Cup later in the season if we get his rating high enough - Lucy Wadham, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was second last time at Kempton in a photo-finish, but we're still arguing about that and have asked them to look at the photograph again. They've agreed to do that. He has enjoyed being back on the Flat. We haven't ruled out running him over hurdles again when the spring ground arrives, so he's probably going to mix and match a bit. He's been running consistently in quite high-class Flat races, but he's been hard to win with and so it was slightly difficult what happened last time, even though I was pleased he ran so well. 19-03-25

runners.name: Knockbrex
runners.comment: Won at Lingfield (1m4f) in January off 4lb lower; ran respectably last two completions
runners.spotlight: Unraced here but won at Lingfield (1m4f, Polytrack) in January off 4lb lower; ran respectably last two completions (unseated leaving the stalls on latest outing) and has a place chance.

runners.name: Java Raja
runners.comment: Wandered and carried head awkwardly when 3rd at Southwell (Sugar Road 2nd) five weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Poor on soft on debut last October but asserted in good style in a Wolverhampton maiden in December and backed up the form when third at Southwell (Sugar Road second) five weeks ago; tongue tied for those last two starts, over 1m4f on Tapeta; blinkers are added today after he wandered and carried his head awkwardly under pressure last time, which complicates the picture on this handicap debut.

runners.name: Midnight Rumble
runners.owner: Lets Get Ready To Rumble Partnership
runners.comment: Unraced beyond 1m2f on Flat; 0-4 over hurdles in December-March
runners.spotlight: Won at Lingfield (Polytrack) last June on the last of his three AW outings and twice runner-up on turf later last summer; all those were at 1m2f and he's unraced beyond that on Flat; 0-4 over hurdles in December-March but may be more interesting back in this sphere.

stable_tour.quote: He's shown useful form on the Flat and won twice. He wasn't as fit as I thought he was last time and I'd like to give him another run on the Flat then switch him to hurdles but unfortunately he's had a little hold-up with an infected sinus. He's shown useful form on the Flat and won twice. 07-11-24

runners.name: Sugar Road
runners.comment: Placed in two Southwell novices and could bring potential to this handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Three starts last summer, notably third in 1m3f novice at Southwell (1m3f, Tapeta); put in his place by the winner when 5-4 favourite in another novice there (1m4f) five weeks ago after a six-month break, but beat the rest (Java Raja third) and could still bring potential to this handicap debut.

runners.name: Civil Law
runners.comment: Continues back down the weights but has never finished better than 4th in six starts here
runners.spotlight: All six AW wins were on Tapeta, five at Wolverhampton, and he last scored in November 2023; continues back down the weights but has never finished better than fourth in six starts here and others have more pressing claims.

quotes.race: Churchill Tyres Handicap
quotes.quote: Civil Law is in the Queen Mother Cup at York tomorrow and we'll see how he is. He's not blowing there and it's a 15,000GBP race. He could have done with a better gallop. Ben said they probably didn't go quick enough for him - Brian Ellison, trainer

runners.name: Billiegee
runners.comment: Two backward steps in the mud should probably be forgiven and she needs a market check
runners.spotlight: Placed in her two starts here (won a maiden on Tapeta); won two small-field handicaps over 1m4f on turf last summer before two backward steps in the mud; those should probably be forgiven and she needs a market check.

stable_tour.quote: When you think of Waldgeist, the sire of this filly, you think of stamina and a strong European pedigree, but this filly is far more precocious than I would have expected. We will take our time with her, and I expect her to start off over 7f by mid-summer, but it will be interesting to see how she does being by such an exciting stallion. 29-03-23

runners.name: Party Island
runners.comment: Wolverhampton run three weeks ago was encouraging and he has each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Racked up the Polytrack wins (two here) in his time and he ended something of a drought with wins last May and July; Wolverhampton run three weeks ago was encouraging and he has each-way chance.

runners.name: Enthused
runners.comment: Behind in two races back on Flat, admittedly over just 7f and 8.6f; tongue tied first time
runners.spotlight: No Flat win since June 2022, with plenty of hurdling success in the meantime but he lost his form in that sphere last October/November; behind in two races back on Flat this month, admittedly over just 7f and 8.6f but connections also now have him tongue tied for the first time.

quotes.race: Friends & Family Remembering Norman Sharpe Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I thought the ground would be on the soft side for Enthused as he likes it rattling but fair play to him and he only ran on the Flat a week ago. Alex Chadwick, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Welcome Back To Ludlow Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It's amazing, you can't top it. I had Enthused in my hands the whole way and his jumping is perfect. He doesn't get much height but he's very quick and he took me to the front and off we went - Jamie Gambin, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Enthused ran well at Fakenham but got trapped on the inside when they had taken the last hurdle out and he was unlucky. He was given a great ride from Alex Chadwick and will run next at Fakenham's final meeting of the year next month - James Owen, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's owned by good friends of mine, the butcher Michael Clarke and the farmer George Wright, and he's a lovely little horse who cost me£5,500 this time last year. He's run 17 times since then, won five times and earned just under£45,000. He's ultra-consistent but very ground-dependent; he needs top of the ground. We probably shouldn't have run him at Cheltenham last time when the rain came. He had a history of breaking blood vessels but I hope we've sorted that out we turn the horses out a lot and he's gained confidence. He's having a break and will be back in the spring. Two miles is his trip. 06-12-23

runners.name: Aiming High
runners.comment: Back up 4lb but did it smoothly at Wolverhampton last week and has each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Has popped up in front where it matters once in each of the last four years, doing so last June over C&D and last Saturday over 1m4f at Wolverhampton; back up 4lb today but did it smoothly last week and has each-way claims despite the step back up in class.

stable_tour.quote: She loves the all-weather and is due to run this week at Kempton on Wednesday. She loves fast ground and accumulates prize-money in her own little way. She's found out as soon as she hits a mark of 80 but while she's in the 70s she's competitive. 04-09-24

8:00.race_name: £30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap

runners.name: Twelfth Knight
runners.comment: Struggled on the whole in 2024 but on a dangerous mark if a wind op has the desired effect
runners.spotlight: Struggled last year but a consequence of that is that he starts this campaign off a 21lb lower mark; has undergone wind surgery since last seen and he's an intriguing contender at this level; betting instructive.

quotes.race: Dr Keith Howard OBE Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Everything was very straightforward. They went very hard early doors and dropping back in grade, Twelfth Knight just needed a bit of confidence more than anything. He's been running in better races and he's been a bit heartbroken a few times but he's a decent enough animal and hopefully he can progress. To be fair to him, when I needed him today he stuck it out. We were off the bridle early but he always stays the five furlongs well. I'm delighted for the owners and Paul - Ryan Sexton, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Brian The Snail
runners.owner: The Brian The Snail Racing Club
runners.comment: Claims on this winter's best but he can lose his chance at the start
runners.spotlight: Retains lots of enthusiasm despite his advanced years, winning over 5f here in December and second at Wolverhampton (6f) last month; needs to leave two lesser efforts (slowly away) behind him.

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail is an old boy who knows the game. Sometimes he breaks out a bit slow - like he's done today - but he thrives being hung onto and it's paid off - Ryan Kavanagh, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Unibet 3 Uniboosts A Day Handicap
quotes.quote: We got a good tow and Brian The Snail battled all the way to the line. On his day he is very good and proved that tonight - Jack Garrity, jockey

quotes.race: Heed Your Hunch At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail is a horse with a lot of ability, but he only ever does it every now and again. His work at home is better than what he shows in the afternoon, but when he puts his best foot forward he's a nice horse - Tony Hamilton, jockey.

quotes.race: Owlerton Greyhound Stadium Sheffield Handicap
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail had a wind operation during the winter but his first run back was inconclusive as he didn't handle the track at Epsom. He might get into the Wokingham now - Robin O'Ryan, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Westow Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: That was too bad to be true, Brian The Snail never ran a race - Richard Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing UK Anywhere Available Now Handicap
quotes.quote: I was delighted with that. Brian The Snail is quite chunky so we wanted to get a run into him. I've made no secret, we do like him and there is a race at Ascot on May 3 for three-year-olds for him. We have the Commonwealth Cup in mind - Richard Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: catterickbridge.co.uk Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail is a good horse. I was a bit worried about the trip -  5f on a sharp track like this - but he's done it well. He'll be a sprinter - Tony Hamilton, jockey.

quotes.race: Book Your 17th October totepool Package Median Auction Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail is a grand, laid back horse and it took Tony (Hamilton) a while to pull him up there. He had done everything very easily at home and he had a really good blow so he will come on plenty for that. He is a horse we like a lot and it will be a surprise if he doesn't go on to better things - Robin O'Ryan, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Lady Celia

prev_owners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd

runners.comment: C&D winner who can go well fresh; not much room for error off current mark though
runners.spotlight: C&D winner but better known for her 5f exploits; has run well after a break in the past but she is taking on some match-fit opponents and isn't that far ahead of her mark.

quotes.race: Hampton By Hilton Hamilton Park Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Lady Celia loves it here but the key to her is the ground and Archie [Young] gave her a marvellous ride. She's also won over six furlongs and on all-weather and she's thriving at the moment - Alan Brown, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Tomorrow Day
runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.spotlight: Non-runner.

runners.name: Kings Crown
runners.comment: Comes here in good form and eased in grade today; others still more appealing for the win
runners.spotlight: In good form this year and this is weaker than the races he has tackled the last twice; others more appealing for win purposes all the same.

stable_tour.quote: We got him earlier this season from Adrian Nicholls. He was highly tried at two and three and has now dropped to what is a good handicap mark. He started the season on 72 and is down to 62 now. When he puts it together I can't believe he won't be winning soon. He'd be my dark horse. 28-08-24

runners.name: Oriental Prince
runners.comment: Progressive sprinter; gained first 6f win at Southwell two weeks ago; high on the list
runners.spotlight: The winner of four of his last six starts and this month's Southwell win was his first at this trip; still improving and he's a key player despite a 4lb rise.

stable_tour.quote: He's a homebred and we're hoping maybe he'll do what Eternal Sunshine has done. He's matured a lot and I've given him time. He's had four runs and we'll probably give him a few runs on the all-weather, but I don't think we'll have a hard campaign with him. We'll see how he progresses but he should be a nice horse to follow next year. I hate to saddle him with it but he'd be my dark horse. 02-10-24

runners.name: Just Ten High
runners.comment: Rare blip at Chelmsford last time but earlier C&D 2nds bring him right into the reckoning
runners.spotlight: Good run of form came to an end at Chelmsford 16 days ago; prior to that he had finished second over C&D twice last month and a return to form wouldn't be a big shock.

runners.name: Sir Maxi
runners.comment: Two wins in amateur races this year, including C&D; needs a good pace at the trip
runners.spotlight: This year's two AW wins (one over C&D) have come in amateur races when ridden by top riders; 4lb rise for latest Chelmsford success shouldn't handicap him out of things but he needs a good pace at 6f.

quotes.race: Betway Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Sir Maxi has been doing everything lovely at home, he does tend to be a small bit keen and he was kind of hanging out around the bends because he's trying to pull too hard and go too quick for himself. As soon as they turned in I just needed him to switch onto that right lead and as soon as he did he quickened away nicely. All he's done this year is only a bonus for what he could be next year, we've always looked at him as being a three-year-old - Rossa Ryan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Jimmy Knocker
runners.comment: Beat Oriental Prince over C&D in January and 7lb better off today; gone backwards since
runners.spotlight: Got the better of Oriental Prince over C&D in January and he is 7lb better off with that rival today; he hasn't progressed since then, however, and now has plenty to prove.

runners.name: Bellagio Man
runners.comment: Conditions to suit and on a feasible mark; none too consistent but the return to 6f a +
runners.spotlight: C&D win off 1lb lower in December; in and out since but return to 6f is in his favour and he's capable of a good run granted a pace to aim at.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Maiden (Plus 10 Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: It was a good performance and Bellagio Man had to be brave. He had a terrible draw but it helped that the favourite got stuck in the stalls. Fair play to Colin and the horse as they took advantage of that. He's still a green horse and will improve from it. He was in front a long way from home and it was a fair performance. He wouldn't ideally like that ground, it went a bit slow, and we were a bit nervous before the race with the heavy showers yesterday and today. He's a good ground horse but because it was the first race we said we'd take our chance and we got away with it - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Match Play
runners.comment: Eyecatching run over 5f here last month; step up to 6f hasn't helped the last twice
runners.spotlight: Eyecatching run over 5f here last month but the step up to 6f hasn't helped the last twice; needs to settle better if he is to come out on top.

stable_tour.quote: I was delighted with him at Leicester, he came home well and will step up to six furlongs at York. 10-05-22

runners.name: Nazca
runners.comment: Conditions to suit but little to shout about since his C&D win one year ago
runners.spotlight: C&D win last March came off 3lb higher but there has been little to shout about since; stable hold stronger claims with Pockley.

runners.name: Pockley
runners.owner: William Burns & Miss L A Perratt
runners.comment: Has his quirks but he comes here at the top of his game; should be involved again
runners.spotlight: Has his quirks but he's not done a great deal wrong this year, winning three times in Class 6 company; should remain competitive despite the slightly stronger opposition.

5:30.race_name: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Urban Road
runners.owner: S Mcmillan, F Reay & A D Brown

prev_owners.owner: D D Oakes & A D Brown

runners.comment: Record of 14442311123 since December features two C&D wins; solid contender
runners.spotlight: Record of 14442311123 since December features two C&D wins; on a career-high mark but still looks a solid contender back here.

quotes.race: Hull FC Rugby League Takeover Day Handicap
quotes.quote: The pace of the race didn't suit him last time. Urban Road is improving, the penny has only just dropped with him - Alan Brown, trainer.

runners.name: Midnight Lion
runners.comment: Has form figures of 11143231, all at Newcastle, for current yard; major claims
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 11143231, all at Newcastle, for current yard; made all in C&D event under Lauren Young last week; major claims.

quotes.race: Gamble Responsibly At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Midnight Lion loves it round here and is thriving at the minute. He's very straightforward - he wings the gates, he doesn't pull in front and when you get stuck into him he really keeps finding - Paul Mulrennan, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: We were hoping Midnight Lion would run like that as Paul [Mulrennan, jockey] had won on him over the course and distance. He developed a sinus problem and he's been on antibiotics so we were a bit negative about his chances.
