Fortunately he won, but he probably needs a tooth out, so it was quite impressive - Jim Goldie, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Newcastle in April and we gave him a second run over hurdles at Huntingdon but he needs top of the ground and the rain got in there and spoiled his chance. He got a knock there but he's back on the go. He's probably more effective on the Flat, at 1m2f or 1m4f. 26-07-24

runners.name: Up The Jazz
runners.comment: Lacks recent match practice and is still seeking first win in this grade
runners.spotlight: Lacks recent match practice and is still seeking first success in this grade (all wins in Class 5); not the percentage call.

runners.name: The Dancing Poet
runners.comment: Has far better strike-rate on turf than on AW
runners.spotlight: Lacks recent match practice and has a far better strike-rate on turf than on AW; gained only success in this sphere in 2019.

quotes.race: National Racehorse Week Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: He's fantastic, he loves it round here. This is his level; perfect. The Dancing Poet is nine years old now but he seems to be getting better with age - Matt Brown, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: weatherbysshop.co.uk Handicap
quotes.quote: The Dancing Poet is a big galloping horse but he likes sharp tracks. He's one-paced but he felt unreal today. He quickened up really well off a steady pace. I was always in the driving seat to kick on and he won nicely in the end - Ben Robinson, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Mr Mistoffelees
runners.comment: Has been shaping well at Southwell for new yard; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Has been shaping well at Southwell (1m) for new yard, leaving the impression this return to 1m2f is worth exploring; shortlisted.

stable_tour.quote: He is a nice handicapper but unfortunately his current mark of 92 is way above where he should be. Having won a mile maiden just before Christmas it was decided to give him a run in one of the Guineas trials (Craven Stakes), where he ran okay but was around eight lengths off the winner. The handicapper then gave us a mark of 92 which is clearly far too high, but I realise they are only doing their job. Clearly horses are penalised for running in races like that as he is now on a very harsh mark, whereas if we had gone for a handicap instead of the Craven he would have been thrown in off 81. They are keen to encourage horses to run in the better races and help nurture good-sized fields but if the price is an 11lb hike then the incentive is not there, and I think they need a re-think and should consider a more considerate approach to horses like Mr Mistoffelees. 17-05-23

runners.name: Federated
runners.comment: Record of 1121 since upped to middle distances; open to further progress
runners.spotlight: Record of 1121 since upped to middle distances, scoring comfortably at Newcastle most recently; highly respected with further progress plausible.

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap
quotes.quote: It was like a piece of work to be honest. The front horse went off and I had something to aim at, I picked him up well and Federated has done it nicely - Oisin Orr, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Without Compromise
runners.comment: The only maiden (0-8) in this field but has largely consistent form
runners.spotlight: The only maiden (0-8) in this field but has largely consistent form and could go well off bottom weight.

8:30.race_name: Weekly Free Bets With BetMGM Extra Handicap

runners.name: Starliner
runners.owner: David Orr & Miss L A Perratt
runners.comment: Made all to win over C&D in November off 1lb lower; in and out since but he's capable
runners.spotlight: Made most when winning over C&D in November off 1lb lower; up and down since but he's capable at this level if the mood takes him.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Starliner has been running with credit. We thought he had a chance but he had to do the hard work on his own which leaves you vulnerable. He was good and tough - Gavin Ryan, rider.

runners.name: Streak Lightning

prev_owners.owner: Grange Park Racing Club And Ruth Carr

runners.comment: Conditions to suit and won well over C&D last month; never dangerous last time
runners.spotlight: His last three wins have come over C&D and the latest was an easy one last month; never threatened off this mark here three weeks ago but he's an each-way contender.

runners.name: Roaring Ralph
runners.comment: Knocking at the door over 6f here and all his wins have come at 7f+; leading contender
runners.spotlight: Two good runs over 6f here this year, beaten 1l into third 25 days ago (runner-up won twice since); races off the same mark and the return to 7f will suit; leading contender.

runners.name: Kings School
runners.comment: Two C&D wins in December & well treated on that evidence; disappointed when backed latest
runners.spotlight: Two C&D wins in December and he's well treated if he can return to that level; disappointed here three weeks ago, however, in a race in which he was backed into favouritism.

stable_tour.quote: A lightly raced Middleham Park three-year-old who came from David Simcock. We'll probably come back to a mile and a quarter with him to start with and go from there. We're just getting him back to peak fitness at the moment. He'll be out in around three weeks, but we're really liking him at home. 23-05-24

runners.name: Rebeccas Girl
runners.comment: String of good course runs this winter, winning three; still improving; high on the list
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who has turned in a string of good course runs since November, winning three times; latest second (6f) represented further improvement; another 2lb higher but set to go well again.

runners.name: Blufferonthebus
runners.comment: Well beaten on her recent return to action; others bring stronger claims
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 with a couple of good runs in slow-ground plating events; well-beaten 40-1 shot on her return to action at Southwell two weeks ago; others bring stronger claims.

runners.name: Cusack
runners.comment: Two course wins this year, the latest over this trip last week; needs more up 2lb
runners.spotlight: The drop back to 7f paid dividends when he recorded a game C&D win last week, his second course win of the year, but up 2lb and not an obvious candidate to follow up.

runners.name: Tomorrow Day
runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.spotlight: Non-runner.

runners.name: Wyvern
runners.owner: Pat Morris And Clear Cut Racing
runners.comment: Second here over 1m on Tuesday; would make more appeal at that trip than today's
runners.spotlight: Several good course runs this winter, albeit mainly at 1m; near miss over that trip on Tuesday but others appeal more over today's distance.

runners.name: War Howl
runners.breeder: G H S Bloodstock & J C Bloodstock
runners.comment: Huge chance if reproducing August's Newmarket third on his stable debut
runners.spotlight: Standout effort for Brian Meehan as a 2yo came when third to the subsequent Dewhurst winner at Newmarket last August (front three clear); possible to excuse both nursery runs (caught wide on first occasion and soft ground on the second) and he's been dropped 5lb for them; sold for 20,000gns in October; interesting contender on stable debut.

runners.name: Hot To Dot
runners.comment: 5f novice winner; ended 2024 with two 2nds in 7f AW nurseries; 4lb higher back from break
runners.spotlight: Made a winning debut last April (5f, soft) and ended her 2yo campaign with two second-place finishes in 7f Tapeta nurseries; returns from a break off a 4lb higher mark but she's not fully exposed.

quotes.race: Northern Commercials New Iveco 2024 Model Year EBF Rest' Novice (Bands C/D)(EBF Qual')(GBB/IRE Inc')
quotes.quote: I'm really pleased with Hot To Dot's performance and I thought Connor (Beasley) gave her a great ride. We thought we had something but you don't always know what everyone else has until you turn up. Other horses may have done a bit more than her, so hopefully there's plenty more to come. We were confident she'd like the ground and hopefully we can aim for bigger and better things now - Gemma Tutty, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She won at Pontefract at 16-1 in April when she did everything right. She was entered in the Marygate at York but a small niggle ruled her out and she could well go straight to the Albany at Royal Ascot. It might be a bit of a stretch but she looks like she's open to progress, so why not? If nothing else, it would be a great experience for her. We won't know just how much improvement she has in her until we roll the dice. 23-05-24

runners.name: Tuco Salamanca
runners.comment: 2-2 since a wind op; 3lb rise for latest win looks fair; leading claims in hat-trick bid
runners.spotlight: Had a wind operation in November and he has shown the benefit with two wins this year, a 7f maiden at Kempton and then a handicap success at Wolverhampton (Sorbus third) where he was value for more than the winning margin; drop back in trip no problem and a 3lb rise looks fair; leading claims.

runners.name: Saxonia
runners.comment: Improved for a gelding operation; conditions no problem and should be involved again
runners.spotlight: He has improved for a gelding operation, getting off the mark in a 1m maiden here last month and close up in Tapeta handicaps either side of it; should run his race once again.

runners.name: Sorbus
runners.comment: 1m maiden win for E Walker in Jan; third to Tuco Salamanca latest; 4lb better off; chance
runners.spotlight: 1m Kempton win in January (second start; sold out of Ed Walker's stable for 60,000gns soon after); low-key stable/handicap debut at Southwell last month but there was more promise in her third behind the reopposing Tuco Salamanca two weeks ago (8.6f); 4lb better off today but it might not be enough to turn the tables.

runners.name: Suzette
runners.comment: 7f win on her nursery debut last summer; struggled in better races after; AW debut
runners.spotlight: Good step forward when making a winning nursery debut at Carlisle last August (7f, soft); beaten twice in stronger company afterwards but she returns to action off a feasible mark; others appeal more for win purposes.

runners.name: Blueandtangerine
runners.comment: Turf winner as a 2yo and this is weaker than last assignment; needs a career best though
runners.spotlight: Seven runs as a 2yo, all on turf, included a Beverley maiden win and a fair fourth on her nursery debut; came up shy in a stronger race at York when last seen in October; career best required back from a break.

runners.name: Tarlac
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And Partner
runners.comment: Two quiet 6f runs for current yard; down in weights, up in trip and Paul Mulrennan booked
runners.spotlight: Down the field in two 6f handicap runs for current stable; down in the weights, back up to 7f and Paul Mulrennan booked so possible a better effort could be forthcoming.

runners.name: Bad Habits
runners.comment: Runner-up on final start for G Boughey in Jan but barely beaten a rival for current stable
runners.spotlight: Finished second of nine at Wolverhampton in January (first-time blinkers; final run for George Boughey) but he's beaten just one home in three runs for current stable; plenty to prove.

6:00.race_name: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Arkinthestars
runners.comment: May do better with Southwell reappearance under her belt; has form at this course
runners.spotlight: Promise last September included third-place finish at Newcastle (7f); below par at Southwell (1m) on reappearance but may do better with that outing under her belt; related to two middle-distance winners.

runners.name: Bayenah
runners.comment: Steadily got the hang of things last year; could well take another step forward
runners.spotlight: Major connections; steadily got the hang of things last year, keeping-on third at Doncaster (1m) final start; bred to be suited by this longer trip and could well take another step forward; leading player.

runners.name: Cecilia Star
runners.comment: 135,000gns foal, 150,000gns yearling; by Sea The Stars; sole newcomer in the field
runners.spotlight: 135,000gns foal, 150,000gns yearling; by Sea The Stars out of an Italian 5f-6f winner (including Listed; RPR 100); sole newcomer in the field; heed the market signals.

runners.name: Ghaiyya
runners.comment: Open to improvement this season; related to several winners for the Johnston yard
runners.spotlight: Related to several winners (two smart) for the Johnston yard; duly showed ability (at up to 8.5f) last term and is open to improvement this season; bred to relish this step up in distance; respected.

runners.name: Storm Kitty
runners.comment: Last of six in 7f maiden here but attracted support and may improve
runners.spotlight: Brings the worst form, having finished last of six in 7f maiden here this month; however, attracted support and is evidently thought capable of better; keep an eye on the betting.

7:00.race_name: Weekly Free Bets With BetMGM Extra Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Callianassa
runners.comment: 0-24 but she ran right up to her best when second in a Class 2 handicap latest; respected
runners.spotlight: Record of 0-24 but she ran right up to her best when second in a Class 2 handicap at Lingfield (7f, Polytrack; RPR 77) last month; should go well again back in a maiden and she has plenty of form at this track.

runners.name: College Fund
runners.comment: 170,000euros yearling; plenty to like on paper and he's an interesting newcomer
runners.spotlight: 170,000euros yearling; fourth foal; half-brother to winners Betterdaysrcoming (7f; RPR 97) and Breathless Spirit (1m4f AW; 86); dam Group-placed 7f 2yo/1m3f winner (100), half-sister to Listed-placed 7f/1m winner Tobosa; interesting newcomer and he needs watching in market.

runners.name: Frankini
runners.comment: Reached the frame in two 2yo runs, with RPR of 77 on both occasions; respected on return
runners.spotlight: Reached the frame in two 7f soft-ground maidens in September and his latest third at Newmarket was behind an impressive winner who ran respectably in a Group 1 next time; both pieces of form put him firmly in the picture and he's respected on return.

runners.name: Golden Harmony
runners.breeder: E A R L Qatar Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: Struggled at big prices in two 6f runs last season and has stacks to find on his return
runners.spotlight: Struggled at big prices in two 6f runs last season and has stacks to find upped in trip on his return.

runners.name: Hurricane Bea
runners.comment: Always behind when last of nine runners in a 6f novice at Redcar (good to firm) last June
runners.spotlight: Always behind when last of nine runners in a 6f novice at Redcar (good to firm; 40-1) last June; opposable on return.

stable_tour.quote: We got him at the breeze-up sales. He's had only one run, at Redcar, where he missed the break slightly and just needed a bit further. That was over 6f but he's in the 7f Convivial Maiden at York on Friday. 22-08-24

runners.name: La Botte
runners.comment: 280,000euros (breeze-up) 2yo; eyecatching third at Kempton and needs close look on return
runners.spotlight: 280,000euros (breeze-up) 2yo; 50-1 for Kempton debut (7f, Polytrack) in October but he made some striking late headway into third and that was behind a useful rival; should be more streetwise this time and he needs a close look on his return.

runners.name: Lights Go Down
runners.breeder: J Blackburn, S Winter & H Cram
runners.comment: Has fair standard to aim at on debut and likely best watched
runners.spotlight: Gelded son of Postponed; third foal; dam unraced sister to Australian 7.5f Group 3 winner Havana Cooler; has fair standard to aim at on debut and likely best watched.

runners.name: Obito
runners.comment: 150,000gns (breeze-up) 2yo; hood is applied on debut but he needs checking in market
runners.spotlight: 125,000gns foal, 130,000gns yearling, 150,000gns (breeze-up) 2yo; seventh foal; half-brother to 8.6f AW winner Timespan (RPR 81); dam 8.6f AW winner (71), sister to winners Passage Of Time (1m2f 2yo Group 1) and Father Time (1m4f Group 2); been gelded and hood is applied on debut but he needs checking in market.

runners.name: Promise Time
runners.comment: Tailed off at massive prices in two 7f runs in the autumn including over C&D
runners.spotlight: Tailed off at massive prices in two 7f runs in the autumn including over C&D.

runners.name: Grizzieblanca
runners.owner: Nick Bradley Racing 51 & Mrs E Burke
runners.comment: Didn't show a great deal on her Wolverhampton debut last week and is best watched
runners.spotlight: Didn't show a great deal on her Wolverhampton debut (8.6f, Tapeta; 22-1) last week and she's probably one for further down the line.

runners.name: Queens Palace
runners.comment: Made a low-key start here (5f) in January and she needs a transformation upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Attracted support into 9-1 on debut here (5f) in January but she never got involved after a slow start; should know more this time but she needs a transformation upped to 7f.

runners.name: Wayward Daughter
runners.comment: Finished in rear at 150-1 in two runs at Southwell (7f/1m) this year
runners.spotlight: Finished in rear at 150-1 in two runs at Southwell (7f/1m) this year; has lots to find back in trip and minor handicaps will be more suitable after this.

runners.name: Bantz
runners.comment: Clear second over 7f here latest and he looks worth another try at this trip; respected
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 3132 over 7f here this year and that latest run was a clear second behind an improver 25 days ago; faded in previous attempt at 1m but he looks worth another try at this trip and is respected off only 1lb higher than last time.

runners.name: Rose Of New Jersey
runners.comment: Eyecatching third here in October and looks interesting upped to 1m on her return
runners.spotlight: Record of 0-8 but she went close in a Thirsk nursery (6f, good to soft) in September and ended last season with an eyecatching third at this track (7f); did best of the closers in that race and she looks interesting upped to 1m on return; stablemate of Bantz.

stable_tour.quote: We bought her as a yearling and have given her a bit of time. In recent weeks she has really come together physically and impressed in her work. She could make her debut at Redcar on May 28 all being well. We're looking forward to her. 23-05-24

runners.name: Herkeios
runners.comment: Seven-race maiden who was well below form at Wolverhampton latest and needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden for two different yards; placed in 1m handicaps on Polytrack and Tapeta this year but his form nosedived at Wolverhampton (8.6f) two weeks ago and he has something to prove again after that; hood worn last time is removed.

runners.name: Sweet Cicely
runners.comment: Has gone the wrong way in handicaps and record is now 0-9; first-time cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (7f) in December but her form has slipped into reverse since and she's been beaten around 8l in last two runs (1m/7f); record is now 0-9 and others are more convincing; visor is replaced by first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Kilteel
runners.comment: Still has potential and needs a close look at this new trip on her return; hood added
runners.spotlight: Made a winning handicap debut over 7f here in September; disappointing at Brighton next time but she bounced back with a good third from off the pace here in her final run last season; headgear is now added at this new trip but she still has potential and is a half-sister to a 1m winner; needs a close look on return.

runners.name: Hashtagnotions
runners.comment: Disappointing in last two runs and he needs to get back on track; visor reapplied
runners.spotlight: Won a C&D handicap in December but he's been disappointing in two runs since including when favourite here 19 days ago (first run since gelded); has some questions to answer and he needs to get back on track; visor reapplied.

3:35.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places on Round course (GoingStick 6.2)

runners.name: Galeron
runners.comment: Fourth in 2,000 Guineas in 2023; back with this yard after going 0-12 in Australia
runners.spotlight: Has his first outing since rejoining Charlie Hills, for whom he was fourth in the 2,000 Guineas in 2023; well handicapped on that form but he was 0-12 in Australia between November 2023 and last October and needs to prove he retains his old ability.

quotes.race: Goffs Million
quotes.quote: We were worried about the draw, worried about the ground but he's just done it. Me and my wife are elated. I thought Galleron was unlucky at Doncaster. I was hoping for a place and he came fourth, just was half a length behind the third - Gary Robinson, owner.

stable_tour.quote: The Hampton Court Stakes is where we could try him, but I need to speak to the owners before confirming it. I'd love to see him over a mile and a quarter ? we've got to bite the bullet and try it one day, so why not here? He finished fourth in the 2,000 Guineas and was fifth in the Irish Guineas, although he finished closer to the winner than at Newmarket. Both times he hit the line really well and should get the extra distance on the way he races. 13-06-23

He won twice last year including the Goffs Million, where he earned his owners ¤611,000. He has run well without success this season, notably when a good fourth to Chaldean in the 2,000 Guineas. His subsequent effort at the Curragh in the Irish Guineas could have seen him finish much closer if things had gone his way. I know he's better than that fifth behind Paddington and his subsequent ninth in the St James's Palace Stakes on Tuesday. 21-06-23

runners.name: Sean
runners.comment: Second of 16 in Meydan handicap two starts ago and that form entitles him to respect
runners.spotlight: 0-14 since joining this yard (multiple winner on the continent) but he ran well in defeat off higher marks in Britain last summer and was the only one to threaten the odds-on Godolphin favourite when second of 16 in 1m1f handicap at Meydan last month; fair fourth in Group 2 there since; highly respected.

stable_tour.quote: He's a tough one. He did very well in Dubai without winning last winter. He took some time to get over it and I think he was below par in the Diomed at Epsom and certainly below par in the Royal Hunt Cup. He came back and ran a good race at Ascot and was then just off it at Sandown the other day. He wants fast ground and some of those 1m1f races in Meydan are perfect for him. 11-09-24

runners.name: Midnight Gun
runners.comment: Progressive campaign last season and this lightly raced 4yo could still have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Made it two wins in a row on handicap debut at Newmarket (1m, good) last June and campaign concluded with clear second over this C&D (soft) in October; gelded since; he's 5lb higher than last time but this lightly raced 4yo is related to Group 1 winners and could still have more to offer.

stable_tour.quote: He's very well bred, by Kingman out of Sky Lantern, and after disappointing on his debut he ran much better at Kempton last time. I hope he'll take another step forward over a mile on grass. He's big and raw and could be a progressive three-year-old. 25-04-24

runners.name: Thunder Run
runners.comment: Three wins from his six starts; may well evolve into something better than a handicapper
runners.spotlight: Made it 3-5 (wins on good to soft-good to firm) when making all in big-field handicap at York (1m) last August; fourth of 20 at Ascot (1m, soft) next time when conditions seemed a shade too demanding; this lightly raced 4yo may well evolve into something better than a handicapper.

quotes.race: Clipper Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Thunder Run is still very raw and it wasn't the plan to go out and make it, but David (Egan) said he jumped out very well as they didn't feel they were going quick enough. But if something took him it probably would've cost him the race - he was on fresh air for the last 100 yards. We only ran Thunder Run at Thirsk last time as he needed a penalty to get in. Thank god he didn't win, because he might've got beat with a 6lb penalty - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Thunder Run was entitled to improve a lot from his first run. We had loads of excuses at Wetherby, he was slow away and drawn wide, and William's (Haggas)  horse got the run of the race. I felt we were unlucky not to win. He's quite a relaxed horse and he quickened up well when Danny asked him. I'd say it was a good performance and he's a smart horse. Danny likes him and I'd say we can go upwards from here - Karl Burke, trainer.

runners.name: Two Tempting
runners.comment: Five wins last year; this 6yo needs to be better than ever today but is not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Won five handicaps during an excellent 2024, the turf wins on good/good to soft; this 6yo needs to be better than ever to land this red-hot handicap but he reappeared with an encouraging fifth at Wolverhampton (AW) three weeks ago and isn't ruled out given how prolific he was last year.

quotes.race: Listen To BetMGM On talkSPORT Handicap
quotes.quote: Two Tempting never ceases to amaze me, he's just a very tough horse. He goes on any ground but I didn't want too much rain. It was on the easy side at Epsom and definitely on the easy side here, and he's shown he goes on any ground - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

quotes.race: Trustatrader Handicap
quotes.quote: I didn't think we'd got it on the line but I'd have been happy with second. I thought Two Tempting ran a blinder. He ran well here last year but we didn't expect to win. The jockey had him in the right place at the right time. He's not in the Hunt Cup - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

runners.name: Apiarist
runners.comment: Has thrived on AW this winter; needs to transfer improvement back to turf (1-12 on grass)
runners.spotlight: Made AW debut in December and made it 3-5 in that sphere (1m/7f) when winning at Southwell last month; that latest form reads well and a 5lb penalty won't necessarily stop him, but he needs to transfer his winter AW improvement back to turf; 1-12 strike-rate on grass previously.

quotes.race: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap
quotes.quote: We've always liked Apiarist and he's thriving. He's picked up a couple of nice prizes and he's progressive. He's maturing with every run and the drop back to seven furlongs today suited him as he's raced keenly in the past. I thought Rab Havlin gave him a fantastic ride. He settled nicely and he has the stamina to stay out this trip. I think he won nicely in the end. This opens up options moving forward for him. The Lincoln could be the starting place for his turf season and those big handicaps are run at a good gallop, so they should suit him - Adam Ryan, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: British EBF £100,000 Final (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: We've always liked Apiarist. Last time he went too quick and we took our time today. He's a big, raw horse and he's going to be a lovely three-year-old. He could be a very progressive horse - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely big horse and anything he did last year was a bonus. He's grown again through the winter but has really strengthened up. I might start him off in a 7f conditions race at the Craven meeting, just in case he runs a bit fresh, and then step him up to a mile. I'm sure there are going to be some big days with him. 04-04-24

runners.name: Dual Identity
runners.comment: Good campaign last season; should be suited by strongly run race at this trip; e-w claims
runners.spotlight: Below best on first and final starts last season but enjoyed a good campaign, winning at Sandown (1m, soft) in May and close second of 17 at York (1m2f, good to soft) in August; should be suited by a strongly run race at this trip and he's an each-way contender if fully tuned up for his return.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a revelation this year and won at Sandown, a place he loves. He was third there on Eclipse day and was then really unlucky from a bad draw in the John Smith's Cup at York, where he got blocked repeatedly. He ran another good race when fifth in the 1m2f handicap at Goodwood on Tuesday. There's a £100,000 race over the same trip at the Ebor meeting we have our eyes on. 02-08-24

runners.name: Orne
runners.comment: Poor end to last season and best form is at 6f, but in top hands and dangerous to discount
runners.spotlight: Disappointing on final two runs last season and there's a doubt regarding the step back up in trip; however, a break may have helped and he showed considerable promise over 1m last year before his excellent Group 2 second over 6f at Haydock; in top hands and dangerous to discount; recent blinkers are off.

quotes.race: Betfred Horris Hill Stakes (Group 3) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: It wasn't the plan to make the running. Orne went last in, but he was first out. Normally he doesn't do a stroke when he is in front but I went on a fresh bit of ground, and he found a rhythm. Just towards the end he got a little bit lonely and ducked left, but he has done it well. It wasn't the plan to go on the far side as I wanted to drop in and get a lead and get there late. When I ended up in front I could see there was fresh ground there so I thought I might as well go there. He didn't stay the mile in the Autumn Stakes. He travelled good and he handled the ground, but he just didn't stay. He could get quicker this horse over the winter - Rab Havlin, jockey.

runners.name: Lattam
runners.comment: Runner-up in this last year on reappearance; his best turf form is on soft going
runners.spotlight: Had a light campaign last year, bookended by fine second placings in this race (soft) and in the Balmoral Handicap at Ascot (1m, soft); he's just 2lb higher than for those big performances and reappears with his yard among the winners; in the mix if conditions suit (best turf form is on soft going).

quotes.race: Paddy Power Irish Lincolnshire (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Lattam is a horse that I was told needed to get there inside the furlong pole or maybe a whole lot later! It was a nose away from being a shocking ride - Chris Hayes, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's probably going to need the ground to be on the soft ground if he's to run, but he showed in the Lincoln that he's an effective horse over a straight mile in soft conditions. 10-06-24

runners.name: Toimy Son

prev_owners.owner: Gerard Augustin-Normand, Mandalore Racing Stable Sas Et Al
Gerard Augustin-Normand, Mandalore Racing Stable Sas Et Al
Gerard Augustin-Normand, Mandalore Racing Stable Sas Et Al

runners.comment: Enjoyed very solid handicap campaign last term (won Golden Mile) and he's an e-w player
runners.spotlight: Enjoyed a very solid handicap campaign last term featuring a win in the Golden Mile at Goodwood (1m, good to soft) and highly creditable third in the Cambridgeshire (1m1f, soft); also ran well first time up; each-way player.

quotes.race: bet365 Cambridgeshire (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: As I said before the race, Toimy Son is in the form of his life. It was not ideal today with the ground becoming a bit tacky, and he is probably better at a mile, but he's run another stormer. He's in the Balmoral Handicap on Champions Day and that's where we'll go with him - David Menuisier, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Golden Mile (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: It's hard to win these competitive handicaps and Toimy Son had a terrible draw but he showed a good turn of foot. Kyle Strydom has done a lot of work with him - thanks to him and all the team at David's for getting the horse here in great shape. I revved him up at the start because he can be slowly away and it worked. He broke better but I couldn't use up too much petrol. He travelled and picked up well - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He'll be my only runner at Ascot. He worked very well on Tuesday morning. I've been training him for the Jersey Stakes and he's in excellent condition. It was quick ground at Longchamp the other day but he showed last year he's effective when it's very soft so I don't have a preference. 09-06-22

runners.name: Whip Cracker
runners.comment: Well backed when close fourth on AW return; lightly raced and could be capable of better
runners.spotlight: Listed runner-up (1m1f, good) on last year's reappearance and ran well in defeat in two heavy-ground handicaps last autumn (1m2f/1m); well backed on reappearance at Wolverhampton (8.6f, AW) three weeks ago when close fourth; this lightly raced 4yo could be capable of better and is not ruled out.

stable_tour.quote: He ran really well in the spring and went to Royal Ascot, where he ran really well off top weight, although he was jarred up on the quick ground. On nice ground, 1m2f will be right up his street. 18-09-24

runners.name: Fantastic Fox
runners.comment: Suspicion he's best on AW but some pretty good turf form last year; each-way possibilities
runners.spotlight: Without a turf win since August 2021 and there's a suspicion he's best on AW; however, he ran pretty well in competitive turf handicaps last season and arrives in good form having been placed in AW handicaps on both outings this year; each-way possibilities.

quotes.race: BetMGM - Stay Golden With Responsible Play Handicap
quotes.quote: It's always a bit worrying when you've let one go. You're hoping that you'll keep tabs with him but I think we went a decent gallop in our pack in trying to not let the leader get too far away. It's played out and worked in our favour. Fantastic Fox won quite cosily in the end - Aidan Keeley, rider.

quotes.race: MansionBet Bet £10 Get £20 Handicap (London Mile Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I don't think it is Fantastic Fox's favourite ground, but his class got him through. He's still learning, he's a bit of a boy and is very babyish, and the day he grows up he'll be a nice horse - Silvestre de Sousa, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's run two super races recently, finishing a close-up eighth over an inadequate trip in the Victoria Cup, and running very well from a bad draw in a handicap on Oaks day at Epsom. He's teed up to run well in the Hunt Cup. 9-06-24

A most genuine and likeable colt who won for the second time this year when taking a Haydock handicap this month. It was a memorable day for his owners as Leicester City also won the Community Shield at Wembley. It was also a memorable weekend for the yard as we had six winners from as many runners. Although the ground was very testing that day he seems to be effective in any conditions - it was just that he handled the soft conditions better than his rivals. He's a lovely colt going forward and we'll stick to handicaps for the time being, but ultimately I think he'll evolve into a Cup horse. 18-08-21

runners.name: Mr Professor
runners.comment: Won this 12 months ago; down the field on next three starts but he's not written off
runners.spotlight: Won this for Dominic Ffrench Davis on his reappearance 12 months ago on his favoured soft ground; down the field on his next three starts (stable debut in October when last seen) and drying ground would be a concern, but he's not written off back at the scene of his biggest triumph.

quotes.race: William Hill Lincoln (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: It was a great performance, Mr Professor travelled supremely well through the race and loved the ground. David was frightened about kicking too soon but when he asked him he quickened nicely and he kept going. If it's soft at Newbury, you'd have to have a look at the Spring Cup. But will it be as testing? Who knows - Dominic Ffrench Davis, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Silver Tankard Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Mr Professor has kept on improving this year. The straight track at Newmarket is where he's let us down but he just didn't settle there. He comes out of his races so well, we weigh ours every Monday and he'd put 8kg on since his last run. The ground was an unknown today but he battled to the line, though he wasn't doing an awful lot in front. He's in the sales next week and he is going to go, we'll see what money there is for him - Alice Haynes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been running well. He probably prefers time between his races and we may have made the mistake of running him too quickly at Goodwood the other day. Owen Lewis gets on very well with him at home, felt the ground was a bit soft and he didn't really like it. We'll freshen him up and he'll be out again in about a fortnight. 21-09-23

runners.name: Magnum Opus
runners.comment: In top form at Meydan the last twice with this visor back on; could have a part to play
runners.spotlight: With this visor back on he won a handicap at Meydan (1m1f, good) last month, before a close fourth of 16 there (1m, good to firm) three weeks ago when not enjoying the clearest of passages; this in-form 4yo could have a part to play if conditions suit (unproven on slow ground).

quotes.race: DP World Logistics Presented By DP World (Handicap) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Magnum Opus didn't travel for the first half of the race but once I got there and gave him a little squeeze he showed a brilliant turn of foot. There wasn't much of a gap but he was going that well he was able to get through it - Pat Dobbs, jockey.

runners.name: Oliver Show
runners.comment: Listed runner-up in Bahrain three weeks ago and he's in with a chance
runners.spotlight: Three AW wins last year and ran very creditably against some in-form rivals when 3l second of six in Listed race in Bahrain (1m, good) three weeks ago; showed promise on good to soft ground early in career; chance.

runners.name: Godwinson
runners.comment: Lightly raced 5yo who goes well fresh and his trainer has won this four times
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 5yo who was inconsistent last season (merely mid-division on last two runs) but he was a fine second in the Spring Cup at Newbury (1m, good to soft) on last year's reappearance and his win at Goodwood (1m, good to soft) in August came after a 72-day break; clearly goes well fresh and may yet have more left in the tank for a trainer who has won this four times.

runners.name: Alpha Crucis
runners.comment: Two heavy-ground wins at Goodwood last autumn; may need testing ground to make an impact
runners.spotlight: Creditable fourth in this last year (soft) and won two in a row at Goodwood (1m1f/1m, heavy) in the autumn; further improvement is possible but he may need testing conditions if he's to make an impact this afternoon.

runners.name: Native Warrior
runners.comment: Ran well at top summer meetings last year and this 4yo retains considerable potential
runners.spotlight: Below best over C&D in September when last seen but had previously run very well in defeat in handicaps at Royal Ascot (1m, good to firm) and Glorious Goodwood (1m1f, good to firm); has also shown promise on soft ground; it's possible this lightly raced 4yo will settle better now he's been gelded and he retains considerable potential for his top yard; one to consider.

runners.name: Orandi
runners.comment: Won 27-runner Irish Lincolnshire a fortnight ago and could be involved under 5lb penalty
runners.spotlight: Irish-trained 7yo who was very consistent in defeat in the second half of last year (including on yielding ground) and he reappeared with a win in the 27-runner Irish Lincolnshire at the Curragh (1m, soft) a fortnight ago; carries a 5lb penalty today and could be involved once more.

quotes.race: Nua Healthcare Irish Lincolnshire (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Orandi was always missing the break, but Shane [Foley] rode him twice last year and was confident he would get him out sharp, which he did. Wayne Hassett was due to ride him but there were crossed wires, which was unfortunate for him and fortunate for Shane. I thought claiming 5lb [Hassett's claim] would be a big help, but it worked out well anyway. He's in the race [William Hill Lincoln], but I doubt he'll run. He was ready to peak here. There's always hope, but I'd be well below 50-50 about running at Doncaster - Tony Martin, trainer.

runners.name: Beringer

prev_owners.owner: L Field, N Farrell, J Spack
L Field, B Cognet, N Farrell, J Spack

runners.comment: Well handicapped on old form but this 10yo returns from another absence with lots to prove
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in the Cambridgeshire in 2019 and well handicapped on his form up to May 2022; however, after a year off he finished down the field at Newbury in May 2023 and has been absent since; this 10yo has lots to prove.

quotes.race: bet365 Cambridgeshire Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: I am delighted with Beringer but I must admit, at the furlong pole, I thought we had it in the bag. I think he will have one more Flat run this year and then I want to go jumping with him. He has been a star - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Coates & Seely Brut Reserve Handicap
quotes.quote: Beringer might have finished second in the Lincoln with a clearer run but has moved forward from that. We might go to York before thinking about Royal Ascot - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Lincoln (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: I thought Beringer was going to be second but he got tired in the last few strides. But I was very pleased with him - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Beck Handicap
quotes.quote: Beringer is learning all the time and we'll keep him to a mile and a quarter for now. There are no plans but as he is rising in the weights he will be able to go for some better handicaps in time - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Beringer got a little bit lost at Newmarket last time but I've been very happy since and I think we'll stick at 1m2f for the time being. We had his wind tidied up through the winter and I think that has made a big difference to him - Alan King, trainer.

runners.name: Dashing Darcey
runners.owner: C H Mcgie & Northumbria Leisure Ltd
runners.comment: Consistent and progressive for Roger Varian last year; career best needed on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Won at Haydock (1m, good) last June for Roger Varian and ran well when placed in the autumn on final two runs for that yard (1m, soft/heavy); subsequently changed hands for 110,000gns; lightly raced and further improvement can't be ruled out but a career best is needed on stable/seasonal debut.

stable_tour.quote: He's a progressive three-year-old and appreciated stepping up to a mile at Haydock on Saturday when he won well. We'll see how he comes out of the race but that win should get him into the Britannia, which is a race that should suit him well. He might prefer a bit of ease in the ground. 9-06-24

runners.name: Old Cock
runners.comment: 4yo who has won three of his six races and is open to further improvement this year
runners.spotlight: Made it three wins from his five starts when landing Haydock handicap (1m, good to firm) last August; only fourth of six at York in September (1m, good to soft; sole run on slow ground) but this unexposed 4yo is open to further improvement this year and is not ruled out.

quotes.race: Betfred 'The Classic Bookmaker' Handicap (London Mile Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Old Cock is a lovely horse and always has been. The first two home were the right two and he's a big, raw horse who could be even better next year. There's a 3yo 1m handicap at York in two weeks I had in the back of my mind, but he doesn't really take his racing that well. He's a big horse and he's not great when you rush him, so we'll see how he is - Ed Bethell, trainer.

1:50.race_name: William Hill Bet £10 Get £10 Spring Mile Handicap
1:50.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places on Round course (GoingStick 6.2)

runners.name: Thunder Roar
runners.comment: Good second in this race last year; has a doubt over current form
runners.spotlight: Suited by soft/heavy; two duck eggs comprise a poor start to his 2025 campaign; good second in this race last year but was in a consistent vein of form at the time and isn't certain to reproduce that effort.

stable_tour.quote: He's a very nice horse and the form of his Salisbury debut worked out very well - he was on the opposite side to the winner there and it would have been a close-run thing if they'd both been together. He's a big horse who's improved for being given a bit of time and turned inside out, he's grown and put on so much weight. We'll find a maiden then step him up and we think an awful lot of him. 10-05-22

runners.name: Myal
runners.comment: Record of 4-5 since handicapping and gained the last win at Doncaster; progressive
runners.spotlight: Versatile as regards ground; record of 4-5 since switched to handicaps, gaining all wins over 7f, the most recent at Doncaster last October; progressive sort who looks a major player provided he stays this new trip.

runners.name: Empirestateofmind
runners.comment: Creditable third in this race in 2022; modest strike-rate since that campaign
runners.spotlight: Best effort on AW this year when second at Newcastle on penultimate start; creditable third in this race in 2022 but has an underwhelming strike-rate since that campaign and remains above last winning mark.

quotes.race: William Hill Top Price Guarantee Autumn Handicap
quotes.quote: We were getting Empirestateofmind ready for the Lincoln when he injured a hock and that put him on the back foot. We thought he'd run well in the Cambridgeshire but he was drawn in the middle and he was a bit fresh. He always needs a run. It's good to get him back. He's in the Balmoral Handicap next week and he'll run if he gets in - John Quinn, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Summer Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Empirestateofmind bumped into one at Newcastle last Saturday and he deserved that, he's so consistent. This is a very nice race to win - Ross Harmon, owner.

stable_tour.quote: Unfortunately he won't be able to run in the Lincoln, which he finished seventh in last year, as he needed three weeks of rest at just the wrong time. He could be out in May and he's a good handicapper when the ground gets soft. He's been a victim of his consistency over the last 18 months as his mark didn't come down even though he didn't win, but he starts now lower than he did last year and I don't imagine he's any worse, so I hope he can win a nice handicap at some stage. 20-03-24

runners.name: Spirit Genie
runners.comment: Had wind surgery since last run; faces a tough assignment off current mark
runners.spotlight: Went from winning a seller in 2023 to landing three handicaps last term; had wind surgery since below-par final run; faces a stiffer assignment off current mark in this competitive field.

stable_tour.quote: The plan is to start him off in a mile handicap at Naas on Monday. He's doing things nicely at home. A mile or even 1m2f will suit him well. 21-04-23

runners.name: Ocean Of Dreams

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: Raced three times for Aidan O'Brien, showing best form on debut; check the betting
runners.spotlight: Raced three times for Aidan O'Brien, showing best form on debut (scored impressively); sold for 32,000gns and gelded since last run; now goes in headgear; heed the market signals on debut for new connections.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Ocean Of Dreams just needed two belts and he was gone. I was very impressed and I think he has Classic potential - Seamie Heffernan, rider

stable_tour.quote: He won at Leopardstown impressively and he's getting ready for the Ballysax. He's working lovely and he's a bit of a baby as he's only had one run. He seems a lovely horse. He has a very good pedigree - he goes back to Urban Sea. I think he's a type for a Derby trial, no doubt about that. 03-04-24

runners.name: Tolstoy

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Sir Robert Ogden

runners.comment: Productive last summer; never figured in the Lincoln Trial on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Productive spell last summer featured four wins, mostly at York; on a tougher mark now and hasn't obviously returned in top form, having never figured in the Lincoln Trial at Wolverhampton on reappearance.

quotes.race: William Hill Extra Place Races Daily Handicap
quotes.quote: Tolstoy is unreal. We might step him up to a mile next as he's not stopping in his races. He's settled now and is grand. He'll come back here for something at the Ebor meeting - Brian Ellison, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Proud To Support Macmillan Handicap
quotes.quote: Tolstoy didn't have a penalty so we thought it was worth giving him another shot. Everything was fine this morning and he was a lot more settled in the paddock today. He was very game in the race - he's tough - Brian Ellison, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tolstoy was well entitled to do that and the race didn't look to have too much depth to it. His last run was good and he likes soft ground. He's quick and I can see him staying over six furlongs - he should get stronger and quicker with a winter on his back - Rab Havlin, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: A recent purchase who hasn't run for us yet. He's a grand horse who ran a lot for Stuart Williams. He wouldn't have the best of feet, but he's fine and has quite good form. He'll run through the summer at Saturday meetings at places like York. 03-04-24

runners.name: Deboras Dream
runners.comment: Physical tweak (gelded since last run) needs to make a difference
runners.spotlight: Registered three wins for previous yard; balance of form for current stable suggests he'll struggle to land this prize, unless a physical tweak (gelded since last run) makes a difference.

stable_tour.quote: He ran disappointingly at Dundalk last time and he's been gelded now. He's rated 88 and he'll definitely win off that mark in January if we can find the right race. 05-12-24

runners.name: Naepoint
runners.comment: Record of 3-4 since handicapping; 1-1 over C&D; improving sort who commands respect
runners.spotlight: Looks versatile as regards ground; record of 3-4 since handicapping, most recently winning the Straight-Mile Series Final at Redcar last October; gelded since; improving sort who is 1-1 over C&D and commands respect.

runners.name: Farasi Lane

prev_owners.owner: M Webber, M T Ward & Schiff Family
M Webber, M T Ward & Schiff Family

runners.comment: Went very close in the Lincoln Trial; possibilities on the back of that useful effort
runners.spotlight: Campaigned mostly on AW for current yard but is equally effective on turf on his day; went very close in the Lincoln Trial at Wolverhampton most recently and has possibilities on the back of that useful effort.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places Handicap (London Mile Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Farasi Lane's homework had been brilliant and he was second here last month, which could be considered a career-best and that's amazing for a 6yo to still be improving. That's probably a career-best again and hopefully it shows what we can do with these older horses. There's a 0-90 on Guineas day I've been thinking about, although he might not get in it now - Jamie Insole, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Our Havana
runners.comment: Won in emphatic style at Southwell (7f) last time and looks well handicapped back on turf
runners.spotlight: Largely progressive 7f performer; emphatic winner at Southwell most recently, taking handicap record to 3-7; looks well treated back on turf, with AW mark now 8lb higher; good chance provided he stays the new trip.

quotes.race: Bet Boost At bet365 Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Our Havana had been working well at home so that was no surprise but he was very idle in front. When the runner up came to him he went again - Oisin Orr, rider.

runners.name: Arthurs Realm

prev_owners.owner: Paul Turner and King for a Day

runners.comment: Has form figures of 173 in this contest, the success in 2022; suited by slow ground
runners.spotlight: Suited by ground softer than good; has form figures of 173 in this contest, the success in 2022; capable of being involved but this exposed 7yo may struggle to beat the progressive types in this field.

quotes.race: Racing TV Zetland Gold Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Arthur's Realm has appreciated the return to an easy surface and it's great that he's managed to win over a mile and a quarter - Ed Dunlop, trainer.

quotes.race: SBK Spring Mile Handicap
quotes.quote: The race fell lovely for me. Arthur's Realm travelled well and they went a nice gallop. Ed was a bit wary of the ground but as the racing has gone on they've got into it, it's a bit holding, and it suited him - Rossa Ryan, jockey

quotes.race: Follow @RiponRaces On Twitter Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Arthur's Realm was a little awkward in the paddock but he's quite talented. We ran him over a mile and a quarter and he probably didn't quite stay: we dropped him to a mile and he's gone and won for us - Robin Trevor-Jones, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Rhythm Master
runners.comment: No win since 2022 but caught the eye at Southwell on reappearance and could go well
runners.spotlight: Hasn't won since 2022 and is 0-8 for current stable; not exactly screaming to be backed but he caught the eye at Southwell on reappearance and could go well off a mark that remains very workable on best form.

quotes.race: Jenningsbet Handicap
quotes.quote: Rhythm Master has been a bit of a rogue. We had to relieve him of his manhood, we tried the visor today and it made the world of difference - John Dance, owner.

runners.name: Surrey Shadow
runners.comment: Unexposed sort whose 7f novice form has substance; interesting handicap debutant
runners.spotlight: Unexposed sort whose 7f novice form, including two efforts at Doncaster, has substance; shapes as if this extra furlong will suit and should build on Southwell reappearance win; interesting handicap debutant.

runners.name: Cynosure
runners.comment: Campaigned mostly on AW; something to prove off current mark back on turf
runners.spotlight: Campaigned mostly on AW, reaching a fairly useful standard; posted good efforts in November/January but form dipped last month; something to prove off current mark in this warm event back on turf.

runners.name: Helm Rock
runners.comment: Hasn't scored on turf since 2022 but best form gives him a fighting chance
runners.spotlight: Gained last three wins on AW and posted a couple of third-place finishes in that sphere last month; hasn't scored on turf since 2022 but best form gives him a fighting chance.

quotes.race: Unibet London Mile Series Final Handicap (Series Final - Qualified horses Only)
quotes.quote: It's a great result. We only ran in the Racing League because the race looked winnable. The plan had been to come here and we did think the races were a bit close together, but Helm Rock has won 70,000GBP in ten days. He's won seven now and was the most expensive yearling we've ever bought, but he's paid it back. It's taken time but he's matured mentally and every year he's come back a bit better - Daniel Kubler - co-trainer.

quotes.race: J W Lees MPA Handicap
quotes.quote: Helm Rock just loves the soft ground and it's been tricky to find it this year. He handles the all-weather but you see the best of him in the mud; he's a true Pivotal - Claire Kubler, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Wreay Handicap
quotes.quote: We debated the trip a bit for Helm Rock but he ran over a mile three times and didn't quite get it. He loved the ground and we'll see what options there are for him-Claire Kubler, joint trainer

stable_tour.quote: It looks like he's better on the all-weather all of a sudden. He's good on turf, but took off on the all-weather and ideally we'd like to get him back to Kempton for the series final he won last year. He's on a break and is one for the second half of the campaign. 02-05-24

runners.name: Promethean
runners.comment: Low-mileage maiden who could improve for gelding operation and first-time hood
runners.spotlight: The only maiden in this field but has low mileage and is interesting on bits of form, including Doncaster effort last September; could improve for being gelded since last run and the first-time hood.

runners.name: One Night Thunder
runners.comment: Absent since finishing midfield in last year's Lincoln; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Not solid on his form for current yard and badly lacks recent match practice, having been absent since finishing midfield in the Lincoln on this card last year; gelded subsequently; others preferred.

runners.name: Rogue Encore
runners.comment: Has form figures of 114, all on AW at Newcastle, since wearing cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 114, all on AW at Newcastle last November, since wearing cheekpieces; unsuited by drop back to 7f the final time; needs improvement on his turf form but the retained headgear may help.

stable_tour.quote: This colt has a nice pedigree and he looks to have ability to match. His training is going very well and the plan will be to start him off in the next month. His work has been good and he will be another for the 'Rogues' to look forward to. 06-07-23

runners.name: Pearl Eye
runners.comment: Exposed contender who has done all of his winning in lower grades; opposed
runners.spotlight: Much more exposed than some of these rivals and has done all of his winning in lower grades; only a fraction above last winning mark but faces a difficult task at this level.

quotes.race: Nars Supports The NHC Handicap
quotes.quote: Pearl Eye should have won here last year, he was unlucky under Patrick Cosgrave, but he's made amends now and it's nice to win first up. He won four for us last year and was only out of the first four once. He's an improving horse and he goes to Chester now for a mile-and-a-quarter handicap. He was second off his highest mark there last year - Darryll Holland, trainer.

runners.name: Look Back Smiling
runners.comment: Best form on slow ground, notably a win off 1lb higher in this contest 12 months ago
runners.spotlight: Best form on ground softer than good, notably a success off 1lb higher in this contest 12 months ago and close second in the 2024 Thirsk Hunt Cup; enters the reckoning, provided conditions are suitable.

quotes.race: William Hill Epic Boost Spring Mile Handicap
quotes.quote: You could see in the final furlong he's not that straightforward. Look Back Smiling has not made life easy for the jockey but he had his head in front where it matters. That's another fantastic run at this track and we're going to have to look for some races back here. His best runs have all been here - Gemma Tutty, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a character but we're all really fond of him and he keeps coming out and doing us proud. He only cost £10,000 but he's on £50,000 prize-money already for the year. He's really peaked this year, winning the Spring Mile at Doncaster on his seasonal reappearance and running very well when second at Thirsk. We were reasonably confident at Doncaster - we knew he had his ground and had a big race like that in him - and he has been a bit more consistent this year. He's quite ground-dependent but the going description was a bit faster than I would have liked for him at Thirsk, where he showed he's not just a heavy-ground horse. That being said, it was much too quick for him at York last week, so he'll have a little break now until he gets his ground again and then continue running in Class 2s and heritage handicaps over 7f and a mile. 23-05-24

runners.name: Spirit Of Acklam
runners.comment: Has low mileage and may still have further progress in him; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Dual novice winner who has two pieces of respectable handicap form; has low mileage and may still have further progress in him; gelded since last run and now goes in cheekpieces; not ruled out.

quotes.race: Western House Hotel EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Spirit of Acklam is a very nice horse and I think he needs a mile and a half. He's going to be great for next year, but I'm still not sure quite what he's going to be though, as he's a great big baby at the moment - Mick Easterby, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Pressures On
runners.breeder: S C E A Marmion Vauville Et Al
runners.comment: Ran well at Wolverhampton on reappearance; due to go up 1lb in future; likely player
runners.spotlight: Opened his turf account with Newmarket win last backend and ran well at Wolverhampton (again over 7f) on reappearance, shaping as if this return to 1m is worth exploring; due to go up 1lb in future; player.

3:00.race_name: William Hill Doncaster Mile Stakes (Listed Race)
3:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places on Round course (GoingStick 6.2)

runners.name: Botanical
runners.comment: Ended 2024 with near miss in 1m2f Listed for new yard; bold show likely back from wind op
runners.spotlight: Couldn't quite justify favouritism in a 1m2f Goodwood Listed race (soft) last autumn on his first run for George Boughey but still recorded a career best RPR; won on last year's reappearance and a bold show is likely on return from wind surgery.

quotes.race: Knights Solicitors Handicap
quotes.quote: Botanical was in super nick today. The worry was the drying ground as he was so dominant on quite soft ground at Hamilton, but he showed he copes with it. He was pretty dominant there and while he'll get a bit of a clobbering for that, he's a smart horse - James Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: Hampton By Hilton Hamilton Park Handicap
quotes.quote: Botanical won it really well and he should be a nice horse next year. The handicapper will have his say and will know whether it's a strong race but hopefully he's not too hard on us. He seems like a Class 2 horse and we'll see if he can climb the ladder a bit next year. I think ground is quite important to him, he was beaten on a sounder surface at Ascot the time before. I'm not sure if we'd run again this season - Roger Varian, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's stepping out of handicap company for the first time after a very impressive win at the Dante meeting. He won't be the top-rated in the Wolferton, but he is progressive and should go well. The easier the ground the better his chance will probably be, but on the opening day you'd hope it wouldn't be too quick either way. A stiff ten furlongs will be right up his street. 9-06-24

runners.name: Checkandchallenge
runners.comment: Placed in Group/Listed last summer but ended 2024 on low note; minus headgear on return
runners.spotlight: Listed/Group 3 winner who was back to somewhere approaching his best when placed in a 1m1f York Group 3 and 1m Sandown Listed race at the end of last summer; ended 2024 on a low note, though, and returns minus the headgear he's worn on his last 12 starts.

quotes.race: Mutasaabeq At The National Stud James Seymour Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Checkandchallenge has run in some hot races this year and I don't think he has actually run a bad race in any of them. Dropping back into a Listed race today it was just nice to get his head back in front. I know the distance between them was a long way at Ascot the other day, but he was fourth in a Group One and he picked up a good bit of prize money and he had some nice horses behind him. I think a mile and a quarter is right for him. We went back for the stiff mile at Ascot as we felt on that track it was going to suit him and he got his just rewards. He can cope with those extremes out there today where a lot of other horses can't. He is in the Hong Kong Mile, but I think he deserves a nice break. There will be plenty of options for him next year. Horses like him can turn up in those Group One races that cut up a bit and pick up a bit of money. We might also look at those Group Three and Group Two races in France again next year - William Knight, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Burradon Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I was absolutely delighted and excited with the manner in which Checkandchallenge has done it in what looked a competitive field. He had to go and win today to warrant a run in the Guineas and that's still on the agenda. It looked like there was a bit left there, which there needs to be to be competitive in the Guineas. There's improvement still to come from him, it wasn't all about today. The big challenge is he's got to convert his all-weather form across to turf, but there's no reason why he can't. He did a nice bit of work on the grass gallops last week which pleased us and made us feel he was definitely above average - William Knight, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely horse who won his first two races and earned a place in the 2,000 Guineas. His second start when bolting up in Listed company at Newcastle had plenty of people talking about him and I must be honest I thought he'd win but not in the manner he did. We decided he had to take his place in the 2,000 Guineas but he never got a chance to show his true colours. He got wiped out at the start, which caused him to lose his action, and from there on things never went right. Unfortunately he came back sore, having knocked a joint. It has been hard work getting him back but he's there now and ready to go again. I looked at Royal Ascot but he had a slightly dirty scope before and you must be 100 per cent for that meeting. He heads to Newmarket for the July meeting, where we'll aim for the Listed Sir Henry Cecil Stakes over a mile and then we'll look to the Thoroughbred Stakes at Glorious Goodwood. He'll run at Newmarket as long as they get nice ground and hopefully we can get him back to where he was before the Guineas. He'll have to carry a penalty there for his Listed win but it's a lesser race and hopefully it'll help him get his confidence back. We're all very excited about getting him out again. Further down the line we could look to step him up to 1m2f. 30-06-22

runners.name: Dancing Gemini
runners.comment: Below par at end of 2024 but went close in French 2,000 Guineas on last year's return
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in French 2,000 Guineas at Longchamp (1m, soft) on last year's reappearance; didn't shine later in the season but mostly at the highest level and could revive with his sights lowered on return.

quotes.race: Betfred Derby (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: Dancing Gemini ran well. I rode him to finish and he just emptied out. He'll be better back in trip - Dylan Browne McMonagle, rider.

quotes.race: Emirates Poule d'Essai des Poulains (Group 1) (3yo Colts) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We'll let the dust settle and then we'll have a discussion. Whether Dancing Gemini will stay a mile and a half around Epsom or maybe do you come back here over a mile and a quarter - there's lots to discuss. He's always had that kick and maybe he might have too much speed for a mile and a half, and coming here might be the wise thing. He'll have come on for today and he's had no prep - Roger Teal, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred Flying Scotsman Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: That was really impressive. We've held Dancing Gemini in high regard all year and he did a piece of work last week that was breathtaking. I knew we had him in good shape coming into today and I said to Lewis if he can back up that bit of work you'll be going pass that lollipop in front. It was a very nice performance. We won this with Tip Two Win and he could possibly be as good. He's got a similar profile, he's got speed, he's got a turn of foot and he's got a good cruising gear. He's in the Futurity here but we'll play it by ear, we'll see how he comes out of today. If all's well and the owner is happy we might take a punt on it. If not we'll leave him for next year, maybe do a trial and go on to the Guineas - Roger Teal, trainer.

quotes.race: Chapel Down British EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Dancing Gemini in probably one of the nicest two-year-olds already. We don't get many but we know when we've got a good horse and I've got a lot of butterflies about this horse. He's still a tad green but he went away nicely and he was very professional - Roger Teal, trainer.

runners.name: Liberty Lane
runners.comment: Won the Cambridgeshire and second in Group 3 on final two runs at 4; big player
runners.spotlight: Defied top weight in the Cambridgeshire at Newmarket (1m1f, soft) last September and returned to the same C&D to chase home Lead Artist in a Group 3 on good to soft the following month; ran poorly in the Lincoln on last year's reappearance but he has won over C&D and when fresh; leading claims.

quotes.race: bet365 Cambridgeshire (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: I was a bit worried at halfway as they looked like they had it on the stands' side, but I had walked the course yesterday and I was convinced that's not where you wanted to be. The ground was 100 per cent the reason Liberty Lane didn't perform in the race last year, as he wants a bit of juice in the ground to be able to get into a rhythm. I ran him in the Dante as a three-year-old and he was always running a bit free as a younger horse but he's always been a good horse - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Suffolk Stakes (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Liberty Lane was sick after the Lincoln and scoped very dirty. The only reasons I ran him today were because I knew Sheikh Obaid would be here and it was a hundred grand race that we had entered early in. He had been coming back to himself in recent days but I didn't expect that. He's learning to relax in his races now as he was always very keen. Clifford gave him a lovely ride today and he will improve for that - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: Hippo Pro 3 Sealant Handicap
quotes.quote: All Liberty Lane does is gallop. I always thought soft ground and a mile is what he wants - Clifford Lee, jockey.

quotes.race: British EBF Future Stayers Oath Novice Stakes (Sire And Dam Restricted Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That felt very good, Liberty Lane travelled well throughout and relished the ease in the ground. He's a lovely horse, tries hard and had been working really well at home. He's a big colt but he's so chilled out and relaxes really nicely. Lucy (Burke) has been riding him a lot at home and I'd galloped him a few times; he's progressed really nicely - Clifford Lee, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He bolted up on his only run and is a beautiful horse who we hope will make up into a Derby contender. I think he's quick enough to start off over 1m1f or 1m2f, then I'm hoping we're good enough to make an entry for the Dante Stakes. 06-04-23

A beautiful colt and, after winning his only start last year at Nottingham by five lengths, we put him away for the winter. On his return at Newmarket earlier this month I thought he would take some beating, but it could be that trying to concede 7lb to Waipiro will look to have been some task as I thought the winner looked smart on the day. I had wanted to run him at Newbury later that week as I felt the course would suit him more but I saw Sheikh Obaid had two other entries so I opted for Newmarket, although I know the Sheikh would not have minded where I ran him. We will look for a Derby trial if we can get some ground on the easy side. 07-05-23

runners.name: Noble Order
runners.comment: Changed hands for only 1,500gns ahead of this stable debut; big outsider
runners.spotlight: Struggled in two AW handicaps for Archie Watson this winter and changed hands for only 1,500gns in January ahead of this yard debut with a tongue-tie added; out of his depth.

runners.name: Point Lynas
runners.owner: Julie And David R Martin And Dan Hall

prev_owners.owner: Julie Martin & David R Martin & Partner

runners.comment: Made all in 1m Listed race last July; not seen again until second in Qatar last month
runners.spotlight: Easy all-the-way winner of a 1m Pontefract Listed race (good to firm) in July on his final start last year; arrives fit from a runner-up effort in a local Group 2 in Qatar (1m, good) last month; in the mix on form but good to soft may be a touch slower than ideal for him.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Pomfret Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I didn't think Point Lynas would do it quite as well as that but he had a good draw and he loves this ground. Everyone let him do his own thing but he just gets into a rhythm and keeps going. He's in the Celebration Mile [at Goodwood] and there's also the Strensall at York - and he loves that place. He'll get an entry and, wherever the ground is quickest, he'll go - Ed Bethell, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Oakmere Homes Hambleton Handicap
quotes.quote: I was thinking we were going a bit fast but Point Lynas just has one way of going, you just let him do it. Don't fight him. Callum gets on with him great. He deserved to win a nice one like this. I'd say that was a career-best performance. We'll probably look at something a little better than a handicap now, we'll probably have to I imagine - Ed Bethell, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Point Lynas has been unlucky not to win before now, he has tended to over-race, but he's settled nicely in front today. He's in the horses-in-training sale and would make a fun horse for someone - Barry Hills, spokesman for winning trainer Charlie.

stable_tour.quote: He joined us last year and has gone from strength to strength. By the end of his first season with us he had gone up to a mark of 90, and this term he won at Newcastle first time out before putting up a career-best effort last time when second to Croupier in the Hambleton at York's May meeting off 93. The handicapper has nudged him up 2lb for that, but he's absolutely thriving and all roads lead to Royal Ascot for him. He's a funny horse at home as he does just as he wants, but we all love him. He's not over-big but has a great action and loves top of the ground, which hopefully it will be at Ascot. Another race I'd love to run him in is the Golden Mile at Glorious Goodwood as he loves those big-field handicaps with a strong pace. 01-06-23

runners.name: Savvy Victory
runners.comment: Turf Listed winner who landed good AW handicap in December (both 1m2f); opposable at 1m
runners.spotlight: Listed scorer at Sandown (1m2f, good) in 2023 and recorded a smart RPR when landing his first success since in 1m2f Newcastle handicap in December; this trip is a little short of his optimum and,  back from 113 days off, others are preferred for win purposes.

quotes.race: Davies Insurance Solutions Gala Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: We were absolutely gutted in the Wolferton. Savvy Victory got knocked over at a crucial time. We had an option of coming here or going for the John Smith's Cup and we chose to come here. We got away with it to be honest as that ground is drying out all the time. We took our time, and came there, and he has quickened on ground he doesn't really like as he would like it heavier. A mile and a quarter is his trip. You haven't seen anything yet. On heavy ground, he will be a proper horse - Sean Woods, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Handicap
quotes.quote: Things probably didn't go Savvy Victory's way last time, but he's done things the right way today and got a nice lead into the race. I might have got there too soon, but he's a lovely, progressive type - I'm sure he'll improve again from today. I was surprised how well he made up ground quickly and I suppose he could try a mile and a half again, although he'd have options at a mile and a quarter. I don't see why he couldn't step back into Listed company, although his best form is probably with cut in the ground. He's a heavy horse, but he might progress with regard to better ground with age - David Probert, rider.

runners.name: Witch Hunter
runners.comment: Hold-up performer who ran well for second in 7f AW Listed race three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Placed in last season's Lockinge at Newbury and also went close in 7f Hungerford there in August; creditable second in 7f Wolverhampton Listed event three weeks ago and this hold-up performer is capable of another good run, particularly if getting a decent pace to aim at.

quotes.race: BetVictor Hungerford Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: I was intending to run Witch Hunter in the Great St Wilfrid but I put him in this as well as with the rain coming I thought I might not run Chindit and it might open up for him. I ran Chindit and it still opened up for him so I'm delighted.  He was unlucky not to win at the All-Weather Championships at Lingfield which I thought was his Derby. He's improved all year - Richard Hannon, trainer.

quotes.race: Buckingham Palace Stakes (Handicap)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted for William (Stobart, owner) - he rang me one day and said he'd like to buy a horse to go to Royal Ascot; we got here, 100/1, no chance, and he looked like he had no chance, sitting last, and he's gone and won. It does happen to nice people sometimes. Jamie's given him a lovely ride - I hate the way he rides, why does he keep doing that to us?! He gave Witch Hunter a super ride and the horse kind of enjoyed that. When he passes one he gets his momentum. And when they pass him, sometimes he just goes, sod it, I'll go another day. He's a very good horse on his day and I don't care what price he is - Richard Hannon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was fantastic last year and ended up winning a Group 2 and at Royal Ascot, but he takes his time to come into his coat every year and finished fifth on his seasonal reappearance at Sandown. I'd love to think this year can be as successful as the last for him. 29-04-24

runners.name: Chic Colombine
runners.comment: French Listed win last March; more miss than hit after; has had wind op; now tongue tied
runners.spotlight: Reappeared to win a 1m French Listed race on heavy last March but just one creditable effort in her four subsequent starts last year; has had wind surgery and returns from six months off (also now tongue tied first time); Billy Loughane partners the stable's other runner.

quotes.race: British EBF £100,000 2YO Fillies' Series Final (EBF Restricted Race Series) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This race had been the plan for a while for Chic Colombine and it's a nice prize to win. She proved at Doncaster she handles soft ground but I don't think she necessarily wants it. She's on the up, showed a great attitude there and has gone from strength to strength since her maiden win. She'll be suited by a mile and I imagine she'll be running in a stakes race before long - George Boughey, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF "Carrie Red" Fillies' Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: The real question was the trip. Chic Colombine is bred to be a miler and possibly a ten furlong horse so I think there's a little bit more to come. She's a filly with a three-year-old's pedigree and we'll just bide our time with her - George Boughey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's going under the radar a bit. She won in France at the start of the year and the form of her Epsom second behind Breege has worked out well, but she wasn't quite right after her last run. Softer ground into the autumn will suit her. 11-09-24

2:25.race_name: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Cammidge Trophy Stakes (Listed Race)
2:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places on Round course (GoingStick 6.2)

runners.name: Marshman
