runners.owner: Nick Bradley Racing 2 & Mrs E Burke
runners.comment: Very good 2nd in this race last year; in fine form on AW at 6f and 5f; solid chance
runners.spotlight: Group 3 winner in France as a 3yo and he started last season with an excellent second in this race (soft) when travelling strongly but run down late on by a top sprinter; his path took a grey turn later but he's been in fine fettle on the AW since being gelded and having wind surgery and he'll be suited by the return to 6f; solid chance.

quotes.race: BetUK Kachy Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Marshman has been gelded and the wind op has improved him a bit more. It feels like he can breathe a bit better in his races. We've got a long season ahead - it's not really started yet so there'll be plenty of races - and he'll probably go into a Group 3 at some point. He's beaten some really good horses and I'll be looking forward to him next time. There were a few question marks as it was a sharper six furlongs, but a quicker gallop was going to suit him. He's very fiery. Even though he's won over six furlongs at Newcastle he's performed today - Clifford Lee, jockey.

quotes.race: Weekly £5 Free Bet With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: We don't really have a long-term target but Marshman took well to the all-weather, so the six-furlong handicap on finals' day would be an obvious place to look. That was his first time on the surface, so we'd need to find two more runs. We can aim high with him. I hope that's not the highlight of the year for him and it's just the start - Nick Bradley of Nick Bradley Racing.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Gimcrack Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: They're two lovely colts and we've got a lot to look forward to with them. Maybe running seven days after last week may not have helped Marshman, he had a real good blow. Though he won very easily, he had a race. There's a little bit more to come from him, maybe ridden a little bit differently. Clifford said he's still a bit green when he's in front on his own - Karl Burke, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran a great race in the Cammidge as he definitely needed the race and I wouldn't be afraid of taking on the winner again. He could be a good sprinter in the making. 03-04-24

An exciting time of the year for our stable as last year's smart juveniles form part of the strongest team of three-year-olds I have had to train. Marshman did his bit last year winning the first starts before finding only Noble Style too good for him in the Gimcrack. He is a very fast horse who will stick to sprints this year and he showed his well being when taking the Group 3 Prix Sigy at Chantilly (5½f) a couple of weeks ago. That was a smart performance as I thought he would need the run first time out. He has come out of that well and the plan is the Sandy Lane Stakes, which we won last year with El Caballo. He also has the Commonwealth Cup as his first big target for the year. 07-05-23

runners.name: Witness Stand
runners.comment: Good progress over 7f as 3yo; well held at Riyadh on yard debut; first 6f run since 2yo
runners.spotlight: Made good progress over 7f for Tom Clover once cheekpieces were fitted, the pinnacle when a ready  Listed winner at Newbury (soft) in September; should have more to come as a 4yo but he was eased when beaten at Riyadh in February on yard debut and he hasn't run over 6f since turned over as 2yo in his one attempt.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Cup Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Witness Stand's last two runs had been career bests and this was another big step up. He's not overly big but he has a big heart and is versatile regarding conditions - Kieran Shoemark, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: The son of Expert Eye looks the part. He has done all we had been asking of him at home and we gave him his first run at Chester last Friday, where I thought it would take a nice one to beat him, and he proved me right with a very professional performance in winning on his debut. Danny brought him off the rail as they entered the short straight and in a matter of strides the race was over. I could not be happier with him, and we will wait and see how he recovers from his first day at the races before making any decisions. We are in no rush as I think he has a lovely future. 06-07-23

runners.name: Al Shabab Storm
runners.comment: Progressive 3yo for A Balding, winning German Group 3 at 6f; good 3rd on AW for new yard
runners.spotlight: Down the field on final 3yo start for Andrew Balding but on an upward march previously, successfully promoted to a Group 3 at Baden-Baden (6f, soft) in August; excellent effort from the front in 7f Listed race at Wolverhampton on recent yard debut and has possibilities back at 6f on turf.

runners.name: Iberian
runners.comment: Classy 2yo, winning Group 2 here; well held in Group 1s last year; 6f AW winner latest
runners.spotlight: Highly talented as 2yo and won a strong Group 2 here (7f, soft; has won on good); soundly beaten in two Group 1s last year but he had wind surgery after and did well, having been hampered early, to beat a course specialist for 6f conditions race at Southwell in December; unproven at this trip on turf but a lack of early pace has not been his problem so far; interesting.

quotes.race: Betfred Champagne Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: That's just what the doctor ordered, I think Iberian is a very exciting horse. Tom said he gave him some feel, he has an electric turn of foot. He put the race to bed very well. His work had been unbelievable at home and we just wanted to show what he can do on the racecourse and I think he's done that today. He learned plenty at Goodwood, he was drawn one there and William was conscious of teaching him to race properly. He got a little out of his ground that day and was a bit inexperienced, on and off the bridle, but he finished well. The ground is still pretty soft and when the ground's a bit quicker you might see a bit better horse. Hopefully he'll run in the Dewhurst and why shouldn't he be a Guineas horse? He'll get a mile no problem, there's plenty of stamina on the dam's side. And he has a great attitude, he does everything so professionally at home - Charlie Hills, trainer.

quotes.race: Nicholson Gin Vintage Stakes (Group 2) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Iberian is a really nice horse and William was very impressed by him. He was drawn nine and we were patient, but he's run a great race. We'll probably look at the Champagne Stakes now and, if he goes well there, we'll probably go to the Dewhurst. William said the softer surface just blunted his speed, although he did pick up. I'm just pleased he's stepped up to that level and I've always held him in high regard - he's a good horse for the future. He could be a Guineas horse all being well and it's nice to know he can compete in these races - Charlie Hills, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I wanted to run him in the Greenham at Newbury on Saturday but the ground will be too soft, so we'll bypass that and he'll instead go to Newmarket for a racecourse gallop this week. I've been delighted with him. He looks fantastic in his coat and has wintered brilliantly. He trains like a very good horse, so there should be exciting times ahead. He won the Champagne Stakes at Doncaster, where he beat two subsequent Group 1 winners on soft ground, but he's different class on a faster surface when he works at home. He's got huge potential and shows so much speed, so a mile will probably be as far as he wants to go. This gallop will take a bit of freshness out of him, but the day out will do him the world of good too. After that, I expect him to run in a Guineas somewhere, depending on the ground and weather. 17-04-24

He's a lovely colt. His work had been very encouraging in recent weeks and I felt he was good enough to start off at Newbury last week, although we considered the Chesham at Royal Ascot, such was the impression we had. I knew it would take a good horse to beat him last week and so it proved. He was very green in the early stages but really picked up when Rossa [Ryan] asked him to lengthen. We'll see how he gets over those exertions before making further plans, but he has a bright future and you'd expect him to get further. 21-06-23

runners.name: Jamess Delight
runners.comment: Major improver over 6f as 3yo, close 2nd to Spycatcher in French Group 3; more to come
runners.spotlight: Brought along steadily before showing his mettle in a Group 3 at Deauville (6f, very soft) in August, when losing out only narrowly to Spycatcher; finished further behind that rival in Group 1 at Ascot after, when he was again slowly away and didn't have the best of runs; has sprint potential but he doesn't always travel strongly and that, combined with a possible slow start, could cost him here.

quotes.race: Barriere Prix de Meautry (Group 3) (3yo+) (Straight Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: James's Delight enjoys the soft ground and we have an entry in the Champions Day Sprint. We're forecast some hotter temperatures so we'll play our cards accordingly - Clive Cox, trainer.

quotes.race: Churchill Tyres Supporting Macmillan Sprint Handicap
quotes.quote: That was wonderful, I'm so pleased. It was a very confident ride from Ryan, as always. The way that he changed gear there today fills me full of excitement. James's Delight does appreciate the ground, although he won on good ground on Guineas day at Newmarket he prefers this end of the scale.  We'll see how he comes back before we think of the Wokingham but winning today means he'll have a penalty and that will be on top of a mark of 102 so we'll see. But he's clearly a three-year-old going places - Clive Cox, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Bet In-Running Handicap
quotes.quote: James's Delight did that well. Last time over seven furlongs was a bit of a non event and he enjoyed this trip of six furlongs a lot better - Richard Kingscote, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He put up a pleasing performance to win at Newbury last month on his debut in the colours of Paul and Clare Rooney, who we've had some great days with in the past. James's Delight is out of a Pivotal mare and I thought that may count on his debut where the ground was on the soft side. He showed a great attitude and I was impressed with his positive response in the closing stages. He has qualified for the Goffs sales race at Naas in Ireland later on and we will obviously seriously consider that option. He is a horse to look forward to. 02-08-23

runners.name: Spycatcher
runners.comment: High-class sprinter at 6f; tends to reproduce his best form on reappearance; solid chance
runners.spotlight: High-class sprinter who's very effective at Deauville and was able to see off James's Delight in a Group 3 there (6f, very soft) in August; finished a creditable sixth in Group 1 at Ascot later and, given he tends to reproduce his best form when fresh, he should be good for another strong show.

quotes.race: Barriere Prix de Meautry (Group 3) (3yo+) (Straight Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with Spycatcher. He looked like his old self today and was given a great ride by Clifford [Lee]. He loves that soft ground, that's key to him, he looked in great shape and travelled over well. We'll aim for Champions Day again but he'll have entries in a few races and if the ground comes up heavy between then and now, he'll probably turn up - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: Arc Prix Maurice de Gheest (Group 1) (3yo+) (Straight Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Spycatcher was on the box, heading for retirement last year. He had an issue but Duncan Moir, the vet, said he'd seen the x-ray and he thought we could put this horse back together again if we did everything right. Karl and Duncan and everyone have got him to win a Group 3 and come within a whisker of winning a Group 1. It's a remarkable training performance and all credit to everyone involved with him. It was a terrific run. He was travelling so well and Maxime Guyon had to go, there was no choice. The agony is that the other horse has come to him, passed him and then he's come back and got him just past the post. He's a fabulous horse and, ground allowing, we'll hopefully look at the Haydock Sprint Cup. He must have this easy ground - Harry Herbert, owner's Chairman and Managing Director.

quotes.race: Prix de Ris-Orangis (Group 3) (3yo+) (Straight Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Spycatcher ran a brilliant race at Newcastle and today he's loved this ground. I liked the way he travelled into it and quickened away. It does take a lot of doing. Some horses you can't really do that with but he's a tough horse to turn around and win - Clifford Lee, jockey.

quotes.race: 1895 Duke Of York Clipper Logistics Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted, Spycatcher has run a great race. He's suffered with his feet a little bit and to come and do it that grade gives us a lot of hope for the future. He's in a Group 2 at the Curragh a week on Sunday, but I'd imagine that will come too quick. We're not in at Ascot and ground with a bit of juice in it will be key to him with his feet - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Novice Stakes (Div I)
quotes.quote: Spycatcher showed last year he had a lot of ability. He was a lot more relaxed today and we might think about the Greenham, otherwise he'd be running in handicaps with big weights - Karl Burke, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a brilliant season and was unlucky not to win the Maurice de Gheest. He needs cut in the ground but could go to Newmarket for the Abernant, then to the Duke of York, which he was second in two years ago. I hope he can find a Group 1 win this year. 03-04-24

He's a horse I have always liked and after suffering a mid-summer injury we had him gelded and I brought him back at Thirsk last month, expecting him to come on for the run, so it was a pleasant surprise to see him romp home from the useful Mount Athos. We had planned to turn him around quickly at Haydock on Saturday but the ground was a bit quick for him. He will not run on any ground with the word ‘firm' in the going description. He is a nice horse who has more good races in him now he has matured. Prior to his last run he had never seen the 7f out, as he was too keen, but the long break and the cut have seen him come back a more mature horse and that trip looks more to his liking now. 07-05-23

runners.name: Frost At Dawn
runners.comment: Group 3 winner at Meydan last March; has some catching up to do on domestic form
runners.spotlight: Has the travel bug and many of her best results have been overseas, such as her 5f win in a Group 3 at Meydan last March; she's effective at 6f but has some catching up to do on her domestic form.

quotes.race: Nad Al Sheba Turf Sprint Sponsored By Emirates Skywards (Group 3) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I had the luck to have a good draw today, so I just played my card. It's the first time I've ridden Frost At Dawn. She's fast and I think she would travel even better over six furlongs - Mickael Barzalona, jockey.

runners.name: Sophias Starlight
runners.comment: Suited by good to soft/soft; front-runs; well held on reappearance in this last year
runners.spotlight: Best form on good to soft and slower surfaces; genuine front-runner who tends to be at her best in the later months of the turf season and was well held, after rearing at the start, in this race last year (20-1).

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Grant Tuer said Sophia's Starlight was in form coming here today and she loves that bit of juice in the ground. I don't think she's the easiest filly to keep right at home but she's had a bit of a freshen up and was tough today - Sam James, jockey.

quotes.race: William Hill Great St Wilfrid Handicap
quotes.quote: It's great for Grant (Tuer) and Nick (Bradley) as it was a big call to make with a three-year-old. Sophia's Starlight is improving and I felt like I was going to win easier. Danny (Tudhope) nearly got there, which quite annoyed me, but she was doing everything on her own. I always had the far side beat and she got everything out of her comfort zone a long way out - Sam James, jockey.

quotes.race: Winners Wear House Of Cavani Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: We could look at something like the Sky Bet Sunday Series with Sophia's Starlight but first she is entered at Carlisle on Wednesday  - Grant Tuer, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: As a juvenile her first run was encouraging but her two subsequent efforts gave us no hint of what she might achieve as a three-year-old. She won on her reappearance at Wolverhampton in May, and since then she's progressed with virtually every run, so much so that she won the Great St Wilfrid at Ripon the weekend before last. I was at Newmarket and watched the race on my mobile phone in a stable box, so I didn't get a very clear picture of who had won. It was a wonderful race for us as stables of our standing need these big Saturday winners for exposure. That was off a rating of 89, 20lb higher than when we kicked off in May. I ran her at York last week and she made the running again but clearly they went off too fast. If you'd stopped the race at the three-pole, the front eight horses filled the last eight places. We'll wait a couple of weeks before looking for another race. There's a fillies' Listed race at Ayr coming up and that's the likely next target. It would be wonderful for her breeding page to get some black type. 30-08-23

runners.name: Perfect Part
runners.comment: Won 5f debut as 2yo; needs to have improved plenty to take a hand on these terms
runners.spotlight: Won 5f debut at Beverley (good to firm) and wasn't beaten far in 6f Group 2 at York in August, but she needs to have improved plenty over the winter to take a hand on these terms.

quotes.race: Hilary Needler Trophy EBF Fillies' Conditions Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: We had Perfect Part out of the stalls two or three times in the last couple of weeks and she came out of them like an absolute rocket. And I saw she was a huge price, I thought they must know something we don't! We thought she was good.  She breezed absolutely brilliantly but she was a late foal and she hasn't got the size. I think that's why I got her so cheap. It was mitigating circumstances - Keith Brown, owner.

stable_tour.quote: I don't see why she shouldn't run well. She won in a time half a second quicker than the colts' race at Beverley. It was a good time and a good race. Sometimes they run green first time out but she was very professional. 10-06-24

1:15.race_name: William Hill Top Price Guarantee EBF Brocklesby Stakes (A Novice Stakes) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
1:15.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places on Round course (GoingStick 6.2)

runners.name: Ahead Of Fashion
runners.comment: February foal; 1,500gns yearling; by Dream Ahead; others have stronger-looking claims
runners.spotlight: February foal; 1,500gns yearling; already gelded; by Dream Ahead out of a maiden half-sister to three French winners; others have stronger-looking claims.

runners.name: Alkuwarrior
runners.comment: March foal; 11,000euros foal; by Alkumait; yard's 2yo strike-rate is modest
runners.spotlight: March foal; 11,000euros foal; from the first crop of Alkumait; half-brother to three winners, notably Sister Of Love (French 6f/7f including 2yo; RPR 81); dam 7f 2yo/8.4f winner; yard's 2yo strike-rate is modest.

runners.name: Archibald Ives
runners.comment: March foal; 13,000gns foal; by Arizona; disconcertingly, the only runner with headgear
runners.spotlight: March foal; 13,000gns foal; already gelded; by Arizona out of an unraced half-sister to the dam of 7f 2yo Group 2 winner Agartha; disconcertingly, the only runner fitted with headgear (blinkers and tongue-tie).

runners.name: Exclamation
runners.comment: February foal; 27,000gns yearling; by Acclamation; stable is 0-38 with 2yo runners
runners.spotlight: February foal; 27,000gns yearling; by Acclamation and the first foal of a French 1m4f/12.5f winner; stable is 0-38 with 2yo runners; opposed.

runners.name: Harome Star
runners.comment: Gelding by River Boyne; not certain to be sufficiently forward, being a May foal
runners.spotlight: Already gelded; River Boyne half-brother to five winners, notably Dream Mover (5.5f-7f including 2yo; RPR 97); dam 6f 2yo winner (94); not certain to be sufficiently forward, being a May foal.

runners.name: Harswell Calling
runners.comment: February foal; by Coulsty; one of four runners for this yard; market instructive
runners.spotlight: February foal; already gelded; Coulsty half-brother to 5f 2yo winner Call Me Harswell (RPR 78); dam last over 5f as 2yo both starts; one of four runners for this yard; market instructive.

runners.name: Kamakameleon
runners.owner: Hold My Beer, M Broughton & T Elphick
runners.comment: February foal; £30,000 yearling; represents last year's winning stable; interesting
runners.spotlight: February foal; £30,000 yearling; by Kameko; dam Group-placed 7f 2yo winner (RPR 99), half-sister to French 7f 2yo Group 3 winner Moon Ray; represents last year's winning stable and looks interesting.

runners.name: Kanishka
runners.owner: C Booth, P Boyle, S Coleby & S Smith
runners.comment: February foal; 20,000gns yearling; Coulsty half-brother to a Doncaster winner (sole start)
runners.spotlight: February foal; 20,000euros yearling; Coulsty half-brother to 7f Doncaster winner Red Rambler (only start; RPR 100) out of 7f-1m2f AW winner (including 2yo; 95), family of Notnowcato; attractively bred.

runners.name: Mighty Vega
runners.owner: D Macauliffe, A Don & Lds Bloodstock
runners.comment: March foal; 19,000gns yearling; from the first crop of Lucky Vega; likely type
runners.spotlight: March foal; 10,000euros foal, 19,000gns yearling; from the first crop of Lucky Vega; half-brother to five winners, notably Broxi (7f including 2yo; RPR 92); should come to hand early if taking after his sire.

runners.name: Monty Magoo
runners.comment: February foal; £4,500 yearling; by Kessaar; one of four Fell runners
runners.spotlight: February foal; £4,500 yearling; already gelded; by Kessaar and the first foal of an unraced sister to 6f Group 3 winner Heeraat; one of four Fell runners; market helpful.

runners.name: Normans Cay
runners.comment: March foal; £60,000 yearling; notable connections landed this prize in 2022; respected
runners.spotlight: March foal; 60,000gns yearling; Sioux Nation half-brother to German 1m 2yo winner Bright Smiles, out of 1m1f winner (RPR 65); notable connections landed this prize in 2022; commands respect.

runners.name: Son Of Sarabi
runners.comment: February foal; brother to a 5f AW winner; yard's 2yo strike-rate is ordinary
runners.spotlight: February foal; brother to 5f AW winner Sarafina Mshairi (RPR 61); dam unraced, out of 5f-winning half-sister to 7f 2yo Listed winner Look Around; yard's 2yo strike-rate is ordinary.

runners.name: The Boreham Bullet
runners.owner: The Upt North Darn South Syndicate
runners.comment: March foal; 1,000gns yearling; trainer has a good record in this contest; possibilities
runners.spotlight: March foal; 3,000euros foal, 1,000gns yearling; by Kessaar and the first foal of a 6f AW winner (RPR 78); trainer has landed this prize six times and had the runner-up last year; possibilities.

runners.name: Justice Twice
runners.comment: March foal; by Inns Of Court; trainer form (last two runners both won) bodes well
runners.spotlight: March foal; by Inns Of Court and the first foal of a Qatar 7f/French 8.5f winner, from family of top-class middle-distance performer Fantastic Light; trainer form (last two runners both won) bodes well.

runners.name: Lady Of Honour
runners.comment: April foal; 3,000gns yearling; by Bungle Inthejungle; stable is only 1-32 with 2yos
runners.spotlight: April foal; 1,000gns foal, 3,000gns yearling; by Bungle Inthejungle; dam 6f AW winner (RPR 75), half-sister to 7f/7.4f 2yo winner Uncs; stable is only 1-32 with 2yos.

runners.name: Lope Harswell
runners.breeder: W H R John And Partners
runners.comment: April foal; 5,750gns foal; from the first crop of Lope Y Fernandez; part of the Fell team
runners.spotlight: April foal; 5,750gns foal; from the first crop of Lope Y Fernandez; half-sister to two winners, notably Mai Alward (6f AW 2yo; RPR 67); one quarter of the Fell team; market informative.

runners.name: Sucking Diesel
runners.comment: March foal; by Aclaim; yard has a respectable record with 2yos; one to consider
runners.spotlight: March foal; Aclaim half-sister to four winners, notably Four Adaay (5f/6f; RPR 82); dam 5f winner (including 2yo; 88); yard has a respectable record with 2yos; one to consider.

4:45.race_name: William Hill NRMB On The Grand National Apprentice Handicap (Yorkshire Future Stars Series) (Div I)
4:45.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places on Round course (GoingStick 6.2)

runners.name: Bulldog Spirit
runners.comment: Winner of his only course start; back to form with 1m3f AW win on yard debut last week
runners.spotlight: Winner of his only course start, over 1m4f as a 3yo; career veered off track at 1m4f to 2m in 2024 but he wasn't at all inconvenienced by the return to 1m3f when making a winning yard debut at Southwell last week; drawn wide but a good test will suit over this furlong shorter trip; shortlisted.

runners.name: Arctic Fox

prev_owners.owner: Colin Taylor And Miss Kay Wilding

runners.comment: Mixed results since two Haydock wins in summer 2022; up against it on first run since July
runners.spotlight: Has had mixed results since winning two in a row at Haydock (1m3f, soft; 1m6f, good to firm) in the summer of 2022 and her season ended early in July last year; up against it over this short a trip after such a long break.

quotes.race: Queen Mother's Cup Handicap (For Lady Amateur Riders)
quotes.quote: It's the right time of year for the three-year-olds taking on the older horses. Arctic Fox has won three in a row and the step up in trip has not bothered her - Richard Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Annexation

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late S F Hui

runners.comment: Latest win over 1m1f at Gowran last spring; hasn't been  cracking it on AW for new yard
runners.spotlight: Three Flat wins in Ireland, most recently over about 1m1f at Gowran (soft) last spring, but although he won twice on Polytrack in his home country he hasn't been cracking it on AW for this yard; has come down the weights, but not by much, and needs a turnaround for the return to turf.

quotes.race: Crowne Plaza Hotel Dundalk Race & Stay Handicap
quotes.quote: Annexation missed the beat a bit and it was ideal as I had something to aim at the whole way. I think this is his ideal trip and he could win another one up here - Chris Hayes, rider

stable_tour.quote: He was really good at Navan in his maiden hurdle and we were aiming for the novice hurdle at Tipperary but he wasn't right. He seems in good form again and we might aim him at the For Auction Novice Hurdle at Navan. He handled soft ground on the Flat, although whether he'll be as effective on it over hurdles we'll see. We'll feel our way with him in the autumn and if he handles soft ground we can plot our way through the winter with him. 09-11-20

runners.name: Monteria

prev_owners.owner: The Late Reg Gifford And Bernice Walter

runners.comment: Good mark on past 1m2f form; not his old self in 2024; well held on recent hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Suited by 1m2f on soft or heavy but he didn't seem his old self in 2024 and was well adrift on a recent hurdle debut; has been given a chance at the weights, so a change in his fortunes can't be discounted.

runners.name: Bashful
runners.comment: Four Flat wins in 2023; subsequent wins hurdling, latest two in February; favourable mark
runners.spotlight: Four Flat wins at up to 1m2f in 2023, on ground ranging from good to soft to heavy, but subsequent successes have come over hurdles, the latest two in February following wind surgery; has a favourable mark to capitalise on now back on the Flat and he should go well.

stable_tour.quote: He's won a couple of times over hurdles and he's still probably not badly treated as a hurdler. He was high enough on the Flat and he struggled a bit but he's come down now. He's on a slight break but I'm sure he'll win plenty more races under both codes. He had a soft-palate operation and that will definitely help him. 26-07-24

runners.name: Destinado

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late K Abdullah

runners.comment: Eight wins last year included one over C&D; considered now below latest winning turf mark
runners.spotlight: Eight wins in 2024 included one over C&D (soft) last March; a later turf win came off 3lb higher than today so, despite a couple of minor AW runs after a short break, he can't be ruled out back on this track.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Build A Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Destinado is a very tough horse who's been very consistent since he joined James. This is his trip, he broke well and travelled nicely throughout the race - Aidan Keeley, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely little horse who helped to put us on the map. He went off the boil a bit but ran really well again when he was third at Southwell just before Christmas. Unfortunately, when he won at Lingfield a few starts back, he won by too far, so he shot up in the handicap and we're just having to fight that a little bit at the moment. 01-01-25

runners.name: Aim For The Moon
runners.comment: Won on first 1m2f attempt; has not gone on from that and slow starts can be an issue
runners.spotlight: She benefited from the step up to 1m2f when winning in fine style at Yarmouth (good) last spring but hasn't gone on from that, on turf or AW, and slow starts can be an issue; needs plenty to go right from high draw.

runners.name: Book Of Life
runners.comment: Both wins on AW; 0-12 on turf but this first attempt at 1m2f on grass might work for him
runners.spotlight: Both wins on AW, in France and for this yard at Wolverhampton (about 1m1f) in February; has yet to win on turf (0-12) but this is the first time he's attempted 1m2f on grass and it might just work for him.

runners.name: Whatacracker

prev_owners.owner: Mrs P A Johnson & C H Stephenson

runners.comment: Lightly raced since wide-margin 1m3f win in 2023; beaten fair way out on AW comeback
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced since wide-margin Carlisle win (1m3f, good to soft) in July 2023; two layoffs since raise queries and he was finding it a slog from some way out on AW comeback last month; has something to prove.

quotes.race: Lake District Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Middle Distance Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Ryan (jockey) did a great job and it's just a horse that's taken us a little while to figure him out. We started Whatacracker over seven because he shows lots of speed at home and we've gradually stepped him up. We thought he'd win at Newmarket last time and he disappointed us a bit but what we see at home is what we've seen on the track today - Mark Walford, trainer.

runners.name: Rock Armour
runners.comment: Matched best form when 1m2f winner at Newcastle in February; more to prove back on turf
runners.spotlight: Matched his best form when winning at Newcastle (1m2f; first-time blinkers) in February but beaten favourite twice since and now tries a different headgear experiment, with the suitability of turf (0-4) yet to be proved.

runners.name: Marioento
runners.breeder: Normandie Stud Ltd & Star Pointe Ltd
runners.comment: Lacks turf experience but improved to win latest AW start (extended 1m1f); should progress
runners.spotlight: All races on the AW, looking ready for a longer trip when keeping on over the extended 1m at Wolverhampton last month and seeing out the extra furlong well to win on that course since; the lack of turf experience isn't ideal but he's well connected and unexposed.

runners.name: Freddy Robinson
runners.breeder: Whitsbury Manor Stud And Mrs M E Slade

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Linsey Pallas & Mrs Claire Ellison

runners.comment: Broke Flat duck over 1m2f (good to soft) last June; fit from hurdling; weights chance
runners.spotlight: First Flat win at Beverley (1m2f, good to soft) last June; three heartbreakingly narrow defeats followed and, fit from hurdling, he's not weighted out of this if refitted cheekpieces (last worn in 2022) are helpful.

stable_tour.quote: He's named after my grandson. I don't know why he didn't win on the Flat, but he's won twice over hurdles. He likes jumping and won at Catterick last time. He came back from that a bit sore but he's fine now and we're just waiting for better ground. He'll probably end up going back on the Flat and he should be winning in that sphere. 03-04-24

runners.name: Bizarre Law
runners.comment: Long spell of modest results for two yards; of more interest when the ground dries out
runners.spotlight: Had form in more demanding company than this last summer but he went off the idea in his final starts for Andrew Balding and hasn't achieved a lot for new connections; of more interest when the ground dries out.

runners.name: Kalikapour
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Both wins on AW, 0-9 on turf; didn't stay 1m6f for new yard latest; up against it here too
runners.spotlight: Both wins on AW (0-9 on turf), most recently when scraping home under Gianluca Sanna at Southwell (1m4f) in December; not equal to the stamina task over 1m6f for new trainer last time; up against it here, too.

runners.name: Waistcoat
runners.comment: Maiden; minor handicap form for both yards and stamina is far from assured over new trip
runners.spotlight: Maiden who achieved only minor handicap form over 1m and 7f for Richard Hannon and was a weak finisher over the extended 1m at Wolverhampton for new yard last month (favourite); in light of that, he has plenty to prove over the new trip even though he hasn't had many chances.

runners.name: Muhib
runners.comment: Two fair 1m2f runs in AW handicaps for this yard; may yet improve back on turf
runners.spotlight: Shaped reasonably well in two 1m2f AW handicaps for this yard, although unable to pick up until the race was over at Newcastle last time; may yet prove capable of improvement but hard to predict whether it will come on turf.

runners.name: Life On The Rocks
runners.comment: Winless on AW over the winter; now 12lb lower than when successful on latest turf run
runners.spotlight: Many AW defeats (a narrow one on Tuesday) over the winter have resulted in a healthy drop in the weights and he's now 12lb lower than when winning on his latest turf start, at Windsor (good to firm; has won on soft) in August; much less to prove than most.

runners.name: Quick Away
runners.comment: Two AW wins this year at about 1m but stamina for this greater test is suspect
runners.spotlight: Had a good spell on AW but both recent wins have come at about 1m and her stamina for this test is suspect judged on the way she faded over the extended 1m1f at Wolverhampton last month.

runners.name: Stoic Syd
runners.comment: Two AW wins at 1m in 2024 but a weak finisher beyond that sort of trip and 5lb wrong today
runners.spotlight: Two AW wins at 1m early in 2024 but he didn't see out his one attempt beyond that sort of trip, on sand last June, and he's 5lb wrong today.

4:10.race_name: William Hill More Top Prices Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
4:10.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places on Round course (GoingStick 6.2)

runners.name: Bedouin Prince
runners.comment: Evens favourite when narrowly denied by a Ralph Beckett newcomer at Kempton
runners.spotlight: Evens favourite when narrowly denied by a Ralph Beckett newcomer at Kempton last November (1m) and the third has won since; half-brother to a 1m4f winner in France so going further this afternoon should help, as might the application of a hood; stable runs two.

runners.name: Believe In Success
runners.comment: 200-1 when beaten 25l over 1m on heavy ground at Newbury last October; has changed yards
runners.spotlight: 200-1 when beaten 25l over 1m on heavy ground at Newbury last October; has changed yards.

runners.name: Bouquet De Paris
runners.owner: Hm The King & Hm The Queen
runners.comment: Weak 16-1 chance when beaten 3.5l over 1m at Southwell having raced freely early on
runners.spotlight: Weak 16-1 chance when beaten 3.5l over 1m at Southwell having raced freely early on; open to improvement for his top yard.

runners.name: Chambers
runners.comment: Two runs at Bath, showing promise; might be one for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Both runs last year were on heavy ground at Bath, beaten a little over 7l on both occasions; probably contesting a better race here and perhaps one for handicaps.

runners.name: Jedhi Knight
runners.comment: Beaten in the region of 20l in his first two races and was behind Paratrooper in the first
runners.spotlight: Beaten in the region of 20l in his first two races and was behind Paratrooper in the first; limited appeal.

runners.name: Kuredu King
runners.comment: Insufficient promise last season to be of any great interest for now; has been gelded
runners.spotlight: 300,000gns yearling in a top yard but insufficient promise last season to be of any great interest for now; has been gelded; handicaps might be more suitable.

runners.name: Padre Bay
runners.comment: Weak 5-2 chance when only third of four runners at Wolverhampton two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Second foal out of a half-sister to Derby winner Adayar; at 5-2, he was weak in the market at Wolverhampton two weeks ago (1m4f) and never really threatened to win that race; cheekpieces are now added.

runners.name: Paratrooper
runners.comment: Could pick up a maiden en route to handicaps and may have a fitness edge over some
runners.spotlight: Frankel colt with a Derby entry but that looks optimistic after defeats at Wolverhampton (9.4f) and Southwell (1m3f); however, could pick up a maiden en route to handicaps and may have a fitness edge over some of these.

runners.name: Singing In Paris
runners.comment: 50,000euros breeze-up buy; gelded and stable not renowned for winning races with newcomers
runners.spotlight: 50,000euros breeze-up buy; eighth foal; half-brother to winners Pride Of Priory (1m2f-12.4f; RPR 105), Total Star (7.4f/1m; 93) and Moon Of Baroda (2m; 81); dam half-sister to 1m4f Group 2 winner Diamilina; has been gelded and stable not renowned for winning races with newcomers.

runners.name: Square Necker
runners.comment: 160,000euros yearling; brother to Listed-placed 1m/1m1f winner Titanium (RPR 104)
runners.spotlight: 160,000euros yearling; fifth foal; brother to Listed-placed 1m/1m1f winner Titanium (RPR 104) and half-brother to French winners Presage Nocturne (12.5f/1m7f; 111) and Skade (7f/1m; 78); dam Listed-placed 1m winner (100); top yard won this with a newcomer 12 months ago; has to be of interest.

runners.name: The Cursor
runners.comment: Well held at Newmarket last October but went off at just 7-2 and the ground was soft
runners.spotlight: A well-held fifth of seven runners at Newmarket last October (1m2f, soft) but this Frankel colt cost 400,000gns and did go off at only 7-2; could easily leave that run behind here.

runners.name: Too Darn Seanie
runners.comment: Only fifth at Chelmsford (1m2f) but showed ability and should improve; now blinkered
runners.spotlight: 88,000gns yearling; only fifth of eight at Chelmsford (1m2f) but showed ability and should improve; headgear soon turned to.

5:20.race_name: William Hill NRMB On The Grand National Apprentice Handicap (Yorkshire Future Stars Series) (Div II)
5:20.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places on Round course (GoingStick 6.2)

runners.name: Phone Tag
runners.comment: AW win in January; freshened up since lesser run later that month; turf winner
runners.spotlight: Back to winning ways at Chelmsford (1m2f) in January; freshened up since a lesser run at Newcastle later that month; has won on turf.

runners.name: Chillhi
runners.comment: Has generally struggled on the Flat and over hurdles since last May
runners.spotlight: Has generally struggled on the Flat and over hurdles since last May, including trailing throughout after a slow start at Newcastle (1m) 17 days ago; risky.

stable_tour.quote: A nice horse who had kissing spines and has been operated on. There were a few times last year when he went to win his races and his head came up. We were wondering whether he was thinking about the game, but we found out he had severe back problems. He's back in now and working away well and should be ready to run in a month. We think a lot of him and I reckon he could be all right. 03-04-24

runners.name: The Ganges
runners.comment: All four starts AW, finishing well held on handicap debut in November; can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Ran okay at Newcastle (7f) in October after long absence but well beaten on handicap debut there (7f again) the following month; off for a further four months ahead of this turf debut over a longer trip; can only be watched.

runners.name: Right Now
runners.owner: J Batty, R Chapman, R Parks & R Wardlaw
runners.comment: Decent Flat form earlier in career but well held in two recent hurdle runs for new yard
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m handicap hurdle on good ground for Rebecca Menzies last summer but well beaten in two hurdle races for new yard in recent weeks; placed in 1m2f maidens on the Flat in Ireland earlier in his career but it's hard to be confident about him after those recent hurdle efforts.

runners.name: Rainwater

prev_owners.owner: M & M Racing, Paul Byrne And Partner

runners.comment: In consistent form on AW this winter; just as good on turf; likely to go well again
runners.spotlight: Won at Wolverhampton (9.4f, Tapeta) in November and he's run well when reaching the frame in 1m2f AW handicaps on all five outings since; just as effective on turf, so should give another good account.

runners.name: Laser Focus
runners.comment: Struggled on AW lately but he's better on turf; could revive
runners.spotlight: Hasn't beaten a rival in three outings in recent weeks but his turf record on the Flat is far superior to that on AW and it wouldn't be a shock to see him revive back on the grass.

quotes.race: Clive Graham Memorial Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Laser Focus is in at Southwell on Friday and we might have to go again as he's won so easily. He's a good ground horse so it makes sense - James Owen trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's done well for us as a dual-purpose horse. He was a cheap purchase as we got him out of a claimer. He's won a good few for Pontoon Racing. He's currently on a break but will come back and have a spring/summer campaign. 01-01-25

runners.name: See Paris
runners.comment: Struggled on AW lately; change of stable and return to turf need to spark a revival
runners.spotlight: Won 1m1f turf race in Germany last year but has struggled on AW Flat for Ivan Furtado this winter; hopes are pinned on the combination of a change of stable and return to turf sparking a revival.

runners.name: Miners Gamble
runners.comment: Placed over C&D last autumn and third in two recent hurdle races; should be competitive
runners.spotlight: Placed over C&D (soft) off this mark last autumn; third in two juvenile hurdles in recent weeks and should be competitive back on the Flat.

quotes.race: Seagreen Is Done, Canter Believe It Handicap
quotes.quote: Miners Gamble is a slow learner. Brian has nursed him throughout his career and he's starting to put everything together now. Franny Norton, who rode him at Haydock earlier in the season, said he liked him and he'd improve. He had a visor on then, whereas he's racing in cheekpieces now and that's played a part. You can't get there too soon on him. He's a bit of a thinker, but I think he'll come on even though he's had plenty of runs now. He's finally got his head in front and I think he's a horse on the up - Ben Robinson, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He was a close third two weeks ago at Newcastle when he probably would have won had he not been squeezed at the start. We've just got to be careful with him before his races as he boiled over last year. He doesn't want to be in the paddock long, so it'll be in and out. He's entered at Chelmsford and Lingfield this Friday. 03-04-24

runners.name: Kingmont
runners.comment: AW maiden win last spring but has found it tougher in handicaps since
runners.spotlight: Won a 1m3f maiden at Kempton (AW) last April but she's found it tougher in handicaps since; the hood she wore when well held at Lingfield last month is quickly discarded; others are more obvious.

runners.name: Young Fire
runners.comment: Struggled on AW this year but now 10lb below the mark he defied on turf last autumn
runners.spotlight: Needs to step up on recent efforts but the fact he's now 10lb lower than when successful over the extended 1m2f at York (good to soft) last autumn makes this veteran a dangerous one to discount.

quotes.race: Haydock Park Apprentice Training Series Apprentice Handicap (Part Of The Racing Excellence Series)
quotes.quote: Young Fire a nice old horse and he seems to like the track. To get a winner for David (O'Meara) is quite good - Jack Doughty, jockey.

quotes.race: Each Way Extra At bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: The ground was a big plus for Young Fire and he's won off his last winning mark. He's a fair horse on his day and he's been running well this year without winning. He needs them to go quick and not get there too soon and it's all fallen nicely for him-Danny Tudhope, jockey

stable_tour.quote: He's ground dependent as he needs a bit of cut. He got a bit sick and won't be out until late May to early June. With his best form on slow ground, we're a bit restricted on where we go and it's likely he'll have a better end to the season. 09-05-22

runners.name: Powerful Response

prev_owners.owner: J Kay, T Goodair, A Skelton, C Johnson
Amo Racing Ltd, Mrs Doyle, Mr Morrin & PTN

runners.comment: Ended 2024 with two close calls over 1m2f at Newcastle but well held both starts this year
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 with two close calls over 1m2f at Newcastle but he's disappointed there in his two outings this year; fourth in this 12 months ago.

runners.name: Sisterandbrother
runners.comment: First AW win in January but below par twice since
runners.spotlight: Gained his first AW win at the ninth attempt, over 1m4f at Wolverhampton in January, but not in the same form on either start since; a return to turf needs to spark a revival.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I didn't want to hit the front too soon on Sisterandbrother as he was keen early and he picked them up well. I don't know how strong the race was but it was only his second run over hurdles so he could be a fun summer horse - Harry Cobden, jockey.

runners.name: Night Bear
runners.comment: Arrives in form from AW and 1lb below the mark he defied at Brighton last summer
runners.spotlight: Gained turf win number four off 1lb higher at Brighton last summer and has recorded consistent RPRs in defeat on AW this winter, finishing runner-up latest; not discounted.

quotes.race: Fairfax Saddles Grassroots Series Middle Distance Final Handicap
quotes.quote: I managed to get a breather into Night Bear and thought I had it in the bag from a fair way out as he was in a good rhythm. He stays well and kept finding - Clifford Lee. jockey.

quotes.race: 100% Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: The step up in trip really suited Night Bear. He has a bit of scope - Paul Mulrennan, jockey.

runners.name: Distinction

prev_owners.owner: Nick Willis And Mike And Wendy Yardley

runners.comment: Three turf wins last summer but recent AW form has been respectable at best
runners.spotlight: Three wins at about 1m in a productive spell on turf last summer but recent AW form doesn't point to a successful return to the grass.

quotes.race: Charles Stewart & Co Steve Evans Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Distinction has done us proud. The stiff mile and soft ground were ideal. He's declared for Kempton tomorrow but that was just a back-up in case he couldn't run here - John Mackie, trainer.

runners.name: Straya
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And Partner
runners.comment: Unplaced in all 13 starts, so needs improvement from somewhere back from 156 days off
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in all 13 starts and needs to find some improvement from somewhere on this first outing for five months.

runners.name: Corsican Caper
runners.comment: No significant impact on AW lately but won on turf off 8lb higher last autumn
runners.spotlight: Won stable debut at Chester (2m, heavy) last autumn but has struggled to make a significant impact on AW lately (beaten just over 6l when third latest); too well handicapped to dismiss back on turf, having dropped to 8lb below the mark he defied at Chester, but this trip looks a bit short.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Corsican Caper loves this type of ground, so he'll probably keep going through the autumn. He's not hard on himself and hopefully there's a bit of improvement in him. He'll cope with a bigger track as well and anything from a mile-six to two miles will suit him - Kevin Frost, trainer.

runners.name: Letmeseethecolts
runners.comment: 1m3f AW win in January; fair third latest; should go well back on turf
runners.spotlight: Came away at Southwell (1m3f) in January with a subsequent winner; pulled too hard when odds-on at Newcastle next time but wasted no time showing she's still in form when third there (12.5f) 25 days ago, despite being hampered 1f out; should go well back on turf.

runners.name: Run Of Luck
runners.breeder: E De Giles &  C Shand Kydd
runners.comment: Did well in turf handicaps last autumn; unexposed 4yo; player if fully primed
runners.spotlight: Made a good start to his handicap career over 1m2f on good/heavy last autumn, with a Bath win sandwiched between placed efforts; returns as an unexposed 4yo who could have more to offer; contender if fully primed after six months off.

3:05.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.9) (Watering)

runners.name: Mahons Glory
runners.owner: C Nightingale & Hold My Beer Partnership
runners.comment: Won on stable debut at Leicester three weeks ago; strong claims if backing that up
runners.spotlight: Two-time hurdle winner (good/good to soft) who scored at Leicester (2m6f, good to soft) three weeks ago on his stable debut and fourth chase start; needs to back that up but holds strong claims if in the same good heart.

quotes.race: Betting And Gaming Council Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: You wouldn't say Mahons Glory was sour, but he needed a change of scenery, so we said we'd give it a go. Lee [Edwards, jockey] schooled him a few weeks ago and was very confident that he'd run well - Dylan Cunha, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Get Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It didn't go to plan the last day but Mahons Glory still ran a cracker. We came here knowing he was in super form and the last day just knocked some of the gas out of him as he was very fresh. We've changed a few things like putting a new bit in his mouth for today and I think he'll have a future over fences. I think he's a graded horse and I'm not sure the three mile hurdling division is that deep and he'd be rated high enough to be thinking about those sorts of races - Patrick Neville, trainer.

quotes.race: Jewson Birkenhead, Price Street Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We didn't really expect it because we thought Mahons Glory would need it, like lots of mine who are needing the run. There are a few quirks in there but he's got a lot of ability. He's not the easiest horse to keep sound, and that's the challenge, but he's definitely got an engine. I think we'll look for a novice with a penalty somewhere - Dr Richard Newland, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a couple of little issues, but we've sorted them out now and he seems to be in great form. We put him over fences and he was second on his first run. Then we took him to Perth and he got a bit worked up. He's settling better now and we've freshened him up, and he might go back to Kempton on Boxing Day for the handicap hurdle he won last year. Otherwise, he might have an option over fences. He's got loads of ability if we can get his head right. 11-12-24

runners.name: Sine Nomine

prev_owners.owner: The Father & Daughter Partnership ( Robin Tate)
The Father & Daughter Partnership ( R Tate)

runners.comment: Kicked before the start in the Kim Muir (pulled up); 2-2 here and capable if back on song
runners.spotlight: Unseated/fell on her two outings at the end of last year and pulled up at Cheltenham recently; however, she was kicked before the start last time and was running pretty well when falling two out at Wetherby in December; won last season's Cheltenham Festival hunter chase and is 2-2 here; capable.

quotes.race: St. James's Place Festival Challenge Cup Open Hunters' Chase
quotes.quote: We've always tended to ride Sine Nomine that way and she seemed to enjoy that. I was hoping the race would pan out in her favour and we could just get a lovely tow into it, and it worked out. She's always finished off quite well and I thought if we were travelling coming down the hill then we'd be galloping at the top of it. I thought she wasn't going to see the last if I stayed where I was on the inside. I decided to pull out and hope for the best and I thought I was beat at that point. Credit to her, she's stuck her neck out and galloped up the hill - John Dawson, jockey.

runners.name: The Wolf

prev_owners.owner: McNeill Family and Prodec Networks Ltd

runners.comment: Back to form when second at Kempton recently and there's every chance he'll be bang there
runners.spotlight: 11yo who posted two quick wins in November (2m7f/2m6f, good/good to firm) and bounced back from lesser run at Carlisle when second at Kempton (3m, good) a fortnight ago; there's every chance he'll be bang there.

quotes.race: Racecourse Live Streams On Racing TV Extra Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The Wolf absolutely winged round for a circuit but we came round to the water jump and I thought I'd get a breather into him but he jammed the brakes on and I thought after that I'd probably be cooked. However, he showed a good attitude today, just winning probably helps those older horses and, obviously a veterans' chase last time he was able to get his head in front and he followed up today. He's a character but he's been a good servant for the yard - Sean Bowen, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Lord Sparky Veterans' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I can't remember the last time The Wolf won but he jumped well today on the whole and these races are why we kept him in training - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: CD Racing At tipstersempire.co.uk Beginners' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It rode a proper race, we got racing early and I couldn't have been more pleased with The Wolf. I was a little bit disappointed he got beat the last day but that's definitely more like it and hopefully he can progress over fences. I didn't want to be racing from the top of the straight with five fences to go, I knew I'd be able to rely on his jumping and have a crack at the last - winning rider Adrian Heskin.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a wind op since his run in the Scottish National and has loads of ability. He ran a cracker at Cheltenham on Saturday. He didn't jump well to start and didn't make it easy for himself but he'll go for the Becher Chase now. He'll win a nice one at some point - I'm sure he'll do it when we least expect it. If he does win a nice race, he may sneak into the bottom weights for the Grand National. 27-10-22

This talented handicapper hasn't won for a couple of seasons but you can't knock his resolve as he has run well in defeat, notably first time out this season when second to Lord Accord at Cheltenham. He heads there again on New Year's Day for the 3m2f handicap chase. Last time out in the Becher Chase he was a bit sticky early on and got detached, but he'll be much better suited to a smaller field at Cheltenham. 22-12-22

runners.name: Pedley Wood
runners.comment: Pulled up when bidding for Wincanton hat-trick; could be in the shake-up if bouncing back
runners.spotlight: Won at Wincanton (2m4f, good to soft) in December and followed up there in January (3m1f, heavy); pulled up there (3m1f, soft) last month and it's hard to be confident on the back of that, but a six-week break may have helped and he can be in the shake-up if rediscovering his progressive ways.

stable_tour.quote: He's just had a wind op as he was making a bit of a noise. We bought him after he won a point-to-point and he was showing us a bit but this has been in our mind for a while. His form had a nice boost from Mole Court at Cheltenham last week so hopefully he can be progressive. 10-11-23

4:15.race_name: Better Value With Racecourse Bookmakers Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
4:15.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.9) (Watering)

runners.name: Intrepide Sud
runners.comment: Made all in 2m maiden hurdle in October; mildly promising chase debut; can improve
runners.spotlight: Made all in 2m maiden hurdle at Uttoxeter (good) in October; pulled up in soft-ground handicaps in midwinter but he didn't do badly on his recent chase debut here (2m1f, good to soft), after a tentative start, and he'll be suited by the drying ground; can improve.

runners.name: Tactical Affair
runners.comment: Struggled in handicap chases of late but down 9lb in three runs; first-time cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Has made heavy weather of handicap chases in Britain but he's dropped 9lb in three runs and this easier test at 2m3f than at Exeter last week should suit; still some reservations, though, with cheekpieces now fitted.

quotes.race: Racing TV Black Friday Offer - Join For Just 12 Euros PM For An Entire Year Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Tactical Affair is a lovely horse and he will come on a lot. He's a fine big horse and only coming into himself - Jordan Gainford, rider.

stable_tour.quote: Ran reasonably well in the big sales bumper at Punchestown. He might start off in a bumper before going novice hurdling. 24-10-23

runners.name: Mortens Leam
runners.comment: Looked in great form for 2m5f win in January; might just need this after a break
runners.spotlight: Still sprightly after all these years and he didn't have to work too hard to gain a seventh chase win, at Fakenham (2m5f, good) in January; has won one of just two course starts but he might just need this after a break.

quotes.race: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing Handicap Chase (Northern Lights Middle Distance Series Qual')
quotes.quote: Mortens Leam travelled well and then got a bit tired, but he wasn't overly fit. He was coming back after fracturing his split bone after being hampered by a faller at Sedgefield on Boxing Day - Mike Hawker, trainer.

runners.name: Russian Ruler
runners.comment: Purple patch over hurdles in spring 2023 but out of sorts over fences and hurdles since
runners.spotlight: Progressive hurdler in 2023 when with Nicky Henderson but he couldn't get it together over fences or hurdles last season and no sign of a revival for new yard; best watched with cheekpieces returning in place of a hood.

stable_tour.quote: We've long held this lad in high regard, but there have been disappointments on the way. That said, he won his last two over hurdles and is a magnificent prospect for chasing - he could go a long way over fences. 30-10-23

runners.name: Red Circle
runners.comment: Chase promise in France; lengthy layoffs either side of tailed-off run on AW last February
runners.spotlight: Chase promise in France in May 2023 but pulled up over hurdles later that month and has had lengthy layoffs either side of being tailed off on AW last February; returns to fences with plenty to prove for new yard.

runners.name: Kayce Dutton

prev_owners.owner: F W Healy & K Leavy & M McDermott & Ms M Mullins

runners.comment: Solid effort when trying to give weight to an improver over 2m4f latest; thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Not yet a winner over fences but he's found some form since back from an absence and was up against it when trying to give weight to one with a bit of potential at Huntingdon (2m4f, good) recently; thereabouts.

runners.name: Inspiratrice
runners.comment: Comes into it on the pick of her chase form and should come on for recent return to action
runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner in 2022 (2m, good to soft) who comes into it on the pick of her chase form, a close second at Exeter (2m1f, soft) in late 2023; has to show that drying ground suits but she's entitled to have a say after needing her comeback run following an absence.

runners.name: Jaipaletemps

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Herve Guerin, Gabriel Leenders & David Lumet

runners.comment: Three chase wins in France; low key in Britain so far but one to keep an eye on
runners.spotlight: Three chase wins in France (at 2m1f-2m3f; heavy/very soft); some low-key runs for this yard but a bad mistake at the seventh set him back in Siam Park's race at Taunton recently; down another 4lb; one to keep an eye on.

runners.name: Siam Park
runners.comment: Taken well to fences and off the mark on second chase start, over 2m on good; can progress
runners.spotlight: A maiden over hurdles but he's taken well to fences and gave a bold display to get off the mark on his second chase start, at Taunton (2m, good) 19 days ago; back up 5lb; should progress further.

stable_tour.quote: He was a non-runner at Wincanton as he had a bit of pus in his foot. He fell in a point-to-point but would've finished second if he jumped the last and the form of that race looks serious. The winner, Butcher Hollow, was sold for £200,000 and bolted up at Galway the other week and the third has run well too. He's a nice sort with a smart pedigree. I think we'll start off over two miles but he'll get further in time. 10-11-23

He's nice and a lovely prospect for Brocade Racing, who allow us all the time we need. It was a good run from him at Wincanton before Christmas when he finished fourth after just getting tired and then he finished third there last week. I thought he ran well and he travelled nicely. I think that's decent form and he improved from his first run, although he probably wants slightly better ground. 18-01-24

1:55.race_name: Support On Course Bookmaker Day Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Qualifier) (GBB)
1:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.9) (Watering)

runners.name: Break Point
runners.comment: Regressive Flat maiden and down the field at 250-1 on recent hurdle debut at Warwick
runners.spotlight: Regressive maiden on the Flat and down the field at 250-1 on recent hurdle debut at Warwick.

runners.name: Goodbyemick
runners.comment: 0-13 in Irish points; highly questionable what he achieved when a remote fourth at Newbury
runners.spotlight: 0-13 in Irish points; highly questionable what he achieved when a remote fourth at Newbury.

runners.name: Ifwegetaway
runners.comment: Pulled up in a 2m4f British point a month ago and can only be watched for now
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in a 2m4f British point a month ago and can only be watched for now.

runners.name: Kientzheim
runners.comment: Three-time winner; failed to justify favouritism at Newbury but against useful opposition
runners.spotlight: Out of a half-sister to the yard's top-class hurdler Epatante; dual bumper winner in France and wasn't overly troubled to make a successful hurdle/stable debut at Kempton (2m, good); failed to justify favouritism at Newbury (soft) but that was against respected opposition; every chance.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes "Gaffer Of All Accas" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Kientzheim is related to Epatante, so it's lovely as she's a sweet filly too. She jumped really well until they really kicked on, but she's a novice. She'll have to grow up a bit more, but I'd think she can go up to some nicer races now. This was a lovely race to start in - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's closely related to Epatante and is in good form ? we like her a lot. She's neat and has been running in some pretty good AQPS Flat races, but we'll find a lot more about her here. 23-12-24

runners.name: Mexican Stan
runners.comment: Showed a tad more last time at Warwick but should be outclassed by the best of these
runners.spotlight: Showed a tad more last time at Warwick (beaten 10l) but should be outclassed by the best of these.

runners.name: St Pancras
runners.comment: Conceding 5lb to a really smart prospect when runner-up in the Grade 2 Adonis
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner who has raised his profile over hurdles, winning the Scottish Triumph at Musselburgh (good to soft) before finishing runner-up in the Grade 2 Adonis at Kempton; he probably faced mission impossible that day in conceding 5lb to a really smart prospect; hard to beat.

quotes.race: bet365 Scottish Triumph Hurdle (A Juvenile Hurdle) (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: St Pancras only ran a couple of weeks ago and we were anxious to get some more experience into him as quickly as possible as he's a lovely horse but just a bit novicey. We were wary even though it is a Listed race that I'd be waiting around until the end of February for some nice ground, so I'm glad we put him on the box with tomorrow's two runners. He did a lovely bit of work the other day and we're over the moon as that is our first Listed winner. We didn't think he'd have the pace of some of them as he probably wants further, but Kevin was patient and came with one good run - Toby Lawes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a good-looking horse. He's getting there now and is nearly ready to run. 29-04-24

I always thought he was a lovely horse. He came out really well from the Ascot race, where he was fifth, and the aim was to get him plenty of experience for the spring. I couldn't see that many options for him in February that were going to be run on decent ground and, luckily, I managed to persuade Andrew Wates to let me take him up to Musselburgh for the Scottish Triumph Hurdle. He's a big, scopey horse who stayed very well on the Flat and I wasn't sure he'd have the tactical speed for it. I thought he'd be running on and collecting some nice prize-money but it was a pleasant surprise how much speed he showed to win - the sprint times from the race were very good and his finishing percentage was outstanding. He has a terrific attitude and showed that in spades at Musselburgh. I'd like to get him qualified for the novices' championship final at Sandown on the last day of the season, so I suppose I might go for a qualifier at Newbury in a few weeks' time and then look at something like the juvenile handicap at Ascot at the end of March before going on to Sandown. That would be my plan A, but if he improves in spades again and takes himself to a rating where we think we should be having a crack at something like Aintree, that would be fantastic. I think we'll play it as sensibly as we can for the time being. 12-02-25

runners.name: Pretty Punctual
runners.comment: Has shown very little in a bumper and two maiden hurdles; new headgear tried here
runners.spotlight: Has shown very little in a bumper and two maiden hurdles; new headgear tried here.

runners.name: Al Mootamarid

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Mohammed Bin Khalifa Al Maktoum

runners.comment: Lost his way for Marco Botti but was a useful 1m2f winner and changed hands for 27,000gns
runners.spotlight: Lost his way for Marco Botti but was a useful 1m2f winner and changed hands for 27,000gns last October; could make a hurdler but this is no easy introduction.

runners.name: Baronetti
runners.comment: Last on one Flat start for the Crisfords; 150-1 when unseating at first on hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Finished last on one Flat start for the Crisfords; 150-1 when unseating at the first on hurdle debut.

runners.name: Dambuster
runners.comment: Won two of his eight races for Andrew Balding; joined this yard for 20,000gns
runners.spotlight: Didn't always look straightforward for Andrew Balding for whom his form petered out; however, he won two of his eight races (1m/1m2f) for that yard and has joined another good one to go hurdling; bought for 20,000gns.

runners.name: Pomeriggio
runners.comment: Regressed in Ireland and kicked off for this yard with a quiet run on the AW last month
runners.spotlight: Flat form deteriorated in Ireland and unseated on her sole hurdle start there; kicked off for this yard with a quiet run on the AW last month.

2:30.race_name: Cash Is King On Course Novices' Handicap Hurdle
2:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.9) (Watering)

runners.name: Lawmans Blis
runners.owner: G P S Heart Of Racing Ltd & Partner
runners.comment: Recent novice winner; raised 6lb ahead of handicap debut and doubt he's thrown in
runners.spotlight: Five-time Flat winner who got off the mark in an eventful 2m1f novice hurdle at Sedgefield (good); doubt he's thrown for this handicap debut after a 6lb rise but does at least come here on a high.

runners.name: Present De Vango
runners.comment: Absent for 520 days but has hinted at winning potential; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Absent for 520 days but has hinted at winning potential and now goes handicapping at a very ordinary level; market should be instructive.

runners.name: Get The Value
runners.comment: Second in a handicap last summer but very laboured in his two subsequent runs
runners.spotlight: Second on handicap debut at Newton Abbot last July (2m2f, good to soft) but very laboured in his two subsequent runs.

runners.name: Belle Montrose
runners.comment: Poor last time but went off at only 4-1 then after an improved run at Wincanton
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced maiden; reportedly never travelled last time at Sedgefield but went off at only 4-1 there after an improved run at Wincanton; could yet come good.

runners.name: Rockette
runners.comment: Latest run needs forgiving but she has the form to warrant a second look
runners.spotlight: Showed a bit for Dan Skelton and again when fifth of 16 runners on debut for this yard at Warwick (2m3f handicap) after a long absence; latest run needs forgiving but she has the form to warrant a second look.

runners.name: Fillyfudge
runners.comment: Has won three on the Flat and two places over hurdles include one in a handicap
runners.spotlight: Has won three on the Flat and two places over hurdles include one in a handicap (in November); ran only okay on the AW a month ago but wouldn't discount.

runners.name: Penthouse Poppet
runners.comment: Ex-Irish; 0-11 in points and 0-8 as a hurdler; lots to prove, even off this low a mark
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish mare who is 0-11 in points and 0-8 as a hurdler; has a lot to prove, even off this low a mark.

runners.name: For You Buzz
runners.comment: Only had the four races but his handicap debut at Hereford was instantly forgettable
runners.spotlight: Only had the four races but his handicap debut at Hereford was instantly forgettable (2m, good; 10-1; finished behind Mambo Beat); could yet raise his game but doubts for now.

runners.name: Freedom Day
runners.comment: This is his handicap debut and that offers some hope, especially with Brian Hughes booked
runners.spotlight: Flat winner for the Gosdens but tailed off in his three completions over hurdles; this is his handicap debut and that offers some hope, especially with Brian Hughes booked.

runners.name: Mambo Beat
runners.comment: In first-time cheekpieces when a close third on good ground at Hereford 21 days ago
runners.spotlight: Sole Flat win came on soft ground but seemed to improve for the good surface when not beaten far into third at Hereford three weeks ago when tried in first-time cheekpieces; possibilities if he's as good again.

runners.name: No Guarantee
runners.comment: 14-race maiden who isn't progressing and he's 9lb of the weights here; hard to warm to
runners.spotlight: 14-race maiden who isn't progressing and he's 9lb of the weights here; hard to warm to.

4:50.race_name: Service With A Smile Oncourse Bookmakers Handicap Hurdle
4:50.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.9) (Watering)

runners.name: Calagogo
runners.comment: Form for Gordon Elliott is a fading memory; an okay run three starts ago but poor since
runners.spotlight: His useful form for Gordon Elliott is a fading memory; didn't run too badly three runs ago but poor since.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Calagogo loved the ground and the cheekpieces really helped him - Jordan Gainford, rider.

stable_tour.quote: A good servant. He's won three for us this year and was a good fourth at Cheltenham recently. We might try to qualify him for the Pertemps, he was pulled up in a qualifier at Punchestown on Sunday, but he'll be a lovely horse to go chasing with next year. 15-11-21

runners.name: Kaproyale
runners.owner: The Galloping Dentist At 45 The Green
runners.comment: Quiet stable debut but will at least enjoy these conditions and he does have track form
runners.spotlight: Won a hunter chase here last May (2m1f, good) but only sixth of the eight runners on debut for current yard in a handicap at Sedgefield on Boxing Day (2m3f, good to soft); he will at least enjoy these conditions and he does have track form.

quotes.race: Racing TV Novices' Hunters' Chase
quotes.quote: I didn't want to take the running up until where the new last fence was. I expected Kaproyale to win like that and this ground is important to him - Zac Baker, jockey.

runners.name: Maggies Boy
runners.comment: Runner-up on handicap debut at Sedgefield (2m4f, good) and he's bred for this longer trip
runners.spotlight: Only his fifth start when runner-up on handicap debut at Sedgefield (2m4f, good) and he's bred for this longer trip; cheekpieces added; considered.

runners.name: Teds Friend
runners.comment: His struggles continued when a well-held fourth at Southwell on Thursday
runners.spotlight: Should be well handicapped but, despite returning to good ground, his struggles continued when a well-held fourth at Southwell on Thursday.

quotes.race: Ann Hitchings Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ted's Friend probably got there a bit soon. He travelled so well into it and he's done it well, with a bit in hand. The further he's gone the better he went - Max Kendrick, jockey.

runners.name: Boskill Borden
runners.comment: Well beaten on UK debut but at 2m and he did place over 2m6f in Ireland
runners.spotlight: Won a handicap in Ireland (2m, soft) but was 50-1 when beaten a long way on stable debut at Ludlow (2m, soft; tried cheekpieces) and he's just 3lb lower for this; did place over 2m6f in Ireland so this longer trip may help.

quotes.race: Frank Gillane Memorial Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Boskill Borden ran here in June and he seemed to handle the track. He's a very professional horse and nothing bothers him. There might be another one in him - Paul Fahey, trainer

runners.name: Tropical Speed
runners.comment: Quiet in two runs for this yard but returning to drier ground could make a big difference
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden; has yet to show any benefit from joining Olly Murphy but returning to drier ground could make a big difference.

runners.name: Dublin To Milan
runners.comment: Still relatively early days but significant improvement is required
runners.spotlight: Finished well down the field on handicap debut at Wetherby (2m3f, soft; 14-1) two months ago; still relatively early days but significant improvement is required.

runners.name: My Louise
runners.comment: Dual bumper winner who goes handicapping at a low level and needs checking in the betting
runners.spotlight: Hasn't offered much since winning two bumpers last season (good/AW) but she goes handicapping at a lowly level and needs checking in the betting.

runners.name: Arctic Saint
runners.comment: Has placed form and it wasn't a bad run after wind surgery at Chepstow
runners.spotlight: Hit the frame in two handicaps (2m4f/2m5f) towards the end of last year and it wasn't a bad run after wind surgery at Chepstow; each-way claims.

runners.name: Tip Top Tonto
runners.comment: Has won off 4lb higher but nothing positive to take out of his last four races
runners.spotlight: In April last year he won a Fakenham handicap off 4lb higher but there's been nothing positive to take out of his last four races.

stable_tour.quote: He came to us in the spring and we chose to get a bumper run into him before giving him a break. He could be quite keen so we wanted to see how he would go if he was dropped in and the result was encouraging. He has schooled well and is one to watch out for in the spring over 2m4f. He has touch of class. 12-10-21

runners.name: Rays The One

prev_owners.owner: Mr & Mrs Ray Jenner And Partner

runners.comment: No hurdle win since 2022 and struggles to follow one good run with another
runners.spotlight: Signs that he might have turned a corner when third at Huntingdon but that theory was soon quashed on his return visit; hasn't won over hurdles since 2022.

runners.name: Nowyouvebinandunit
runners.comment: 11-race maiden but chased home the favourite over C&D 19 days ago
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden but chased home the favourite over C&D 19 days ago and that was back on this drier ground; in the mix.

runners.name: Caballo Diablo
runners.comment: Has achieved little under rules and not ideal that he's 4lb wrong at the weights
runners.spotlight: Three-time point winner who has achieved little under rules and not ideal that he's 4lb wrong at the weights.

runners.name: Top Drawer
runners.comment: Longstanding maiden who has been off for a long time and he's 8lb out of the weights
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden who has been off for a long time and he's 8lb out of the weights.

3:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.9) (Watering)

runners.name: Greatness Awaits
runners.comment: Fader last time but in a Class 4 handicap and this is much a better opportunity
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who won back-to-back Class 5 2m handicaps at Ludlow (soft) and Hereford (good) before finishing down the field in a higher grade at Southwell (2m4f); probably remains in good form and this is easier.

stable_tour.quote: A consistent run-of-the-mill handicapper. Coming back to 2m for those conditional hands and heels races suits him down to the ground and he's not far away from winning. 19-02-25

runners.name: Matchless

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: Four hurdle wins; he's not one for maximum faith but the same is true of his rivals
runners.spotlight: The last of four hurdle wins came in a seller at Plumpton in November (2m, good); well beaten on chase debut two runs back but again disappointed when favourite for a claiming hurdle at Catterick last time (behind Honneur d'Ajonc); he's not one for maximum faith but the same is true of his rivals.

quotes.race: Philip Kirby Racing Club Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Nothing went right for Matchless at Doncaster, he ran keen and was caught wide, and you could put a line through that. He was fresh afterwards, this looked a winnable race and the owner was happy to come. The ground was a question mark but he'd run in a Group 3 on soft/heavy and only been beaten seven lengths.
