He loves jumping and he has a good attitude. We'll give him a break now, as I think he'll be better on better ground, and find a nice novice handicap for him in the spring-Alan O'Keeffe, assistant trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Matchless had a nice first run, I liked him and I thought if I got to make the running he'd win. He is still a little bit green and he is a nice colt with a nice pedigree. Aidan doesn't mind running a good horse down here and I have to compliment the staff on the ground - Seamie Heffernan, rider

stable_tour.quote: He won a maiden at Listowel last September on his second start and is probably a mile or 1m2f type. It was a bit messy for him at Leopardstown on Sunday. The horses that went forward all stayed there and we dropped him in because we felt the pace would be hot. Hopefully he'll make a big jump forward next time. 12-04-21

Aidan O'Brien trained him before we got him, and I understand he was used as a pacemaker for the Ballydoyle stars. Life is obviously different for him and he really enjoys life. He had a good spring, winning back-to-back races at Doncaster over 1m2f. That little spell saw his handicap mark shoot up to 87, and despite some good runs in defeat is now down to 84. I hope to get him out again soon and bag a third seasonal win before we give him the winter off. I will certainly be looking to Town Moor or another similar galloping track. 29-08-22

runners.name: Honneur Dajonc
runners.comment: Narrowly beaten by the favourite in a seller on Friday and faces easier opposition here
runners.spotlight: Bang there in three of his last five races, the latest only yesterday when narrowly beaten by the favourite in a seller at Stratford (2m3f, good); faces easier opposition here and should be hard to beat, but he can have his off days.

quotes.race: AK Bets Watch All UK Racing Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Honneur d'Ajonc is quite quirky and it's taken a while to get him where he is today. He doesn't like being crowded and didn't enjoy being boxed in on the rails at Perth last time. Today he's had the dream run round - Alex Chadwick, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Tribute Cornwall Pale Ale Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We thought we'd lost Honneur D'Ajonc at Kempton last season and it took a long time for him to recover from that, so it's very rewarding to see him going the right way now. He's a proper horse and exactly what we thought he was going to be. This would have been the limit of his stamina but he's versatile and has grown over the last year - Jane Williams, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him at Doncaster in the spring. He's won for us and ran very well the other day on heavy ground at Haydock over 2m3f, which is good as it opens up more avenues. I think he'll stay further. New owners at my yard have got involved with him and they've purchased another horse recently, so they're having a good bit of fun. 01-01-25

runners.name: Blackijo Dagrostis
runners.comment: 0-8 in points; 40-1 when pulled up in a small-field novice hurdle at Ludlow; lots to prove
runners.spotlight: 0-8 in points; 40-1 when pulled up in a small-field novice hurdle at Ludlow; has a lot to prove.

runners.name: Black Tonic
runners.comment: Ability respected but has a bit on at these weights and has been a long-time absent
runners.spotlight: Has a bit on at these weights and has been a long-time absent; however, he was travelling easily when departing late on in a Killarney handicap on final outing in August 2023; possibilities should the market speak favourably.

runners.name: Its A Good Name
runners.comment: Lightly raced; tailed off in a Class 4 handicap in January on the back of a long absence
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced ex-French winner but was tailed off in a Class 4 handicap in January on the back of a long absence; current wellbeing is too big an issue.

runners.name: Razzo Italiano
runners.comment: All three wins have come in low-grade hurdle races but these terms aren't favourable
runners.spotlight: All three wins have come in low-grade hurdle races, including one over C&D; wouldn't read too much into recent Flat failures when outclassed in novices but these terms aren't favourable.

3:55.race_name: Caldwell Filtration 50th Year Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
3:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: Chase 6.1, Hurdle 7.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Range
runners.comment: Jumping can be an issue but he ran well last time; can have big say granted a clear round
runners.spotlight: He's fallen on two of his five chase starts but won at Chepstow (2m3f, good to soft) in November and wasn't beaten far when last of three in a warm little handicap at Exeter (2m1f, good) three weeks ago; this is a drop in grade and he can have a big say if putting in a clear round.

quotes.race: Noahs Ark Childrens Hospital Charity Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Range is still quite novicey but it was great to see him jump nicely and win. He fell last time but almost needed to make a mistake at some point, to learn to respect the fences as he was quite blaze over them sometimes. Sam [Twiston-Davies] said the ground had probably dried out more than we would have liked, so it's good he won despite wanting softer going. He's just got to learn to settle more but we always thought he might end up being a sort of Welsh National horse. He's one to look forward to - Sam Thomas, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's getting the hang of things and maturing all the time. He ploughs through soft and heavy ground so we'll try to get him out in the next couple of weeks under a penalty after his win at Chepstow last month. He's definitely going in the right direction this season. 05-01-24

runners.name: Georgi Girl
runners.comment: Well beaten at Sandown in second chase but no surprise if she bounces back with bold show
runners.spotlight: Four-time hurdle winner (2m/2m5f) who made a pretty encouraging chasing debut in a Listed mares' novice at Exeter (2m1f, good to soft) last month; disappointing in handicap chase at Sandown (2m4f, good) since but she's better than that; no surprise if she bounces back with a bold show.

quotes.race: Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Sponsor Walking With The Wounded)
quotes.quote: I had loads of horse turning in and hopefully Georgi Girl shouldn't get penalised too much. Going up that hill normally you feel like you're walking, particularly when it's sticky, but she dealt with the ground beautifully - Charlie O'Shea, rider.

runners.name: King Arise
runners.comment: Below par at Leicester recently but progressive over fences previously; cheekpieces go on
runners.spotlight: Won at Wincanton (2m4f, good to soft) in December on second chase start and runner-up the next twice, including over C&D; also effective on good ground; below par at Leicester three weeks ago but he'll be a major player if swiftly returning to form in first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Coqolino
runners.breeder: S A R L Haras Du Logis Saint Germain
runners.comment: Runner-up last August/October but not in the same form this year and now 0-17 over fences
runners.spotlight: Runner-up off this mark twice in a row last August/October but this 10yo hasn't been in the same form on either run this year; now 0-17 over fences.

quotes.race: Navan Members Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Coqolino gave us a scare at the last but he did it well and was entitled to. He's a gorgeous horse and a chaser in the making - Denise Foster, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Didn't run in the second half of last season so he remains a maiden over fences. Hopefully he can pick up a chase somewhere along the way. He wants a trip and plenty of cut in the ground. 24-10-23

4:30.race_name: Abode Estate Agents Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
4:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: Chase 6.1, Hurdle 7.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Broughshane
runners.comment: Creditable third on chasing debut and the step back up in trip could work in his favour
runners.spotlight: Won two handicap hurdles in the autumn (2m3f/2m4f, good to soft/good) and returned to form with close third of six on this month's chase debut at Fontwell (2m3f, soft); there's room for improvement in his jumping and the step back up in trip could work in his favour; unexposed and respected.

stable_tour.quote: He showed some good form over hurdles last season, finishing third on Welsh National day and looking like he was going to go close when falling three out back at Chepstow in January. He got off the mark first time out this season at Fontwell and could be going over fences now. He handles soft ground well and will stay three miles. 06-11-24

runners.name: Poppa Poutine
runners.comment: Won at Wincanton in December but soundly beaten then pulled up the next twice
runners.spotlight: Won off this mark at Wincanton (3m1f, soft) in December and is also effective on good ground; not discounted but he's been soundly beaten then pulled up the last twice and needs to get back on track.

quotes.race: Play Tote Cheltenham Ten To Follow Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Poppa Poutine is only six, amazingly. He'll be a good stayer for years to come and goes on a lot worse ground. He'll be the type for those regional Nationals. He's a great ride and is honest. He'll take you wherever you want to be, but he's a bit idle when he gets there. At the same time, he's a grand horse - Sam Twiston-Davies, jockey.

runners.name: Almazhar Garde
runners.comment: In good form in the autumn; lesser run last month but after a break and he's not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Runner-up three times in a row in the autumn (2m6f-3m, good/good to firm); not in the same form at Hereford (3m1f, soft) last month but that was after a 97-day break and he's back on better ground today; not ruled out.

stable_tour.quote: He has been very unlucky this season as he's been second in both the Southern and North Yorkshire Nationals, having just been touched off last time over 3m6f. We had been looking at Cheltenham next month, but I think we might leave him this year as he's a long-term Grand National hope. He's in great heart and we're looking at something like the Grimthorpe at Doncaster, or if he missed that the Midlands National would be a nice target. 09-02-22

runners.name: Everythingsontick
runners.comment: Two wins last season but just one outing this term, when unseating mid-race in January
runners.spotlight: Two wins last season during his first chasing campaign (2m6f/3m1f, good to soft/soft); unseated mid-race in January on sole run this term; retains potential but it remains to be seen what sort of form he's in.

quotes.race: Dine&Stay @ The Jolly Sportsman Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (For The Gay Kindersley Trophy)
quotes.quote: You have to be in the right place at the right time shall we say. I've had that sort of thing happen to me in the past so it works both ways. I was lucky the gaps appeared when they did -  Jockey Izzie Marshall speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Carrigmoorna Rowan
runners.comment: Failed to progress over hurdles but this point winner could improve now sent chasing
runners.spotlight: Failed to progress over hurdles but he didn't run badly at Market Rasen this month when back from an absence and this point winner is a possible improver now switched to fences; no surprise to see a good run.

runners.name: Montregard
runners.comment: Pulled up at Wetherby last time but looked promising previously and he remains unexposed
runners.spotlight: Won at Market Rasen (3m, good) in November on second chase start and third of five in warm race at Taunton (2m7f, good to soft) a fortnight later; pulled up at Wetherby since and something to prove on the back of that, but this unexposed 6yo retains potential and is not ruled out.

quotes.race: Full Circle Series At Punchestown Festival Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was really disappointed with Montregard at Newcastle but I think the cheekpieces have helped him here and he's toughed it out well - Tom Lacey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice horse of JP McManus's who won his maiden at the second attempt over hurdles when last seen at Warwick in April. I was really pleased with him that day; he was green but toughed it out and stayed on nicely. I'd say he's progressed through the summer and is set to return in a 0-105 handicap hurdle at Uttoxeter on Friday. He'll ultimately jump a fence too. A nice prospect. 20-12-23

runners.name: Good Work
runners.comment: Off mark at 27th attempt here in January; pulled up since but over 3m6f on heavy ground
runners.spotlight: Serial runner-up who got off the mark at the 27th attempt here (3m2f, good to soft) in January; pulled up at Exeter since but 3m6f on heavy ground proved too much and he could be in the mix if that hasn't left a mark.

runners.name: Fern Hill
runners.owner: J E Harrison & Mrs S Case
runners.comment: Not easy to win with but some positive runs of late and has an each-way shout
runners.spotlight: 10yo who is not easy to win with (just 1-19 over fences) but he's produced positive runs on two of his last three starts; has an each-way shout.

runners.name: Caeruleum
runners.comment: Won two in a row in December; 3m5f proved too far at Bangor last month; one to consider
runners.spotlight: 7yo for whom things clicked in December with two comfortable wins (3m2f, soft/good to soft); weakened at Bangor (3m5f, soft) last time and could tap back into his previously progressive ways now back down in trip.

runners.name: Konfusion
runners.comment: Novice who has been showing progressive form and could improve further now up in trip
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 7yo who won at Wetherby (2m3f, soft) last month on second chase start and kept on for a creditable third at Hexham (2m4f, good to soft) last time; ran well at up to 2m7f over hurdles and he's open to further improvement now back up to a staying trip; key player.

quotes.race: Entertain In Style At Wetherby Racecourse Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Konfusion got a slight strain, nothing serious, which was why he's been off since Sedgefield and we hoped he'd be fit enough. He's a nice horse - Joel Parkinson, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Militaire
runners.breeder: R D & J S Chugg & Millhouse Stud
runners.comment: Went close over 2m4f on second chase start but faded over 3m subsequently
runners.spotlight: Close second at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft) last month on his second chase start and on that evidence this lightly raced 8yo should be breaking his duck imminently; however, he was outstayed when a soundly beaten third at Chepstow (2m7f, good) a fortnight ago and needs to prove his stamina.

runners.name: Nine Nine Nine
runners.comment: In good form at favourite course Leicester but this slightly longer trip may be a negative
runners.spotlight: Has run well when second at favourite course Leicester (2m6f/2m4f, heavy/good to soft) the last twice; however, the different track and longer trip could be negatives, while he's 2lb out of the handicap today.

quotes.race: Best Ticket Deals Online @ leicesterracecourse.co.uk Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Nine Nine Nine has been running well, but we've just been having mishaps with him. He's still got a lot to learn, so hopefully he can learn from that - Sarah-Jayne Davies, trainer.

5:05.race_name: Visit Warren Greatrex Racing At Rhonehurst Handicap Hurdle
5:05.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: Chase 6.1, Hurdle 7.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Mahland
runners.comment: Well beaten both starts this term and needs to have been revived by recent wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Progressed well last season, signing off with a 4l win from the front over 3m at Ffos Las; soundly beaten both starts this term and needs to have been revived by recent wind surgery; all rules runs so far on soft/heavy.

stable_tour.quote: It was such a shame Chepstow was abandoned last weekend as he was going to run in the novice handicap chase run in Val Dancer's honour, so we ran him in a handicap hurdle at Ffos Las instead. He's a lovely horse to deal with and is very straightforward. We'd be looking for him to go over longer trips when chasing in time and he certainly doesn't mind some cut in the ground. He needs conditions like that. 16-01-25

runners.name: Party Business
runners.comment: Fifth last time was step back in right direction; longer trip a plus; high on the list
runners.spotlight: Recent form-figures look unpromising but he has had excuses, and fifth over 2m4f here last time was a move back in right direction; headgear back on and this step back up in distance should suit; high on the list.

quotes.race: EFT Construction Handicap Hurdle (Grade 3) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was anxious watching Party Business early on. He just didn't travel, I presume it was a lot to do with the trouble he got into at Cheltenham - he's going to remember that as he was nearly brought down twice. He didn't pick up the bridle, he didn't travel and he didn't jump and he was obliged to go very wide turning for home. I'd said to Charlie 'if you get the opportunity, don't take it up before the last' and three out we were in front and I thought it was going to be a long way but he was tough. He fell in the Challow when he was going so well and nearly getting brought down at Cheltenham was very tough for him but he was a well-handicapped horse and he's shown that today. We'll go chasing with him next season. He's bred to be a chaser so let's get on and do that - Ian Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Howden Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought that was an impressive performance. Party Business is a quality horse but you never know when you're running against the big yards what might be in there. I think the form should stand up and long term I had thought the EBF Final at Sandown would be an option for him, although we've probably blown our mark now. I think he'll stay further - Ian Williams, trainer.

runners.name: Bertie B
runners.comment: Seventh and pulled up last two starts; bit to prove all of a sudden
runners.spotlight: Won well at Plumpton (2m5f, good to soft) in December but he was only seventh next time and then pulled up at Ascot; bit to prove all of a sudden.

runners.name: Getaway Drumlee
runners.comment: Poor over fences last time but could have untapped potential over this longer trip
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner; creditable efforts in first two handicap chases (2m/2m3f) but then ran badly when favourite at Wetherby; needs to bounce back over hurdles but could have untapped potential over this longer trip.

quotes.race: yeeehaaa.bet Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I think Getaway Drumlee can be all right. He'll overcome a fence as well, but I'd imagine he'll go on through May and then we'll give him a break before we go chasing with him next season. He ran a blinder at Doncaster and better than I expected him to. It was great to see him follow up as he jumped and travelled beautifully, and it's nice to see Beau [Morgan, jockey] getting a couple of nice winners for us towards the end of the season. He had a couple of nasty problems - a fibrillating heart and a fractured fetlock - after Sandown when he last ran before this season, so he's had to overcome quite a bit. He's got a good attitude and it's brilliant to see his head back in front for his owners, who have shown so much patience with him - Ben Pauling, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We have a lot of lovely novices this season and among them is Getaway Drumlee. He joined us after winning his point-to-point at Tattersalls Farm in the spring and had been working so well I expected a big show from him on his rules debut over hurdles earlier this month and he did not disappoint. We started him off at Hereford over 2m3½f and although a little green he won very comfortably and can only have learned from the experience. I think he could be versatile regarding his trip as his point win came over 3m, yet I could see him being effective over 2m if asked. He is nice horse and although not too big he jumps well and has a lovely attitude. 26-10-22

runners.name: Double Click
runners.comment: Arrives in good form in the mud; today's forecast faster ground a possible concern
runners.spotlight: Won by 10l at Ffos Las (2m4f, soft) in January, his fourth hurdling success, and was second over the same C&D (heavy) last month; evidently in good nick and shapes as if he'll stay this far, but today's forecast faster ground could be a concern.

quotes.race: DragonBet Still Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Double Click does need a double click and you have to get him into a nice rhythm jumping well. He's had a couple of runs this season, but he might have needed the runs, and the team has him going very well. He likes the new trip and I couldn't be happier - Will Featherstone, jockey.

quotes.race: Ashcroft Services Conditional Jockeys' Training Series Handicap Hurdle (Racing Excellence Series)
quotes.quote: It's great for young Will [Featherstone, jockey]. It's his fourth winner for us and his third this season, so he's going well and I'm thrilled for him. Double Click likes soft ground, he likes two miles and he likes passing horses, so the combination kind of worked - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A grand sort, he's going to keep improving and will be ready to run at the end of this month. 15-11-23

Twice a winner over hurdles, he loves soft ground so you can forget his last run when it was too quick at Warwick at the end of May - he finished last of three behind Allihies. I'm certain there's more to come from him and he's nicely handicapped. 28-09-23

runners.name: Kaituna River
runners.comment: Has gone backwards since good second over fences at Southwell; cheekpieces fitted
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 8yo; ran well when second in 2m4f handicap chase at Southwell in December but has gone backwards in two outings since; returns to hurdling and now fitted with cheekpieces.

runners.name: Clondaw Royale
runners.comment: Holding form well, third at Catterick last month, and in the mix again
runners.spotlight: Has been running well for conditional rider Benjamin Macey, third of 11 at Catterick (3m1f, good to soft) last month; in the mix again.

quotes.race: Thank You John Burgess Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Clondaw Royale is a really nice horse and I'm delighted to get that win with him. The further he went, the better he got. Hopefully, he'll be a nice stayer in the future - James Smith, jockey.

runners.name: Juan Bermudez
runners.comment: Seems out of sorts and best watched unless there's a market move in his favour
runners.spotlight: Won two novice hurdles at Stratford in June 2024 but has cut little ice since, including on stable debut (after wind surgery) last time; falling in weights but best watched unless there's a market move in his favour.

runners.name: Marty Byrde
runners.comment: Off since novice hurdle win in March 2023; carries risks but may still be unexposed
runners.spotlight: Placed in two heavy-ground bumpers early in 2022; no impact first three starts over hurdles but improved to win novice at Exeter (2m5f, good to soft) in March 2023; has been off since; carries risks after such a long absence but should stay this far and may still be unexposed.

runners.name: Copshill Lad
runners.comment: Hasn't built on Stratford win, fading when fifth at Wincanton last time; needs more
runners.spotlight: Made stable debut in first-time cheekpieces (after wind surgery) when narrowly winning over 2m6f at Stratford; hasn't built on that, fading when fifth at Wincanton last time; just 1lb lower and needs more.

stable_tour.quote: He runs in the famous colours of Middleham Park Racing and made a winning debut when landing a Stratford bumper in May. We have tinkered with his wind over the summer, and he is now back in full work. He should be ready to resume next month with a view to tackling National Hunt novice hurdles. 13-10-22

runners.name: Risk Dargent
runners.comment: Yet to win a handicap and disappointing from a career-low mark last time
runners.spotlight: Yet to win a handicap and was disappointing from a career-low mark when sixth of 12 at Warwick last time.

stable_tour.quote: A consistent sort who deserves to have won more races. He's run okay this season and a step up in trip will hopefully see him back in the winner's enclosure. 19-02-25

runners.name: Paddy Omahler
runners.comment: Comes here after a win and a creditable fourth but drying ground might be a concern
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 16th attempt at Wetherby (3m, soft) in January, and ran creditably at Kelso (2m6f, soft) next time; withdrawn on good going latest intended outing so drying ground might be a concern.

runners.name: Its Maisy
runners.comment: As good as ever when third in December and excuses since; best efforts on soft ground
runners.spotlight: Three wins at around 3m on soft (including here) last term; as good as ever when third at Haydock in December and 2m3f was an inadequate trip next time; had an excuse (lost a shoe) latest start so may well bounce back, although (as for stablemate Paddy O'Mahler) drying ground could be an issue.

quotes.race: Racingtv.com Mares' Handicap Hurdle (Go North Lady Buttons Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: It's Maisy is a typical of one of the trainer's horses, they jump and they gallop - Nick Scholfield, rider.

runners.name: Superior Glance
runners.comment: Lightly raced 10yo; third of five at Bangor four weeks ago; impossible to discount
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 10yo; some improvement when third of five at Bangor (2m7f, heavy) four weeks ago, rallying; that doesn't look especially strong form but she's still impossible to discount.

2:45.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: Chase 6.1, Hurdle 7.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Barry Fife
runners.comment: Second in point then fifth in bumpers; has some potential and should make a hurdler
runners.spotlight: Second behind a useful rival in an Irish point before finishing fifth in two bumpers, fading when beaten 16l at Southwell on latest; still has some potential and should make a hurdler.

runners.name: Doctor Kildare
runners.breeder: S C E A Du Haras Des Sablonnets Et Al
runners.comment: Bumper winner; seemingly amiss on hurdles debut but progressing now; leading player
runners.spotlight: Bred to be useful and won Bangor bumper last April; ran as if amiss on hurdles debut but he looks to be progressing now and took second behind an impressive odds-on shot in maiden at Doncaster (2m3f, good to soft) four weeks ago; shapes as if he'll stay this longer trip; leading player.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper at Bangor in April and is ready for hurdles as he's been schooling well. He might not be the biggest but has talent. 22-10-24

runners.name: La Higuera
runners.comment: Placed in Irish points; made mistakes on hurdling debut; may still be unexposed
runners.spotlight: Placed in two Irish points in 2023; some promise in Exeter bumper and Fontwell novice hurdle (2m3f, soft; made mistakes) in 2024; improvement required but he's from a good jumping family and could still be unexposed.

stable_tour.quote: He'll be a lovely horse in time. He was very green on his first run over hurdles in October and then stepped on a nail, which is why he hasn't been out since. He's from a fantastic staying family and is a staying chaser for the future. Time is going to be his biggest asset and he'll just improve as he matures. I think he'll take us to some nice races. 12-02-25

runners.name: Stones Throw
runners.breeder: Shade Oak Stud & Mr D Jenks
runners.comment: Bumper winner on soft; has gone the wrong way over hurdles and needs to get back on track
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner on soft; has gone the wrong way in four runs over hurdles, beaten over 30l last two starts; stoutly bred and moves up further in distance today, but he needs to get back on track.

runners.name: Wistmans Prince
runners.comment: Well beaten in bumper at Ludlow and novice hurdle at Taunton; difficult to recommend
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in bumper at Ludlow and novice hurdle at Taunton (2m3f; 150-1); difficult to recommend judged on those efforts.

runners.name: Edna E Mode
runners.comment: Some improvement on third hurdles run when fourth in Chepstow maiden, but that's poor form
runners.spotlight: 4yo filly; low-grade Flat maiden; some improvement on third hurdles run when fourth of eight in maiden at Chepstow (2m3f, good), but that's poor form and she's not sure to stay this longer trip.

3:20.race_name: Bobby Beech Is 60 Mares' Handicap Hurdle
3:20.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: Chase 6.1, Hurdle 7.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Blue Las
runners.comment: Third of five in Grade 2 mares' novice last month; has potential off her opening mark
runners.spotlight: All six starts on soft/heavy ground; this two-time bumper winner (including here) scored easily at Ffos Las (2m) in December on her second hurdle start before a creditable third of five in a Grade 2 mares' novice at Sandown (2m4f) last month; has potential off her opening mark, if conditions suit.

stable_tour.quote: She's another horse we have for Dai Walters. She's got a good pedigree, being by Constitution Hill's sire Blue Bresil. She outran her odds to finish fourth behind a decent horse of Ben Pauling's - Dunskay - on her debut at Huntingdon in February. Hopefully she can be progressive. 06-03-24

runners.name: Kantagua Du Large
runners.comment: French chase winner but soundly beaten in novice hurdles on both British starts
runners.spotlight: Won 4yo chase in France last January and this 5yo should be capable of a lot better than she's shown in novice hurdles this year on her first two British starts; perhaps moving into a handicap will trigger a revival but she has something to prove after her last two performances.

runners.name: Miss Maverick
runners.comment: Pulled up last month in first two chases but won three novice hurdles here last spring
runners.spotlight: Something to prove regarding current form having been pulled up last month on her first two chase starts, but she won three novice hurdles in a row here last spring and could stage a revival now back in this discipline.

quotes.race: TCS Recruitment Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think Miss Maverick just handled the ground better than the majority in this race. She's a keen-running sort and, to be honest, I didn't have a lot left in the tank but she had the race won from a long way out and hopefully she can progress from this - James Davies, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Presenting Doy
runners.comment: Unexposed point/maiden hurdle winner who now goes handicapping with yard in excellent form
runners.spotlight: Point winner (3m, soft) who returned from an absence to post promising fourth on hurdle debut at Warwick (2m3f, good to soft) in January; had to work hard to win at 2-5 at Lingfield (2m3f, heavy) last month but could have plenty more to offer and her yard is in excellent form; handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: She's a big mare who ran a lovely race when fourth on her first run for me in a mares' novice hurdle at Warwick last week, travelling and jumping great and galloping all the way through the line. That was a fine run for a mare who hadn't been on the track for a long time and probably wants a bit further. She's one for the future but you'd hope she'd win a novice hurdle before the end of the season. 29-01-25

runners.name: Either Or
runners.comment: Disappointing since Warwick win last January; may bounce back at some stage for top yard
runners.spotlight: Looked to be one to follow when winning on hurdle debut at Warwick (2m3f, soft) last January; disappointing subsequently, particularly on her two starts this winter, but she's in top hands and may bounce back at some stage.

quotes.race: Welcombe Hills Vineyard Mares' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: It was very soft ground the last day Either Or ran here and she just took a blow as it was her first run of the season, but we were happy with it. We were very confident coming into the race today as she has done everything nicely at home. Her jumping is her biggest asset and fences will be her forte in the future. She is a real hardy mare and the further they went the better she got. I'd say we will go for another race like this under a penalty next - Katie Croft, owners' representative.

stable_tour.quote: She's a point-to-point winner and added a novice hurdle at Warwick last season. Her life is still way out in front of her and I hope she'll continue to improve and has a bright future ahead. 22-10-24

runners.name: Sweet Magic
runners.comment: 0-12 but runner-up on two of her last three starts and could be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: 0-12 but placed a few times; went very close at Aintree (2m4f, good to soft) in December and returned to form with 5l second at Warwick (2m3f, soft) last month behind a progressive winner; could be thereabouts.

stable_tour.quote: She deserves to have won a race and has just been unlucky. She's been in contention a few times, including when falling at the last at Warwick last season. She had a niggle from there, but bounced back to just get nutted on the line at Aintree on Boxing Day. We ran her at Ludlow last time but going right-handed didn't suit her at all. We'll go back the other way at Wetherby next week. 19-02-25

runners.name: Hello Cello
runners.owner: Harry Fry Racing Syndicate Hello Cello
runners.comment: Has shown ability; begins handicap life on a realistic mark and with improvement possible
runners.spotlight: Hasn't really threatened across her five starts but has shown ability, as when sixth of 15 at Huntingdon (2m4f, good to soft) last month; begins handicap life on a realistic mark and with the possibility of improvement.

runners.name: Dont Tell Rosie
runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Mrs B E Moore
runners.comment: 7l second on handicap debut at Taunton and the winner has followed up; on the shortlist
runners.spotlight: Took a step forward when upped in trip and runner-up on last month's handicap debut at Taunton (2m3f, good to soft); she was no match for the winner but that one has won since, as has the third; this lightly raced 5yo could continue to improve and she's on the shortlist.

2:10.race_name: Quinnbet Daily Free Bet Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
2:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: Chase 6.1, Hurdle 7.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Crystal Glance
runners.comment: Dual winner and still lightly raced but she needs to kick on again to defy this mark
runners.spotlight: Made it two wins from three starts when scoring on handicap debut over C&D (good) in November; close second at Doncaster next time but she's finished down the field in her last two runs; still unexposed but has bit to prove all of a sudden and she needs more progress.

runners.name: Iolaos Du Mou
runners.comment: 0-7 over hurdles and has struggled in his four handicaps; lots to prove
runners.spotlight: Good-ground bumper winner for Nicky Henderson in 2022; showed some early promise over hurdles but he's been disappointing in four handicaps including when tailed off on his Doncaster reappearance (2m, good to soft) four weeks ago; mark continues to fall but has lots to prove.

quotes.race: British Horse Society Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Iolaos Du Mou will come on a lot for that. He'll go hurdling and we were worried about the ground, but everyone was - John Jarvis, part-owner.

stable_tour.quote: For a start, we all call him Pablo and he was second at Fontwell recently, but I think that will turn out to be a pretty good race and he should be winning over hurdles soon. 30-10-23

runners.name: Ruler Legend
runners.comment: Signs of a revival at Huntingdon and has claims if he can build on that; cheekpieces added
runners.spotlight: Won on handicap hurdle debut at Huntingdon (2m, soft) last spring; disappointing in next four runs but he showed signs of a revival when third in his bid for a repeat success at Huntingdon 17 days ago; should benefit from that reappearance run and he's in ther mix with cheekpieces added.

quotes.race: Discover Whats Trending rhino.bet Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ruler Legend wasn't going anywhere at the third last but then his stamina kicked in as he was a stayer on the Flat. I was happy with how he picked up the leader at the last and he was going away at the finish - Richie McLernon, jockey.

quotes.race: Royal Ascot Trials And Ladies Day May 15th Rated Race
quotes.quote: I thought Ruler Legend did it well. He ran well here last year and likes a dig in the ground. He's a big galloper and will probably get 1m4f. He could be an Ulster Derby horse or something like that. All he does is stay, he's resolute and keeps galloping. He probably ran into quite a nice horse of Joseph's [O'Brien's, Ghasham) in Cork the last day - Fozzy Stack, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's been progressing along nicely. We could have a think about the Queen's Vase or possibly a handicap like the King George V Stakes. 09-06-22

runners.name: Jorebel
runners.comment: Well held in all four hurdle runs and needs to significantly raise his game
runners.spotlight: Placed in his last two Irish points but he's been well held in four hurdle runs since November including when fourth of five on recent handicap debut at Plumpton (2m, good; 9-4); still has potential but he needs to significantly raise his game.

runners.name: Little Pi
runners.comment: Won at Wincanton last January but he's been out of sorts in just four runs since
runners.spotlight: Completed a double off this mark at Wincanton (1m7f, good to soft) last January but has form figures of 0P67 since then including in two runs for new yard this year; has some questions to answer and he needs to bounce back near best.

runners.name: Fat Harry
runners.comment: Improved third at Catterick (2m3f) last time but not sure this drop back in trip will suit
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 8yo who found improvement after a break when a rallying third in Catterick handicap (2m3f, good) three weeks ago; 1lb lower here but not sure this drop back in trip will suit and others are more persuasive.

runners.name: Inion Tiogair
runners.comment: 0-9 over hurdles and has struggled in handicaps, despite a steep drop in the weights
runners.spotlight: Won a soft-ground bumper in January 2023 but he's 0-9 over hurdles and it's been a struggle in handicaps; now 21lb lower than for his opening mark but he needs a big turnaround after a short break.

runners.name: Remarkable Flight
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: Added to her two Flat wins when scoring at Fakenham; up 5lb but she's a big player again
runners.spotlight: Dual 1m2f Flat winner who was runner-up in two of her first four starts over hurdles, before going one better in handicap at Fakenham (2m, good to soft) two weeks ago; needed some riding to come from the rear to justify favouritism in that six-runner race but she was firmly in charge from the home turn; up 5lb but she's open to more progress and is a key player.

5:40.race_name: Quinnbet "Junior" National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)
5:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: Chase 6.1, Hurdle 7.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Barrow Hill Lad
runners.comment: Bred to be suited by longer trips in due course and yard has modest strike-rate in bumpers
runners.spotlight: By Getaway; dam useful 2m1f-3m hurdle/chase winner, closely related to winners The Cider Maker (3m1f chase) and Urca De Lima (bumper/2m5f hurdle), out of 1m6f winner; bred to be suited by longer distances in due course and yard has a modest strike-rate in bumpers.

stable_tour.quote: He's a really nice young horse. He was due to run in a bumper last week but his tracheal wash wasn't right, so we didn't go. He ran in a schooling bumper at Larkhill in February and he's due to run this month at some point. He's one for the future and will definitely want a trip over fences some day. I'd like to run him in a bumper before the season's out. 12-03-25

runners.name: Donttellyamumjack
runners.comment: Promising third at Hereford, finishing with a rare rattle; open to plenty of improvement
runners.spotlight: Made a promising start when third of seven at Hereford (soft; 7-2) five weeks ago, finishing with a rare rattle, a place behind Emerald Warrior; open to plenty of improvement and should go well.

runners.name: Double Measure
runners.comment: Appealing on pedigree and represents yard with a fine strike-rate in bumpers this term
runners.spotlight: 105,000euros 3yo; second foal; half-brother to French 2m1f hurdle winner Luciano Montorio; dam unplaced 2m1f-2m2f hurdles/chases, half-sister to two useful French winners; cost a six-figure sum, makes some appeal on pedigree and represents a yard with a 28% strike-rate in bumpers this term.

runners.name: Emerald Warrior
runners.comment: Attracted support and shaped well when second at Hereford; clearly held in some regard
runners.spotlight: Attracted support and shaped well when second of seven at Hereford (soft; 13-8 favourite) five weeks ago, leading over 3f out and pulling clear with winner; clearly held in some regard and looks a big player again.

runners.name: Gaelic Glow
runners.comment: 2024's winning stable having good season with bumper runners; well worth a market check
runners.spotlight: £10,000 3yo; Passing Glance half-brother to point/3m chase winner Hoe Joly Smoke; dam bumper/2m3f hurdle winner, half-sister to useful 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Robbie; stable having a good season with its bumper runners and won this event 12 months ago; well worth a market check.

runners.name: Heaven Can Wait
runners.comment: 20,000gns 2yo; dam useful French Flat winner; trainer can ready one first time
runners.spotlight: 20,000gns 2yo; Postponed half-brother to a 7.5f winner in Qatar; dam useful French Flat winner (1m2f/15.5f) from classy Flat family; trainer can ready one first time; not discounted.

runners.name: Mini Mario
runners.breeder: Elms Bloodstock & Miss A Gibson Fleming
runners.comment: Stable 0-8 in bumpers this season and others appeal a bit more on paper
runners.spotlight: By Blue Bresil; dam bumper and useful 2m-2m1f hurdle/chase winner, sister to 2m chase winner Desertmore Hill; stable 0-8 in bumpers this season and others appeal a bit more on paper.

runners.name: Mr Jukebox
runners.comment: Yard's strike-rate in bumpers has decreased in recent years; this one still needs a look
runners.spotlight: 20,000euros 2yo; brother to point winner Inishcorker, half-brother to bumper and useful 2m3f-2m5f hurdle/chase winner Bhaloo; dam unraced sister to two hurdle winners; yard's strike-rate in bumpers has decreased in recent years but this one still needs a close look.

runners.name: Saffron Creed
runners.comment: Half-brother to two sprint winners; others appeal more on pedigree
runners.spotlight: Sans Frontieres half-brother to winners First Excel (6f AW) and Trulie Good (5f AW); dam 6f/7f winner; others appeal more on pedigree.

runners.name: The Bluesmaster
runners.comment: Stable has had excellent season with bumper runners; one of the most interesting newcomers
runners.spotlight: Brother to bumper winner Full Force Gale; dam 2m3f hurdle winner, closely related to 2m4f hurdle winner Parthian Empire; stable has had an excellent season with its bumper runners (5-9); one of the most interesting newcomers in the line-up.

runners.name: Tread Carefully
runners.comment: Has a plausible pedigree for a race of this nature and the yard wins its share of them
runners.spotlight: 50,000euros 3yo; Affinisea half-brother to 2m-2m3f jumps winner Isabella Bee and French winners Fleur De La Roque (2m1f hurdle) and Dancing Roque (1m7f/2m1f hurdle); dam useful 1m4f Flat/2m1f hurdle winner; plausible pedigree for a race of this nature and the yard wins its share of them.

runners.name: Walk In The West

prev_owners.owner: M R Chapman, E Jones & H Kingston

runners.comment: Second favourite for Listed event at Cheltenham on debut; well beaten but should improve
runners.spotlight: Went off second favourite for the Listed bumper at Cheltenham (soft; 4-1) on New Year's Day, but folded tamely to finish well beaten; clearly thought capable of much better.

runners.name: Driving Miss Dazy
runners.comment: Will probably be suited by longer distances in time, but not without hope on debut
runners.spotlight: By Jack Hobbs; dam 2m5f hurdle winner, sister to 2m4f hurdle/2m6f chase winner Torn Asunder, out of half-sister to useful 2m4f-2m7f chase winner The Outlier; will probably be suited by longer distances in time, but not without hope on debut.

runners.name: Night Burlesque
runners.comment: Beaten 12l at Catterick (25-1) on debut, fading; may come on for the run
runners.spotlight: Beaten 12l at Catterick (25-1) on debut, fading after racing freely; may come on for the run and not discounted by any means.

1:40.race_name: Shouldvebeenaring, New For 2025 At The Irish National Stud Irish EBF Maiden
1:40.going_detailed: SOFT, Yielding to soft in places on Round course (Middle track)

runners.name: Joyful Tidings
runners.breeder: Mr M Dunphy & Mr E Cantillon
runners.comment: First Irish runner for four-time Group 2-winning sire A'Ali; market will guide on debut
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam half-sister to winners Viren's Army (10.3f Listed) and Eagle Creek (useful 7f/1m), out of useful 7f 2yo/1m winner; first Irish runner for four-time Group 2-winning sire A'Ali.

runners.name: Noodles
runners.comment: 16,000euros yearling; half-brother to winners at 5.5f-7f including Verhoyen (RPR 102)
runners.spotlight: Eighth foal; 16,000euros yearling; half-brother to winners at 5.5f-7f including Verhoyen (RPR 102); dam 1m4f winner, half-sister to useful 1m winner Island Light; respected.

runners.name: Pints In Peace
runners.owner: Arvin Savage & Ian Marmion & Justin L Murphy
runners.comment: Dam out of half-sister to French 1,000 Guineas winner Tie Black; stable 0-4 with 2yos
runners.spotlight: Cost 21,000euros as a foal; picked up for 20,000euros nearly a year later; dam 1m1f winner, out of twice-raced half-sister to French 1,000 Guineas winner Tie Black; stable 0-4 with 2yos.

runners.name: Arugam Bay
runners.comment: Cheap purchase; dam 6.5f-7.4f winner; should get much further than this in time
runners.spotlight: Cheap purchase; second foal; dam 6.5f-7.4f winner (inc AW; RPR 83), out of 6f 2yo winning half-sister to Listed-placed 1m1f 2yo winner Play Gal; might need further than this.

runners.name: Miami Destination
runners.comment: Cost £30,000; dam half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 2 winner Captain Marvelous; highly respected
runners.spotlight: Ten Sovereigns filly cost £30,000; closely related to US 5f turf winner No Nay Franklin; dam maiden half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 2 winner Captain Marvelous; highly respected for red-hot yard.

runners.name: Oh Cecelia
runners.comment: 48,000euros yearling; dam 1m 2yo winner; stable had four 2yo winners last year
runners.spotlight: 48,000euros yearling; dam 1m 2yo winner (RPR 84), out of 7f 2yo winning sister to 6f 2yo Group 2 winner Misheer; market noted for stable who had four 2yo winners last year.

runners.name: Smart Sioux
runners.comment: Dam out of unraced half-sister to 6f 2yo Listed winner but will probably need further
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam out of unraced half-sister to 6f 2yo Listed winner Crystal Crossing (dam of St Leger winner Rule Of Law); pedigree suggests she will want further than this.

runners.name: Stonezilian
runners.comment: 47,000euros yearling; half-sister to three winners; one of two for in-form yard; respected
runners.spotlight: 47,000euros yearling; half-sister to three winners including Dense Star (Listed-placed 5.7f 2yo; RPR 94); dam unraced half-sister to 6f 2yo Listed winner Brevity; one of two for in-form yard; withdrawn here on March 16 (coughing).

2:15.race_name: Tote Never Beaten By SP Handicap
2:15.going_detailed: SOFT, Yielding to soft in places on Round course (Middle track)

runners.name: The Highway Rat
runners.comment: Runner-up in this contest two years ago; goes well fresh; has each-way possibilities
runners.spotlight: Six career wins, five on the AW; tends to run well fresh; runner-up behind Laugh A Minute in this contest two years ago from same mark; handles cut in the ground; capable of going well and has each-way possibilities.

quotes.race: Rathkenny Handicap
quotes.quote: The Highway Rat was entitled to win a race like this on his AW form and he did. The second horse came to me and I had to keep him up to his work but I was always comfortable - Billy Lee, rider.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai Pat Smullen Mercury Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: The Highway Rat is only a three-year-old and sprinters tend to improve. He's thriving so well at the moment and is a horse to look forward to. We still have to make our mind up whether we travel over the winter but he is certainly a horse we'll look forward to next year - Andy Oliver, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He'll probably come back for the Bold Lad Sprint Handicap on Sunday week at the Curragh. He hasn't run since May as he came out of Naas a bit jarred, which was unusual and disappointing. He's had his break since and is fresh and well. He looks to be fully himself. It's his first run back but he normally runs well fresh. We were going to run him this weekend at Navan but we decided we'd go straight for the Curragh. 11-09-24

runners.name: Go Athletico
runners.breeder: Mrs Camille Vitse & Mrs Valerie Decouz

prev_owners.owner: Team Valor International LLC & J Fairhurst
Team Valor International LLC & Jimmy Fairhurst
Team Valor International LLC & Shamrock Thoroughbreds
AB Racing Limited, Ecurie Ades Hazan Et Al

runners.comment: Short of room at this track over 6f on Irish return 13 days ago; second handicap start
runners.spotlight: Eight-time winner but drew a blank last year; has returned to his former trainer and was short of room at this track over 6f on Irish return 13 days ago; just his second handicap start and has possibilities off this mark.

quotes.race: Westgrove Hotel Renaissance Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Go Athletico has been very consistent for me and I am very privileged to have him. He got his just rewards today. He's in the Abbaye, if it's a dry week we won't run him - Ado McGuinness, trainer

runners.name: Heavenly Power
runners.comment: Career-high mark to overcome on his return from a break and 5f might be on the sharp side
runners.spotlight: Consistent performer, including in big handicaps, and bagged two 6f contests in the second half of last year here and at Naas; career-high mark to overcome on his return from a break and 5f might be on the sharp side.

quotes.race: FBD Hotels And Resorts Killashee Hotel Handicap
quotes.quote: Heavenly Power will probably go straight to the Bold Lad now. I was worried about the ground but he did well - Eddie Lynam, trainer

runners.name: Real Force
runners.comment: Won this contest last year when seeing off Stag Night by 3l on heavy; big player if ready
runners.spotlight: Won on seasonal reappearance the last two years running, including this contest last year when seeing off Stag Night by 3l on heavy; flopped 12 days later in Listed company at Cork and hasn't been seen since; big player if he's ready to roll.

quotes.race: La Celia Wines Handicap
quotes.quote: Real Force will got to Cork for a Listed race now. He was in great form coming into the race, he is a real athlete and got through the ground nicely - Ger O'Leary, trainer.

quotes.race: SP Or Better Guaranteed With Tote Handicap
quotes.quote: Real Force is probably better over 6f but can go 7f. I had him in the five and the seven today and I thought with the heavier ground that this race would suit as he has been a bit gassy on his first runs in the past. He will improve plenty for this run as he was short a few bits of work - Darren Bunyan, trainer.

quotes.race: Final Day Of The Irish Flat Season Race
quotes.quote: Real Force has done nothing wrong all year and he's been very consistent. We've minded him and he goes on the soft ground. We'll have him back early next year, and there might be a possibility of him going to the Saudi Cup meeting on February 20, he has an invitation - Adrian Joyce, assistant trainer

runners.name: Keke
runners.comment: Rounded off his year with an impressive C&D victory in September; 11lb higher mark here
runners.spotlight: Highly progressive, landing a hat-trick here over 6f in August before finishing fourth in the Bold Lad a month later; rounded off his year with an impressive C&D victory in late September; 11lb higher mark to deal with on his return.

quotes.race: SBK Joe McGrath Premier Handicap
quotes.quote: Keke has just kept coming forward all season and to win four handicaps in a year is pretty cool. I would say he'll go on his holidays now. The handicapper will have his say, so we'll come back for the good sprint handicaps next year. When he came to us as a two-year-old he couldn't run a message. But he gradually improved and won his maiden last year. I told the owner to hold onto him and thankfully he did - Eddie Lynam, trainer.

quotes.race: G Dunlop Electrical Handicap
quotes.quote: keke is a horse I would like to try over six. He's not the brightest horse in the world but when you light him up he can be keen. I would hope there might be a bit of improvement in him - Eddie Lynam, trainer

quotes.race: Grimes Maiden
quotes.quote: Keke had a good run last day. Once you get him relaxed he is straightforward. He switched off and travelled well, he was doing enough at the end - Colin Keane, rider

runners.name: Betsen
runners.comment: Didn't get the clearest of runs when beaten 3l here over 6f on handicap debut 13 days ago
runners.spotlight: Second in a Listed race last spring and later won a 5f maiden (good) on seventh career start; beaten under 4l in a 6f Group 3 next time; didn't get the clearest of runs when beaten 3l into seventh here over 6f on handicap debut 13 days ago but has work to do.

runners.name: Stag Night
runners.comment: Second to Real Force in this race last year but is 4lb better off; recent run; likes soft
runners.spotlight: Strike-rate of 4-16; has worked his way up the ratings; finished second to Real Force in this race last year but is 4lb better off with that rival here and a recent run here should blow away the cobwebs; handles soft well; big player.

runners.name: Two Stars
runners.owner: Mrs Anne Gaffney & Mrs T Gaffney & Liam J Butler

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Anne Gaffney & Mrs T Gaffney & Liam J Butler

runners.comment: C&D handicap winner in November; can't be dismissed and was fourth in this race last year
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 5yo who loves the mud; impressed when winning C&D handicap (yielding to soft) off 83 after a break in November, travelling smoothly; headed near the post when runner-up at Doncaster over 6f six days later; another who can't be dismissed; fourth in this race last year.

quotes.race: Guinness Handicap
quotes.quote: Two Stars had a setback after he ran here last time. I always felt he was a little better than his mark. Hopefully he can be competitive in some of those better sprint handicaps next year - Fozzy Stack, trainer.

runners.name: Sporting Hero
runners.comment: All six of his wins have been on the AW; current turf mark looks harsh; others preferred
runners.spotlight: All six of his wins have been on the AW at between 5f-6f; won back-to-back 5f handicaps at Dundalk last month before another bold showing in second there last week; current turf mark looks harsh so others are preferred.

runners.name: Sturlasson
runners.comment: Well behind Keke over C&D when last seen; booking of Keane and falling mark only positives
runners.spotlight: Sole victory came in Navan maiden last May (5f, good); went very close in a valuable sprint at Epsom in June but has regressed since; well behind Keke over C&D when last seen in September; the booking of Keane and falling mark only positives.

quotes.race: Betfred 3YO "Dash" Handicap
quotes.quote: It was Sturlasson's first time in a handicap, and normally they'd say they need a run in a handicap because it is a different type of sprinting, but he did fantastically well. He won his maiden in Navan, and the thing we were happy with it that the first few furlongs there are a bit undulating and downhill, so he might have had a bit of experience there for this. Oisin [Murphy, jockey] said the three-year-old handicap sprint at Royal Ascot is made for him - that's where he said he'd do, so all things being well, we will. When he first ran in a maiden he was second to Bucanero Fuerte, who is favourite for the Commonwealth Cup, so we knew he was pretty useful - Kieran Cotter, trainer.

quotes.race: Navan Racecourse Maiden
quotes.quote: Sturlasson's work during the week was spectacular. He skipped along there and he loved it. It was a real professional performance and I'm delighted. The lads are saying they might go for the Palace of Holyroodhouse Handicap at Royal Ascot on the Friday - Kieran Cotter, trainer.

runners.name: Greatest Drama
runners.comment: Gowran fillies' maiden winner over 7f; soft ground an unknown & this is a big drop in trip
runners.spotlight: Encouraging 7f debut run behind Delacroix before landing Gowran fillies' maiden (7f, good) despite running green; tough Group 3 assignment here behind Heavens Gate in September; soft ground an unknown and this is a big drop in trip; handicap debut.

runners.name: Magical Vision
runners.comment: Beat Two Stars over C&D & she's 3lb better off with that rival so she's well handicapped
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner in just 10 career starts and has never raced on ground better than soft; hasn't been seen for nearly a year since beating Two Stars over C&D but she's 3lb better off with that rival here so she's well handicapped on her return.

quotes.race: Newbridge Silverware Sprint Handicap
quotes.quote: Magical Vision travelled very well and five furlongs is definitely her trip - Aidan Howard, trainer.

quotes.race: Compas Stallions Handicap
quotes.quote: Magical Vision has lots of gears. We will look for something similar in a couple of weeks because she won't like summer ground - Aidan Howard, trainer.

quotes.race: Awardsandgifts.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: We really liked Magical Vision at home, we've had a few setbacks with her. She definitely has a lot of gears, the soft ground suits her, she does need that. We'll be looking forward to her next year, hopefully bigger and better things.  - Alana Insole, owner, talking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: NavanRacecourse.ie Maiden
quotes.quote: Magical Vision is a mare we have always liked. She has had her little problems. She handles that ground well. We will probably put her away and have her for next season - Aidan Howard, trainer.

2:50.race_name: Visit The Irish National Stud & Gardens Maiden
2:50.going_detailed: SOFT, Yielding to soft in places on Round course (Middle track)

runners.name: Dark Willow
runners.comment: Seven outings without making the frame, impossible to make a case for her in a maiden
runners.spotlight: Seven outings without making the frame; impossible to make a case for her in a maiden.

runners.name: Onemorestar
runners.comment: Down the field on her only start at three, towards the back over 7f here on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Down the field at Naas on her only start at three; towards the back over 7f here on reappearance.

runners.name: Penny Mountain
runners.comment: Some promise last year, likely to be of more interest as a handicap prospect after this
runners.spotlight: Reared up in stalls over C&D on debut last September, showing promise with a staying-on effort, finishing seventh of 13; again showed some ability in a 7f maiden at Naas; likely to be of more interest as a handicap prospect after this.

runners.name: Kilmood Susan
runners.comment: Twice runner-up last May including over C&D, two subsequent runs not as encouraging
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in maidens over C&D and over 5f at Tipperary last May; failed to match that form over 5f at Down Royal in June; not beaten far in fifth in a late-season 5f maiden at Navan; could get into the money if reproducing her early-season juvenile form.

runners.name: Lady Mary Heath
runners.comment: 80-1 chance when unseating her rider early in a C&D maiden on debut, best watched
runners.spotlight: 80-1 chance when unseating her rider early in a C&D maiden on debut; best watched.

runners.name: Miss Crinshawn
runners.comment: 66-1, made little impression in a 7f maiden here 13 days ago, hood worn then is left off
runners.spotlight: 66-1, made little impression in a 7f maiden here 13 days ago; hood worn then is left off.

runners.name: Pickersgill
runners.comment: Ended last season with two solid placed runs, not certain to uphold form with Smiling
runners.spotlight: First two runs were over 7f; showed considerable improvement when dropped to this trip at Naas in October, taking third behind a Joseph O'Brien-trained favourite; again shaped well when second to a promising newcomer from the same source over C&D nine days later.

runners.name: Prairie Girl
runners.owner: J Kirkland & Mrs J M Ryan
runners.comment: Likely to show the benefit of an introductory run at Dundalk last month, not beaten far
runners.spotlight: Likely to show the benefit of an introductory run at Dundalk last month; not beaten far in midfield.

runners.name: Sakakibara
runners.comment: Some promise on debut over 6f at Dundalk last November, might prefer further than this
runners.spotlight: Some promise when beaten just under 6l in seventh on debut over 6f at Dundalk last November; might prefer further than this.

runners.name: Smiling
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Finished behind Pickersgill at Naas, experience of second run can help her to reverse form
runners.spotlight: Cost 300,000gns as a yearling; apprentice-ridden and easy-to-back first time out over 6f at Naas; faded to finish seventh of 12, fourth of five in a group headed by third-placed Pickersgill; picked up further experience when runner-up over 5f at Dundalk in November; return to 6f should suit; fair prospects of reversing form with Pickersgill.

runners.name: Vanderbilt House
runners.comment: Failed to reach the first four at two but showed enough to suggest she can win races
runners.spotlight: Earned a handicap rating of 80 after three unplaced runs at two; possibly flattered by a mark that puts her 4lb ahead of the twice-placed Pickersgill; best run when fifth behind subsequent Listed winner Chantez over 7f at Leopardstown; beaten around 8l in sixth over this trip at Naas; first-time cheekpieces.

3:25.going_detailed: SOFT, Yielding to soft in places on Round course (Middle track)

runners.name: A Dream To Share
runners.comment: Former bumper star, ran on late over 1m here on Flat debut, shorter trip is a concern
runners.spotlight: Flat-bred; top bumper horse of the 2022/23 season, winning five times including Grade 1s at Cheltenham and Punchestown; interrupted career since, running twice over hurdles this term; ran on strongly from off the pace to take fourth over 1m here 13 days ago; drop to 7f is not an obvious stratgegy against that background.

quotes.race: Race & Stay At Punchestown Champion I.N.H. Flat Race (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: A Dream To Share is a great horse to keep his form for so long. He had to dig deep at the end, the second is a very good horse, but John is a strong man for his age. He did very well. The races all came at an ideal distance apart for him. The space between Leopardstown, Cheltenham and here suited him very well. He'll get a nice holiday now - John Kiely, trainer.

quotes.race: Shabra Charity Oliver Brady Memorial Future Stars (C & G) I.N.H. Flat Race (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: I didn't know what to expect to be honest because we haven't that much to work A Dream To Share with but we always liked him - John Kiely, trainer.

runners.name: Buckle And Bolts
runners.comment: Closely matched with A Dream To Share on debut running, ran green, open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Betrayed inexperience on debut over 1m here 13 days ago; closely matched with A Dream To Share on that running; open to improvement.

runners.name: Cleverlydoesit
runners.comment: Late-maturing sort ran green in a claimer at Dundalk, likely to need more experience
runners.spotlight: Late-maturing sort ran green in a claimer at Dundalk; likely to need more experience.

runners.name: Cinammon Coco
runners.comment: Midfield on debut over 1m here last October, second string for the trainer of Mathan
runners.spotlight: Midfield (14th of 27) on debut over 1m here last October; has been gelded; second string for the trainer of Mathan.

runners.name: Dmaniac
runners.comment: Fine second in 21-runner maiden over 6f here last October, behind Mathan on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on 5f Navan debut last August; improved considerably when 50-1 second behind last Sunday's Madrid Handicap winner in a 21-runner maiden over 6f in October; made some late progress over 6f here on reappearance, but well held by runner-up Mathan.

runners.name: Edmond Halley
runners.comment: Winning dam is noteworthy as a half-sister to trainer's Group 2 winner Matilda Picotte
runners.spotlight: Winning dam is noteworthy as a half-sister to trainer's Matilda Picotte, winner of three stakes races including the 7f Group 2 Challenge Stakes at Newmarket.

runners.name: Mathan
runners.comment: Came from off the pace for a neck second over 6f on return, can prevail over extra furlong
runners.spotlight: Solid debut over 6f behind a well-regarded filly and improved on that when runner-up at Navan, also over 6f; now looks in need of this extra furlong having come from off the pace for a neck second over 6f here on return.

runners.name: Monkstown
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: Brother to Ballydoyle-trained winners Samuel Colt and Montego Bay, no Group 1 entries
runners.spotlight: Cost 300,000euros as a yearling; sixth foal; brother to winners Samuel Colt (Group-placed) and Montego Bay, half-brother to 1m6f winner Pasley (79); dam, by Duke Of Marmalade, placed on AW; holds no Group 1 entries, but unwise to discount.

runners.name: Radial Symmetry
runners.comment: Brother to winners Geometrical and Slaney Tide, rider had a winner here on opening day
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; brother to winners Geometrical (Group-placed winner on Flat, also won over hurdles) and Slaney Tide; apprentice rode a 25-1 winner for the yard on the first day of the season.

runners.name: Sonic Invader
runners.comment: In rear on debut in 1m maiden in which A Dream To Share was fourth, safe to rule out
runners.spotlight: In rear on debut in 1m maiden in which A Dream To Share was fourth; safe to rule out.

runners.name: Spent All Me Money
runners.breeder: Lynch Bages, Camas Park & Summerhill B/S
runners.owner: Mrs Noreen Galvin & John P Wade
runners.comment: Half-brother to a French 1m1f-1m4f winner, others are more appealing on pedigree
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-brother to a French 1m1f-1m4f winner; dam US 1m AW winner; others are more appealing on pedigree for a maiden over this trip; gelded.

runners.name: Starsurge
runners.comment: Stable outsider at Naas last Sunday, Colin Keane aboard now, hood now added to tongue-tie
runners.spotlight: Raced keenly on last Sunday's Naas debut; stable outsider then, Colin Keane aboard now; hood now added to tongue-tie.

runners.name: Taudeni
runners.comment: Showed potential when finishing in midfield over 6f on debut at Navan, trip should suit
runners.spotlight: Showed potential when finishing in midfield over 6f on debut at Navan, despite looking inexperienced; extra furlong should suit; gelded now.

runners.name: Widely Acclaimed
runners.comment: Unlikely to be good enough to win a turf maiden at this stage judged on two Dundalk runs
runners.spotlight: Unlikely to be good enough to win a turf maiden at this stage judged on two Dundalk runs.

runners.name: Gotomylovely
runners.owner: Mrs M V Magnier & Mrs Paul Shanahan
runners.comment: Ran once on AW at two, shaped well despite running green when fifth of 20 over C&D
runners.spotlight: Weak in the betting at 33-1 when beating only one home on the AW in November; 100-1 on reappearance over C&D, ran green but shaped well in running prominently before fading to finish fifth of 20.

runners.name: Saol Nios Gile
runners.comment: 50-1 when finishing in midfield over C&D on debut, held by fifth-placed Gotomylovely
runners.spotlight: 50-1 when finishing in midfield over C&D on debut; held by fifth-placed Gotomylovely.

runners.name: Whos Listening
runners.comment: Stout pedigree, may need further to be seen to best effect; hooded for debut
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam French 1m4f winner, half-sister to French 1m4f Group 3 winner Ottery; from extended family of German Derby winners Lando and Laroche; may need further to be seen to best effect; hooded for debut

4:00.going_detailed: SOFT, Yielding to soft in places on Round course (Middle track)

runners.name: Poet Master
runners.comment: Group 2 C&D winner, not beaten far in a Group 1 on last start, likely to go close
runners.spotlight: Won three of his five races in 2023, and maintained progression with Newmarket handicap win on seasonal debut; uneven form in four subsequent starts; merits respect for his C&D Group 2 win in July (Lord Massusus, 3.75l runner-up); ended the campaign with creditable fifth in the Prix de la Foret; handled soft then, but more effective on a sound surface.

quotes.race: Romanised Minstrel Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Poet Master is still immature and can be difficult to switch off, but they went a good gallop in front and it suited perfectly. I could get him switched off. I got to the front sooner than I wanted. but he was able to gallop to the line. The ground was perfect for him. I think there is more to come, he is maturing all the time and I think he will keep improving - Sam James, jockey.

quotes.race: Consign With The National Stud Handicap
quotes.quote: Poet Master has got a lot of potential and feels if he'll get a mile no problem. I think there's a Listed race at Haydock he could go for next - Sam James, rider.

quotes.race: Betfred City Of Doncaster Handicap
quotes.quote: Poet Master has got his own ideas about the job, he's still learning, he's still green and he probably wasn't in love with that ground. He'll probably be a very decent horse when he puts everything together. It will have to be black type now but the better the race, the better he'll   be. They went a good gallop there and he was always in his comfort zone - Sam James, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: That was a fantastic performance in the Group 2 Minstrel Stakes at the Curragh and he's now the highest-rated horse in the yard, so the handicapper was certainly impressed. He goes for the Park Stakes at Doncaster and would be very competitive on good ground or slower, and I imagine then he'd go to the Prix de la Foret. I see him as a real seven-furlong specialist. He's got the pace to handle six furlongs on soft ground but a mile would probably stretch him. 11-09-24

runners.name: Lord Massusus
runners.comment: Second to Poet Master in the Minstrel Stakes, capable of holding his own in this grade
runners.spotlight: Listed winner over 1m at this course and later ran well in defeat in Group 2 and 3 races, notably when chasing home Poet Master here in the Minstrel Stakes; out of his depth in the Queen Elizabeth II Stakes on final start.

quotes.race: Bahrain Turf Club Desmond Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Lord Massusus disappointed last day but things didn't go right. We got him switched off today and he came home like a good horse. It was a good performance - Joe Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: The Dillon Marshall Property Consultants Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: We'll make an entry for the Jersey Stakes now, seven furlongs would be ideal - Joe Murphy, trainer of Lord Massusus

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Race (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Lord Massusus put up a very good performance and I think he's a good horse. That qualifies him for the final at Naas next month. He did what good horses do today - Joe Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Premier Nursery Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Lord Massusus was very straightforward and travelled well. He's plenty green, around here it's a tight enough track, but when I squeezed him he picked up and when he hit the front he pricked his ears and won with a little left. Hopefully he'll keep improving, he got the trip well. He's got a bit of scope and will make a nice three-year-old - Gary Carroll, jockey.

runners.name: Power Under Me
runners.comment: Winner of seven of his 24 races, 1-9 record at this venue is a negative, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Winner of seven of his 24 races; gained the most recent of five stakes wins on his favoured soft ground at Tipperary last October; 1-9 record at this venue is a negative; unplaced in this event two years ago.

quotes.race: Coolmore Sioux Nation Concorde Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Power Under Me is ground dependent, soft is ideally his ground. He owes us nothing and has been a great servant. He is a stalwart and to rock up and have a Listed and a Group 3 every year is brilliant - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Hurling For Cancer At Netwatch Cullen Pk Carlow August 12th Race
quotes.quote: Power Under Me is a horse we have tried to keep ticking over and this race fell right for him. You don't expect to get ground like this in July. We can get him revved up for September onwards - Ger Lyons, trainer

quotes.race: Amethyst Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Power Under Me is probably between trips. He is not an out-and-out miler and he is not quick enough for the proper sprints any more. He loves that ground, though. Listed and Group 3 is within his remit all day long. You won't see him on anything quicker than good to soft and we might see the best of him later in the year, but he owes us nothing - Ger Lyons, trainer.

quotes.race: Knockaire Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Power Under Me is very ground dependent. He had been a bit disappointing on his last couple of runs so we decided to step him up in trip. They went hard and he was impressive today. That rekindles everything for him next season - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Cork Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: That's as quick as Power Under Me wants it - he grows another leg when there is juice in it. Colin (Keane) said he is after getting very strong over the winter and has matured big time. One day, if all the conditions went in his favour, there is a big pot in him. He'll be entered for all the big sprints later in the year, the Haydock Sprint Cup and British Champions Sprint Stakes at Ascot over six furlongs could be options and the softer the better for him - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Tifrums Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: He's only come good in the last six weeks. He was backward but his work was very promising at home. Ideally we would like to get another run in for the Birdcatcher or something like that but I don't think we'll have time for that. He'll be a nice horse for next year. It's amazing how well Mehmas has done this year and he's our only one. At the start of the year he was showing us nothing. He was very weak and gangly but the last six weeks we were just waiting for the right ground - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer

runners.name: Big Gossey
runners.comment: Course specialist has recorded seven of his nine wins here, could run into a place
runners.spotlight: Course specialist has recorded seven of his nine wins here; also effective at Dundalk, showing consistent form during the winter campaign following a C&D win on final start of 2024 turf campaign; another fine effort in a 6f handicap here 13 days ago; fourth of six in this last year.

quotes.race: Cavalor Equine Nutrition Race
quotes.quote: Big Gossey got in well at the conditions and it's a perfect sort of race for him. He is in terrific form and we might find a race for him at Dundalk before next year - Charles O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: David Power Memorial Premier Handicap
quotes.quote: Big Gossey has been great for my career. I was delighted to see the rain as he thrives with a bit of an ease. He just loves it here. I would have loved something to bring me a bit further but I wanted to get rolling on him and not let something get first run - Robert Whearty, rider.

quotes.race: Sheehy Motors Volkswagen Race
quotes.quote: Big Gossey has been a great horse to me this season, he's a legend. He hit the line well when he won the Bold Lad, and over that ground and trip, I didn't think the seven would be a problem - Robert Whearty, rider

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF "Bold Lad" Sprint Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Big Gossey was a bit unlucky the last day when he missed the break. I travelled into it lovely and got a lovely run up the rail. He had a bit of a look when he got there but he stayed going - Robert Whearty, rider.

quotes.race: AK Bets "Higher Limits, Better Prices" Handicap
quotes.quote: Big Gossey is getting better as the year goes on and he loves it up the Curragh. I'm delighted that he's after getting his head in front today. I always thought six was his ideal trip but a fast run five like that suits him down to the ground - Danny Sheehy, rider.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF "Bold Lad" Sprint Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Big Gossey travelled throughout and picked up well. I was probably there a bit early but he saw it out. He has plenty of speed and did everything right - Michael Hussey, jockey.

quotes.race: Join Us On Instagram @dundalk_stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Big Gossey came on from the last run. They went a good strong gallop which suited him and he settled lovely. When I gave him a squeeze he picked up really well. He toughed it out to the line so I'm very happy with him - Danny Sheehy, jockey.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Race (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Big Gossey is a horse that's improving every week and there's more improvement in him again. He's an out-and-out sprinter - Mick Hussey, rider

runners.name: Hurricane Ivor
runners.comment: Got a 15lb promotion for last Sunday's emphatic Naas handicap win, this looks demanding
runners.spotlight: Formerly best known as a sprinter; developed into a useful competitor at 7f last season, winning here in May and posting a fine effort when 40-1 second in the Ahonoora Handicap at the Galway festival; now on his highest mark (106) since 2022 thanks to a 15lb promotion for last Sunday's emphatic Naas handicap win; only stakes win came in 2021.

quotes.race: Mongey Communications Handicap
quotes.quote: Hurricane Ivor loved it. I was a little worried about the ground but he was great. It's the first time he has won over seven - Jessica Harrington, trainer

quotes.race: Dubai International Airport World Trophy Stakes (Group 3)
