quotes.quote: Hurricane Ivor could go to France, you never know, he's done nothing but improve. He takes a while to get going but this was half a furlong shorter so he's done well to win. He's a lovely, straightforward horse and just does what you ask him to do - not much more, though! - Maureen Haggas, trainer's wife.

quotes.race: Portland Handicap
quotes.quote: That was great, Hurricane Ivor is such a star. He's a charming horse who is such a pleasure to have around the yard and he's done nothing but improve all year. The trip suited him and so did a bit of dig in the ground. I don't think he'll run in the Ayr Gold Cup. We'll probably look at a black type race, it was a good performance under top weight today and he deserves it - Maureen Haggas, trainer's wife.

quotes.race: Coral "Beaten-By-A-Length" Free Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Hurricane Ivor has done very well. He ran poorly first time but had been training much better since and this was a little bit lower grade. He needed every yard here, and a flat six or a stiff five will be his game. I thought the ground might be too soft for him today, but it wasn't. I'm sure there will be an appeal from some quarter, probably from us. Most people seem to think we won the race but it's pretty impossible to know, really - William Haggas, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran an absolute cracker at the Curragh in a premier handicap on Guineas weekend. He's a really solid performer who never lets us down and the Wokingham is very much the plan for him. 16-06-23

runners.name: Tinas Indian
runners.owner: C F Harrington & James John Hughes
runners.comment: Landed a gamble on debut in a 17-runner maiden over 6f here last August, tough task
runners.spotlight: Landed a gamble on debut in a 17-runner maiden over 6f here last August, justifying a strong home reputation; potentially capable of holding his own in Pattern company; faces a stiff task against battle-hardened types.

quotes.race: FBD Hotels And Resorts Castleknock Hotel Maiden
quotes.quote: Tina's Indian is a horse we love, we think he is very good. I've never had a horse to work like him. The owners gave him all the time he needed to develop into a horse. We were confident coming today. He is a huge horse and he has needed time - Mark Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Fleur De Chine
runners.comment: Best of five runs in stakes races when second to Power Under Me at Tipperary last October
runners.spotlight: Won a contest over an extended 1m1f at Gowran last June; best of five runs in stakes races when second to today's rival Power Under Me at Tipperary last October; up against it in this company.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Gowran Classic
quotes.quote: Fleur De Chine stayed every yard of that and she can probably step up to 1m4f. She has a free entry for the Irish Derby so we could enter her and see what happens - Jessica Harrington, trainer

quotes.race: Ryans Cleaning Fillies & Mares Maiden
quotes.quote: Fleur De Chine was very good. We were disappointed at the Curragh but she just pulled up a little bit sore that day. We'll see what mark she gets and hopefully she can pick up some black type later in the year - Kate Harrington, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She came out of the Curragh in great form. She just seemed to lose her action a furlong down the last day. Hopefully she can go win her maiden on Wednesday at Gowran Park. 24-04-24

runners.name: Mexicali Rose
runners.breeder: Moyns Park Estate And Stud Ltd
runners.comment: Won the 18-runner Galway Mile last July off 90, Listed-placed three times, aiming high now
runners.spotlight: Won the 18-runner Galway Mile last July off 90; Listed-placed three times, including behind Power Under Me and Fleur De Chine at Tipperary; 95-rated filly is aiming high here.

quotes.race: COLM QUINN BMW Mile Handicap
quotes.quote: Mexicali Rose did it well and she will definitely improve for it. I rode her for a bit of luck and thankfully I got it - Wayne Hassett, rider.

runners.name: Princess Child
runners.comment: Solid Listed form, reliable filly but needs a major career-best to feature in this company
runners.spotlight: Three wins in Spain in 2023; placed in four consecutive Irish Listed races between August and September last year; unplaced at Saint-Cloud on final start; reliable filly but needs a major career-best to feature in this company.

runners.name: Camille Pissarro
runners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & P M Brant

prev_owners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & P M Brant
M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & P M Brant

runners.comment: A few reverses before redeeming himself in the Prix Jean-Luc Lagardere, strong contender
runners.spotlight: Began and ended juvenile campaign with a win; twice second in Group 3 races at this venue, but failed to reach the money when favourite for the Coventry and the Gimcrack; just denied in a valuable sales race at Doncaster before redeeming himself in winning the Prix Jean-Luc Lagardere; handled soft ground then, and profited from hold-up ride.

quotes.race: Qatar Prix Jean-Luc Lagardere (Group 1) (2yo Colts & Fillies) (New Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I think being produced very late was probably the key. Let him go to sleep. Christophe's given a masterclass, obviously. He loved him. He said Camille Pissarro did everything 100 per cent and he'll get a mile no problem next year - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A Wootton Bassett colt we've always liked. He won lovely the first day at Navan. He went on to the Marble Hill afterwards at the Curragh and was just beaten. We were happy with him but Ryan [Moore] just felt he was still a bit babyish and that he would benefit a good bit from the experience. We hope there's plenty more to come from him. 11-06-24

runners.name: Officer
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: Superb pedigree, winning favourite on debut over C&D last August, second string
runners.spotlight: Coolmore-bred colt with a superb pedigree; winning favourite on debut over C&D last August; remains an interesting prospect despite the failure of runner-up Storm Piece to boost the form; second string.

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud The Antarctic Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Officer is a quick horse and he relaxes. He looks like a nice colt, he is compact and strong. He did well, he got a position and quickens. This trip is a very comfortable one for him - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

4:35.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF 3yo Spring Series Median Auction Fillies Maiden
4:35.going_detailed: SOFT, Yielding to soft in places on Round course (Middle track)

runners.name: Adrienne
runners.comment: Has shown a fair standard of form at Dundalk, more needed now in first-time blinkers
runners.spotlight: Found her level in 1m nurseries at Dundalk late last year, making the frame twice; improvement sustained when second in a maiden at that venue in January; more needed in first-time blinkers on return to turf.

runners.name: Al What
runners.owner: Mrs M Cahill & Mrs Caroline Hendron & Peter Robin Parkhill
runners.comment: Fair debut over 7f, Colin Keane takes over, improvement on the cards over this trip.
runners.spotlight: Apprentice-ridden when staying on in midfield over 7f here on debut; Colin Keane takes over; improvement on the cards over this trip.

runners.name: Dawn Spirit
runners.breeder: Al Shira'Aa Farms S A R L
runners.comment: Made little impact over 1m on debut, pedigree suggests she may do better over this trip
runners.spotlight: Made little impression over 1m at Leopardstown on only juvenile outing; pedigree suggests she may do better over this trip; holds an Irish Oaks entry.

runners.name: I Do Believe
runners.comment: Half-sister to winners including Kevin Prendergast-trained Mudamer, in good hands
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to winners including Mudamer who scored twice for Kevin Prendergast; dam unraced; in good hands.

runners.name: Invigorated
runners.comment: Half-sister to winners Dramatic Sands and Many A Year, dam AW winner who stayed 1m4f
runners.spotlight: Eighth foal; half-sister to winners Dramatic Sands and Many A Year; dam AW winner who stayed 1m4f.

runners.name: J Ms Joy
runners.comment: Placed three times for Pat Martin, similar form at Dundalk on first start for this yard
runners.spotlight: Placed three times for Pat Martin, twice at around 1m on turf and over 7f at Dundalk in December; similar form when runner-up over 1m at Dundalk on first start for Gavin Cromwell.

runners.name: Mother Mara
runners.comment: Best of three runs for Ralph Beckett was on AW, needs to raise her game on Irish debut
runners.spotlight: Ex-Ralph Beckett; ran to a similar level in two late-season outings on turf (Haydock 6f and Newmarket 7f); fared better over 7f at Wolverhampton on final start in Britain.

runners.name: Red Scarlet
runners.comment: Twice placed in maidens, met trouble in running in a sales race, possible future winner
runners.spotlight: Placed in 7f maidens at Leopardstown and Down Royal last August/September; met trouble in running when sixth of 16 in a valuable sales race at Naas in October; that run can be upgraded; ought to be capable of winning a race.

runners.name: Reponse Finale
runners.comment: Went close over 7f at Down Royal in September, not as effective at Dundalk in October
runners.spotlight: Improved from Naas debut last September when going very close in a 7f maiden at Down Royal 11 days later; not as effective at Dundalk in October.

runners.name: Restful
runners.comment: Ran well on second of two outings at 1m at two, blinkered first time, should stay this far
runners.spotlight: Beaten around 12l on debut in a 1m maiden at Cork last October; reappeared at Thurles nine days later and showed improvement in finishing third behind a Ballydoyle-trained odds-on chance; dam is closely related to star Hong Kong performer Designs In Rome; blinkered first time, should stay this far.

runners.name: Sound Of Lightning
runners.comment: Unraced dam (by Galileo) has a strong pedigree, interesting filly for powerful connections
runners.spotlight: First foal; unraced dam (by Galileo) has a strong pedigree; sister to winners Yucatan (Australian 1m4f Group 2), Faufiler (US 9.5f Grade 3) and Mount Everest (1m2f Listed), half-sister to 5f Group 2 winner Planet Five, out of Breeders' Cup Mile winner Six Perfections; interesting filly for powerful connections.

runners.name: Thakheera
runners.owner: Mohammed Bin Hamad Khalifa Al Attiyah
runners.comment: Capable of improvement form 7f debut but but unlikely to be good enough to win here
runners.spotlight: Looked in need of further when running over 7f here on debut; capable of improvement but unlikely to be good enough to win here.

runners.name: Tirhakah
runners.comment: Fifth foal; dam well beaten in France on only start, others have stronger pedigree claims
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; dam well beaten in France on only start, half-sister to useful juvenile winner Yaseer; others have stronger pedigree claims.

runners.name: Vervain
runners.owner: T Egan & Crampscastle Bloodstock Ltd & J C Fleming
runners.comment: Two respectable displays at two, will be of more interest in handicaps
runners.spotlight: 50-1 for her debut over 7f at Leopardstown last July, some merit in her run; 40-1 for a 1m maiden at Cork in October and again shaped respectably; will be of more interest in handicaps.

5:10.race_name: Tote Guarantee Available On Course Handicap
5:10.going_detailed: SOFT, Yielding to soft in places on Round course (Middle track)

runners.name: Titanium
runners.owner: Damian C Nolan & D P Kilmurray & Liam Gavin & Kieran Clarke

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie 4l, Comte Guillaume De Saint-Seine Et Al
Ecurie 4L, A & G Botti Et Al

runners.comment: Won over this trip at Leopardstown (heavy) in October; tailed off over C&D 13 days ago
runners.spotlight: Useful seven-time Flat winner (six in France); won off mark of 87 over this trip at Leopardstown (heavy) in October; ran three times over hurdles subsequently, well beaten on each occasion; tailed off over C&D 13 days ago; work to do.

runners.name: Presence
runners.comment: Winning favourite over C&D in October; respected on her return despite 18lb higher mark
runners.spotlight: Consistent performer in handicaps; winning favourite over C&D in October off 74; ran well when fourth in Listed company over this trip at Naas eight days later; respected on her return despite 18lb higher mark to contend with.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Presence relaxed well today. She got a good tow into the race today and did it well. She wasn't really suited by the track at Bellewstown, she wants a nice track like this one - Keithen Kennedy, rider.

runners.name: Solomon
runners.comment: Always detached when last of 5 at Dundalk on stable debut last month; monitor the betting
runners.spotlight: Cheaply bought out of Willie Haggas's yard in October, having won Southwell AW novice and 1m2f Haydock handicap (good) last season; always detached when last of five at Dundalk on stable debut last month; monitor the betting.

runners.name: Indigo Five
runners.comment: Big efforts in defeat over C&D lately, including fourth of 27 on latest; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Winner and twice placed in consecutive handicap runs over 7f-1m2f at this venue between June and September last year; fifth of 16 in Listed at Naas in October; two big efforts in defeat over C&D since, including fourth of 27 just 13 days ago; shortlisted.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Summer Fillies Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Indigo Five was very brave today and will be better with cut in the ground - John Feane, trainer

runners.name: Letherfly
runners.comment: Curragh soft-ground maiden win in October 2023; absence to overcome but very lightly raced
runners.spotlight: Churchill filly made winning debut in Curragh soft-ground maiden in October 2023; third in Naas Listed on seasonal return last year, coming from well back; below best at Galway when last seen; absence to overcome but very lightly raced; handicap debut.

runners.name: Akecheta
runners.comment: Unlucky fourth over C&D in November; stays further and should be hitting the line well
runners.spotlight: Debut winner over 7f (soft to heavy) at Tipperary last May; model of consistency in defeat since, last seen finishing a rather unlucky fourth of 17 over C&D in November; stays further and should be hitting the line well.

runners.name: Evening Blossom
runners.comment: Back-to-back wins over this trip last summer; big player if she handles conditions
runners.spotlight: Progressive last summer, winning back-to-back over this trip at Gowran and Leopardstown, both on good ground; finished 2l behind Presence when eighth in Listed grade at Naas but has 4lb pull in the weights here; has form on soft early in career; big player if she handles conditions.

quotes.race: Dublin To Bahrain Fillies & Mares Handicap
quotes.quote: Evening Blossom has threatened to be a nice filly but for one reason or another it has taken her a few runs this year to get it all together. Hopefully she can continue to progress now - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It was a messy race at Dundalk the other day, but she ran well and wasn't beaten far. We think she will progress into stakes company this season. 23-04-24

runners.name: Sea Eagle
runners.comment: Poor behind Titanium when sent off favourite for 1m Leopardstown handicap in October
runners.spotlight: Dual Roscommon winner last year (including on heavy); down the field in Irish Cambridgeshire and most recently disappointed behind Titanium when sent off favourite for 1m Leopardstown handicap in October; others preferred off this mark.

quotes.race: Conor Cassidy Car Sales Handicap
quotes.quote: Sea Eagle seemed to relish the ground and there was hardly a blow out of him. The plan was to slot in and it worked out a dream. When he was going well and going through the ground, it was just a matter of keeping him going - Shane Foley, rider.

quotes.race: Abbey Hotel Roscommon Handicap
quotes.quote: He seemed to love the 1m2f, we figured Sea Eagle would handle it and told Jack (Cleary) to ride him cold, just drop him in and be the last to challenge and he did it to a tee. It opens options for us now, trip-wise. He handles soft but the lads said it was on the fast side of good out there - Ger O'Leary, trainer. speaking to Racing TV

runners.name: Apercu
runners.comment: Back to winning ways here (1m2f) in October; trip on sharp side; wouldn't want it too soft
runners.spotlight: Dundalk maiden winner took well to turf, finishing runner-up at Down Royal in July before going one better in Navan handicap (10.5f, yielding) in first-time cheekpieces; got back to winning ways here (1m2f, yielding) in October; trip on sharp side; wouldn't want it too soft.

stable_tour.quote: She will probably go for the Northfields Handicap. She won nicely at Naas and she stepped up to a mile and half at the Curragh and finished sixth, which I was a bit disappointed with as I thought she had a great chance. I'm not quite sure she got the trip, so we're bringing her back in distance. She'll be near the bottom of the handicap but she has a fair chance of getting in. 11-09-24

runners.name: Ob La Di
runners.comment: Bellewstown maiden winner was beaten out of sight at Galway twice most recently; avoid
runners.spotlight: Gained her first win in Bellewstown maiden (12.5f, good to yielding) in August sporting first-time cheekpieces; beaten out of sight in Listed/handicap contests at Galway subsequently; this is a big ask and she's likely to be outpaced.

runners.name: Fort Vega
runners.breeder: S A S U Ecurie Des Monceaux Et Al
runners.comment: Eyecatcher in Irish Lincoln, disputing the lead just outside the 1f pole, finishing 6th
runners.spotlight: Useful 2023 form before disappointing Britannia Stakes run; down the field in Irish Cambridgeshire on only 2024 start; eyecatcher in Irish Lincolnshire over C&D on return, disputing the lead just outside the furlong pole, finishing sixth of 27; on the shortlist.

quotes.race: Royal Ascot Trials At Naas Handicap
quotes.quote: Fort Vega was a doubt on the quicker ground but we decided to let him take his chance because it was such a good race for him. He's in the Irish 2,000 Guineas, we might think about the Jersey Stakes - Sheila Lavery, trainer

quotes.race: Golf At Gowran Park Maiden
quotes.quote: Fort Vega is a really nice colt and still needed that run. A mile on that ground should be perfect for him. He has some smart entries but we won't lose the run of ourselves - Sheila Lavery, trainer

runners.name: No More Porter
runners.comment: Will need to improve on midfield finish in Irish Lincolnshire on his return to figure
runners.spotlight: All three turf wins have come at this venue; sole win last year came over 7f off mark of 82 in September; 1lb higher now and will need to improve on midfield finish in Irish Lincolnshire on his return to figure.

quotes.race: SBK Handicap
quotes.quote: No More Porter does not usually back up his races and we took a chance coming here after Listowel. He doesn't run a bad race here and he has been unlucky in the big handicaps - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Sporting Life Handicap
quotes.quote: No More Porter is just an improving horse. He showed us a little bit the last day and we thought he had a good chance here today - Johnny Feane, trainer.

runners.name: Casanova
runners.comment: Won at Listowel in September; highly tried here without success; others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Ended a long losing run at Listowel (1m1f, good) in September; unable to compete off higher marks in four subsequent starts and is highly tried at this venue without success; others are preferred.

quotes.race: Oisin Kelly "Every Drop Counts" giveblood.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: Casanova has threatened to do that and he tends to go well this time of year. I was happy enough to race on the fresher ground on the outer. I didn't plan on being that wide with the loose horse, but I had enough in hand - Ronan Whelan, jockey.

quotes.race: Donnellys Of Barna Rated Race
quotes.quote: Casanova travelled at his ease and I was just waiting for a gap. I thought he quickened up well and handled the ground well - Chris Hayes, jockey.

runners.name: Catena Zapata
runners.comment: Dual 1m winner on the AW has been off the track 331 days; will more than likely need this
runners.spotlight: Dual 1m winner on the AW at Dundalk with some placed turf form; mostly seen over hurdles last season but has been off the track 331 days; will more than likely need this to blow the cobwebs away.

quotes.race: Test Your Tipping Talents At PUNTERS.HOLLYWOODBETS.COM Every Dundalk Meeting Race (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Catena Zapata improved a lot from the first day and the step up to a mile suited him. I didn't want to make it but I didn't want them to go too slow. He really stuck his neck out. He's a lovely big horse and should get 1m2f next season - Billy Lee, rider

runners.name: Goldrush Kid
runners.comment: Off the mark over C&D (soft) off 68; all out to win so will find this company much tougher
runners.spotlight: Consistent Flat performer had three spins over hurdles before finally getting off the mark over C&D (soft) 13 days ago off 68; he was all out to win so will find this company much tougher from 6lb higher.

5:45.going_detailed: SOFT, Yielding to soft in places on Round course (Middle track)

runners.name: Leinster
runners.breeder: Al Shira'Aa Farms S A R L
runners.comment: Down Royal maiden win on good; this trip should suit; ground a slight worry; gelded
runners.spotlight: 140,000gns yearling off the mark at second attempt when easily winning 1m2f Down Royal maiden (good) last May; did best work late when third at Roscommon (10.5f) on handicap debut off 85 last July; step up in trip should suit but ground a slight concern; gelded.

runners.name: Nans View
runners.comment: Won back-to-back handicaps in October; poor run over hurdles since; chance back on Flat
runners.spotlight: In great form in October last year, winning back-to-back handicaps here (yielding) and at Galway (heavy) at 1m2f-1m4f; ran no race on hurdles debut behind subsequent Fred Winter winner Puturhandstogether at Cork in December; respected back on the Flat.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Nans View has been knocking on the door and finished strongly the last day over a mile. Dylan said she hit the line well today and she'll probably go a little bit further - Jarlath Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Morse
runners.owner: Mrs John M Weld & N J Hitchins
runners.comment: Sole win on the Flat came on heavy ground at Leopardstown off 73 over 1m last April
runners.spotlight: Sole win on the Flat came on heavy ground at Leopardstown off 73 over 1m last April; largely out of form since barring one good effort at Down Royal in September; dual-purpose performer has plenty to prove at present.

runners.name: Morning Logic
runners.comment: Shock 25-1 winner on belated Flat debut in December 2023; has a tough mark; long layoff
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdler sprang 25-1 shock on belated Flat debut over this trip at Dundalk in December 2023, looking green but seeing it out well; failed to back that up in handicap company off tough opening mark; 4lb lower on turf now but lengthy absence to overcome.

quotes.race: Story Of Dundalk Stadium Book Buy Online Maiden
quotes.quote: Morning Logic has been unlucky over hurdles, he wasn't getting his ideal ground and running a bit keen. 1m4f here suited him, he settled well, he got a bit free when they slowed it down so I let him roll on and when we turned in he quickened up nicely. He ran a bit green when he hit the front but did it well -James Ryan, jockey, talking to Racing TV

runners.name: Bear Profit
runners.comment: Never-nearer third over 1m2f at Leopardstown off 76; should stay this far; contender
runners.spotlight: Two wins on AW and successful on turf at Leopardstown (1m1f, good) last June; got off the mark again at Naas (10.5f, yielding) in October off 69 before a never-nearer third over 1m2f at Leopardstown off 7lb higher; should stay this far; contender.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Lengthen The Odds Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Bear Profit just arrived there. Things didn't go right at Listowel when he raced too keen. He's not a bad horse and got a lovely ride - Ger O'Leary, trainer.

runners.name: Whimsy
runners.comment: Runaway Gowran maiden hurdle winner last time; still off a nice mark back on the Flat
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner finally got off the mark over hurdles after a frustrating sequence when winning a Gowran maiden by 21l three weeks ago; she was beaten less than 3l in C&D handicap in October off current mark; shortlisted.

quotes.race: Lord Bagenal Hotel Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Whimsy finally got there. A big thanks has to go to Paddy Hanlon and Paddy Graffan the last day as if she had gotten away with it, she mightn't have started today.  I went down to the start to make sure. We wanted to make the running, but it didn't work out. Oakley [Brown, jockey] said she found another leg once she turned in. She loves that ground, so I was glad to see all the rain coming. It's brilliant to get over the line over hurdles and I thought the handicapper was a wee bit harsh putting her up 3lb for the last day, but I suppose I'll have to eat my words now. I didn't know what way she'd go being out the back but she enjoyed it Oakley said. We might get something at Fairyhouse for her and if the ground is heavy, it would be ideal - Anthony McCann, trainer.

runners.name: Solar Breeze
runners.comment: Shaped like a stayer on first crack at this trip when running on into third at Dundalk
runners.spotlight: One win apiece on AW and turf at 1m-1m2f, but shaped like a stayer on first crack at this trip when running on into third at Dundalk last month; finished second here over 1m2f off 2lb lower in August; each-way possibilities.

runners.name: Gangster Granny
runners.comment: Below her best in the Amateur Riders Derby over C&D when last seen; better expected
runners.spotlight: Maiden winner over this sort of trip at Limerick (good) last summer and has largely been consistent in defeat since; below her best in the Amateur Riders Derby over C&D when last seen, having cut out much of the early running; better expected.

runners.name: Calzaghi
runners.comment: Would have defied 10lb rise if he wasn't slowly away here last time; big player
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark on second handicap start when winning well at Navan (1m2f, good to yielding) in October; would have defied 10lb rise if he wasn't slowly away from the stalls here next time over the same trip; has form on an easy surface; big player.

runners.name: Quiz Test
runners.comment: Cork winner in 2023 off 65 (1m2f, good); consistent enough but needs to improve
runners.spotlight: Cork winner in 2023 off 65 (1m2f, good); had four runs last year, the pick of those a runner-up finish at Leopardstown over 1m7f on decent ground; one of his poorer runs last time at Roscommon when fitted with cheekpieces (left off); needs to improve.

runners.name: Lucky Out
runners.owner: Yvonne Colgan & Mrs Monica Cogan & L Browne
runners.comment: Never tried over this far and was tailed off over 10.5f previously; hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: One win in nine turf runs for Tom Mullins, a 7f Galway maiden last summer; raided Southwell on first start for this yard last month when outpaced over 7f; never tried over this far and was tailed off over 10.5f previously; hard to fancy.

quotes.race: Caulfield Industrial Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Lucky Out got a no-nonsense ride from Seamie and she won well. I thought she would run to her mark today and it was good enough to win - Tom Mullins, trainer.

runners.name: Party Dress
runners.comment: Won 1m1f maiden at Tipperary last May on soft; hurdles winner last time; respected
runners.spotlight: Won 1m1f maiden at Tipperary last May on soft ground and good handicap third here over 1m2f in October; got off the mark over hurdles in 2m Thurles maiden in November; respected with Billy Lee back aboard.

runners.name: Theophilos
runners.comment: Running well in defeat at Dundalk this year; best form on good; Keane booked
runners.spotlight: Won a Tipperary handicap (1m1f, good to yielding) off 61 in April 2023; went close over 10.5f at Roscommon last May off 73; running well in defeat at Dundalk this year; best form on good; Keane booked.

runners.name: Duke Of Leggagh
runners.comment: Won back-to-back handicap hurdles at Naas in February; lurking off a dangerous Flat mark
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner won back-to-back handicap hurdles at Naas in February, easily scoring latterly off 112; pulled up when stepped up in trip there on latest but is lurking off a dangerous mark back on the Flat; conditions fine.

quotes.race: William Hill Keep Your Raceday Positive Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was ideal conditions for Duke Of Leggagh. He jumped a lot better today. I knew he had improved from the last day, but I didn't think he had improved that much. We'll probably go back to the Flat with him now and he really does like that ground - Mick Mulvany, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Duke Of Leggagh ran well last day and on his Flat form he was entitled to win that. Guts won it for him. We'll mix it between this and the Flat but he wants ground like that - Mick Mulvany, trainer

quotes.race: Bective Restaurant Handicap
quotes.quote: Duke Of Leggagh had to win today, trying to win going up 12lb was going to be hard, but he's a lovely horse in the making. It took a while for the penny to drop last year, but it did on his last run at Galway and he is improving all the time. Gary said he had a bit left - Mick Mulvany, trainer

runners.name: Tuba
runners.comment: Midfield in ordinary Dundalk maiden in November; more needed up in trip on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Encouraging third in 1m Limerick maiden last July on debut; failed to build on that when raised in trip at Killarney; disappointing favourite on AW debut when midfield in ordinary Dundalk maiden in November; more needed up in trip on handicap debut.

runners.name: Inchiquin Maid
runners.comment: Dundalk winner in Dec'; handicapper got to grips with her since and more needed now
runners.spotlight: Two creditable efforts on first two starts for this stable, landing 2m Dundalk handicap in December before going close there from 10lb higher next time; handicapper got to grips with her since and more needed back on turf.

runners.name: Saffronandblue
runners.owner: Anthony Vaughan & O B P Carroll
runners.comment: Poor hurdles campaign this term has been fruitless; returns to the Flat off workable mark
runners.spotlight: Two-time Flat winner, winning back-to-back handicaps at Leopardstown and Sligo last spring; hurdles campaign this season has been fruitless; returns to the Flat from a workable mark so market watch advised.

runners.name: Desert Friend
runners.comment: Seven-time winner in all codes; okay form over hurdles of late; not without a chance here
runners.spotlight: Seven-time winner in all codes, last Flat win coming at Ballinrobe (1m5f, good) last summer; recent Leopardstown hurdles comeback run not without promise; unseated rider at Cork nine days ago; not without a chance.

quotes.race: John B. Keane (C & G) Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Desert Friend likes it around here. There wasn't much pace on, I was happy enough. He travelled and he jumped well, and he done it really well in the end. We didn't go much of a gallop which suited him down to the ground and he galloped all the way up the straight - Donagh Meyler, jockey.

runners.name: Forlio
runners.breeder: A C Coombs & Mr J William Rowley
runners.comment: 2nd over this trip at Dundalk on latest; shouldn't be far away but risky for win purposes
runners.spotlight: Limerick win over 1m3f last May came on testing ground, as did good Roscommon third in August; kept on well in the closing stages when runner-up over this trip at Dundalk on latest; shouldn't be far away but risky for win purposes.

quotes.race: AOS Security Handicap
quotes.quote: Forlio has done some amount of work but I did think he would need the run. Colin said he didn't really love the ground as it was sticky for him so normal soft would be better for him - Paul Flynn, trainer.

runners.name: Purple Sky
runners.comment: Beaten out of sight on her only attempt at this sort of trip; big leap of faith required
runners.spotlight: Some decent efforts in handicaps at around the mile in September of last year but she was beaten out of sight on her only attempt at this sort of trip; big leap of faith required.

runners.name: Jurality

prev_owners.owner: Straight To Victory Syndicate/Geoffrey Thorpe/Brian Bunyan
Straight To Victory Syndicate, Geoffrey Thorpe & Brian Bunya

runners.comment: Finished 51l behind the winner over C&D last June; impossible to fancy on all known form
runners.spotlight: Sent off at huge prices when down the field on both hurdles outings this month; finished 51l behind the winner over C&D last June; impossible to fancy on all known form.

12:17.race_name: Grand Steeple-Chase Cross-Country de Fontainebleau (Listed Race) (5yo+) (Turf)

runners.name: Fraga Has
runners.owner: Ecurie Hugo & Pierre Pilarski & Palmyr Racing

runners.name: Ici Avrilly
runners.breeder: Mme Ac Andre, Haras De Saint-Voir Et Al

runners.name: Iceo Madrik
runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Les Boulaines & Isabelle

stable_tour.quote: It's difficult when a horse joins the stable halfway through the season, as he did last term. We threw him in at the deep end first time in the Ultima but it didn't work out - the ground wasn't soft enough, and it definitely wasn't soft enough when he pulled up at Newton Abbot. He's had a nice, long summer and a wind operation ready for the season. He had some nice form in France, but needs it soft and will be running over further than two and a half miles. He also needs to go left-handed. He'll be out next month. 31-10-23

runners.name: Roi Mage
runners.owner: D G Pryde & D P Van Der Hoeven & G Mcgladery & J Beaumont

prev_owners.owner: D G Pryde & D P Van Der Hoeven & G McGladery & J Beaumont
D G Pryde & D P Van Der Hoeven & G McGladery & J Beaumont

quotes.race: Randox Grand National Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Roi Mage has run an absolute blinder. He was show jumping them a little bit, he was jumping them nearly too well and by the time he got to the elbow he just paid the price a little bit. But I had a brilliant spin off him, he's 11 years old and he's run one of the best races of his life - Felix de Giles, jockey.

quotes.race: Bluegrass Stamm 30 Chase
quotes.quote: Roi Mage came into us in January. He had a good run in the Red Mills Hurdle, we knew he would come on for it and the plan now is to go to Aintree for the Topham - James Griffin, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's 13 but is fresh for his age mileage-wise. He'll go straight to Cheltenham and also has an entry in the Grand National, but we might lean towards the Irish National instead. As soon as they announced the Cross Country was changing to a handicap, it was a no-brainer. Sweet David winning at the track in November was a good boost to the form as we beat him off levels at Craon. If we get him there in the same form as he has been at Aintree or in France, I'd be expecting a bold run. 20-2-25

runners.name: Gentilhomme
runners.owner: Ecurie Patrick Joubert & Haras De Saint-Voir

prev_owners.owner: Haras De Saint-Voir & Ecurie P Joubert

runners.name: Kap My Sun
runners.breeder: Mlle C Fretard, L Moutel & J Moutel

runners.name: Woodchuck
runners.comment: Smart performer who was last seen landing a Group 2 in Italy over a mile; place chance
runners.spotlight: Consistently smart performer who was last seen landing a Group 2 in Italy over a mile, this following a string of good efforts at up to 1m2f; more needed on the figures to win this if some of his rivals run their race but a place couldn't be ruled out.

runners.name: Alcantor
runners.comment: Career best came over C&D when last seen; makes strong appeal if to that level today
runners.spotlight: Finished second in the Group 1 Criterium International here as a 2yo but took a while to hit his best form last season, which did end with a career best in landing the C&D Group 3 Prix Perth, a race in which he mostly dictated; makes strong appeal on that performance if returning at that level.

runners.name: Marhaba Ya Sanafi
runners.comment: Has 13l to find with Alcantor on C&D form in October, but is race-fit for today
runners.spotlight: 2023 Poule d'Essai des Poulains who never really pressed on from that, albeit is well capable of smart form; finished 13l behind Alcantor in the C&D Prix Perth last year but does have a recent run under his belt, albeit second to Vertbois over C&D, so won't lack for race fitness.

quotes.race: Prix Bertrand du Breuil Longines (Group 3) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: One mile most certainly is Marhaba Ya Sanafi's  best trip, so it was not a surprise to see him win again today. His owner is keen to see him run again this season in the Prix Jacques Le Marois so that will be his next target - Andreas Sschutz, trainer.

quotes.race: Emirates Poule d'Essai des Poulains (Group 1) (3yo Colts) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I expected Marhaba Ya Sanafi to run in the first five but I wasn't expecting him to win. The horse really improved from his last run, he did have a hard preparation going into his first few races. He had to settle for fourth early on in the race and he was off the bridle. We got daylight in the straight and he had some gas left in the tank. Mickael knows the horse inside out and everything went to plan - Andreas Schutz, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Vertbois
runners.comment: Won a C&D Listed event here recently, beating 2 who are in this, and is capable of better
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced for his age and only had his first run outside conditions events when finishing second in a Listed event in December; bettered that form, however, when landing one of those on his recent return to action over C&D, when Marhaba Ya Sanafi was second and Short Final, and should get race run to suit; needs to up his game on the figures but seems capable of better.

quotes.race: Prix Altipan (Listed Race) (4yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Vertbois has always worked well and he came close to winning a Listed race at the end of last year. Everyone was making a comeback here, so you have to keep your feet on the ground, but he did it well coming from behind like that. We'll see whether his trainer decides to follow the programme into Group races - he's entered in the Prix Edmond Blanc back here [on March 29] - but at least we know he is up to this level and we don't have to go down a grade - Louise Benard, Godolphin representative.

runners.name: Short Final
runners.breeder: Ecurie Ades Hazan & Mlle K Morice
runners.comment: Closely matched with Vertbois and Marhaba Ya Sanafi; Cristian Demuro booked for 1st time
runners.spotlight: Three from four at this track, and started this year off with that only defeat here, when third behind both Vertbois and Marhaba Ya Sanafi over this trip in a Listed event; needs to find more to reverse that form and best known as a smart handicapper, but Cristian Demuro is an interesting jockey booking.

runners.name: Tumbler
runners.owner: Scea Haras Des Forets, Regis Clarot & Gest Invest Capital

prev_owners.owner: Jean-Philippe Temime, Regis Clarot & Gest Invest Capital
Laurent Gruson, Regis Clarot & Julien Caullery
Ecurie R E, Franck Raoul Et Al

runners.comment: This will be his fifth start of 2025 but needs plenty more on the figures
runners.spotlight: Exposed type who won't lack for race-fitness considering this well be his fifth start of the year, but he does need to step up significantly in this company.

runners.name: Zoom
runners.comment: Finished last season on a high here and no obvious reason why he can't run well
runners.spotlight: Hasn't done a lot of racing at Group level but is more than capable of smart form, as he showed at the end of 2024, winning back-to-back races here, the second of which a mile Listed event; should run well but others preferred.

runners.name: Dare To Dream
runners.breeder: Ecurie Des Monceaux, Meridian International Sarl & Scuderia
runners.comment: Has run well in Group 1s at up to 1m4f, so this trip for her return is the question mark
runners.spotlight: Plenty of good form as a 2yo and mostly built on that last year, failing to win after a reappearance success in a Group 3, but running with credit in a couple of Group 1s at up to 1m4f; this will be her first run since below her best in the Prix Vermeille, and this trip is the obvious question mark for today, but there is plenty of potential pace in this and she could grab a place.

runners.name: Sparks Fly
runners.comment: Loves this track, winning 3 of the 4 times she's been here, and might be hard to catch
runners.spotlight: Often front-runner who loves this C&D (most recent success was a career-best), winning three of the four times she has been here, all under this rider; looks sure to run her race, and would be hard to catch if the rest of the field left her to dominate.

quotes.race: Prix Isola Bella - Fonds Europeen de l'Elevage (Listed Race) (3yo+ Fillies & Mares) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We've not done our usual thing of bowling her out in front and Sparks Fly has quickened away really impressively. We've got so much in hand I think that next year's going to be a really fun year with her - Laura Pearson, jockey.

quotes.race: Robin Hood Stakes (Listed Race) (Formerly Known As The Ben Marshall Stakes)
quotes.quote: Sparks Fly is unreal. I'm so proud of her mother [Stepping Out], who has produced some amazing horses for us. She's had her, Caroline Dale and Baby Steps, and they were all very useful. We thought last time in France she could have gone a bit faster even though she was in front, so Laura decided to go forward again this time and play catch me if you can. The filly never stopped and she loved it ? she had her ears pricked the whole way around. We'll go back to Saint-Cloud for the Prix Isola Bella she won last year. It's on November 10 and she'll get her preferred soft ground there - Dave Lowe, owner.

quotes.race: Prix Coronation (Listed Race) (3yo+ Fillies & Mares) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Sparks Fly has not had the best of seasons but the ground was wrong for her at the Curragh and we had to take her to the other end of the track because she hangs and we have to do what she wants to do. This track suits her down to the ground. She has a lot of ability and a lot of spirit and, as long as we point that in the right direction, she takes us there - Laura Pearson, jockey.

quotes.race: Book Bounce Bingo At Ayr Racecourse Handicap
quotes.quote: Every time I ride Sparks Fly she seems to be coming on mentally and physically. The sky's the limit. I remember when I rode her at Wolverhampton on her first go (in a handicap) and she wasn't quite there on the all-weather, but she's really bounced on the turf. She likes the softer ground, she prefers to be swimming more than running. There's definitely more to come and I'd say she's holding a lot more under her belly - Laura Pearson, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: She was a real flag-bearer for us last year, winning eight races in all. To win her first race off 59 in May and then win a Listed race by 12 lengths and finish off on 107 was phenomenal. Once she started winning she kept pulling out more and more. She looks like she's strengthened up loads and I think we'll have a bit of fun again this year. Soft ground is paramount for her. The only bad run she had was at York and I was kicking myself for running as I walked the track and it was too quick, but we thought we have to try her on quick ground at some stage. We know now it's not her gig. As soon as she got back on to soft, she relished it again and finished off the season really strongly. We were struggling for a race to start her off this time and ended up running her over 7f at Haydock, which is too short but we needed to get a run into her. She's got loads of options but it's down to the weather. There's the Group 3 Princess Elizabeth at Epsom on Saturday and then Royal Ascot. If we don't get the ground, we'll have to go to France or Ireland. She's working the house down at home and is ready to rock and roll. 30-05-24

runners.name: Tajlina
runners.comment: Not difficult to forgive a poor run last time; well bred and can do better
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to the classy Map Of Stars; impressed on second start when winning by 7l at Chantilly over 1m1f during October, but wasn't able to back that up on final start of the season in a Listed event; not difficult to forgive a poor run as a 2yo, however, and holds a Prix Diane entry, so no surprise if she does much better today.

runners.name: Kiamba
runners.owner: Ecurie Elag, Mme A Garavaglia-Drion & Meridian International

prev_owners.owner: Mme A Garavaglia-Drion & Meridian International SARL

runners.comment: Bumped into one last time in a Listed event at this venue; leading claims
runners.spotlight: Finished runner-up both starts, with one of them coming just over three weeks ago here over 110yds shorter in a Listed event, when bumping into a potential Group-class filly; leading claims on that effort with the promise of more to come.

runners.name: Konada
runners.breeder: Ecurie De Castillon, Khalifa Mohammed Al Attiyah & C Tricaud
runners.comment: Won last two, both on the AW and over 1m2f; needs to transfer that level back to grass
runners.spotlight: Comes into this off two wins, both over 1m2f on the AW, the most recent of those coming in January at Pau, beating a rival who has since enhanced that form; needs to transfer that level back to turf, however, although did win a maiden on grass at Marseille Borely last year.

runners.name: Raoule
runners.breeder: Ecurie Skymarc Farm, Scea Marmion Vauville & Scea De La Font
runners.comment: Beaten twice since debut success and this is first run on grass
runners.spotlight: Won on debut in December and run okay since while not adding to that success, but needs to up her game on this first run on grass.

runners.name: Felina
runners.comment: Showed improved form and looked all about stamina when winning last season; respected
runners.spotlight: Didn't show much on debut in Britain but has displayed improved form in France, which ended last season with a 1m2f success at Salon-de-Provence; looks all about stamina judged on that effort and fully respected with Christophe Soumillon on for the first time.

runners.name: Jones
runners.breeder: D & C Bloodstock Llp & C Wilson
runners.comment: Holds a Prix Diane entry and best a couple of rivals who won next time; interesting
runners.spotlight: Only raced over 1m1f 110yds on the Polytrack at Deauville, and followed up her okay debut run with a win 71 days ago, the next two home that day winning next time; holds a Prix Diane entry and open to plenty of improvement on this first turf start.

runners.name: Glamis Road
runners.comment: Matched her career-best here last time and leading chance if staying this trip
runners.spotlight: Has displayed very useful form since winning on debut, and picked up a career best when landing a 7f Listed event here last November; matched that level on her recent return, so should be a leading contender here if staying this new distance.

quotes.race: Prix Herod (Listed Race) (2yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: They didn't go fast enough for her the last day in my opinion, so I was eager to take the bull by the horns and make it a test of stamina, as was the owner and the trainer. Glamis Road was a little bit unlucky not to be third that day and this was a good performance, she likes that ground - Sam James, jockey.

runners.name: Cortella
runners.owner: Xaysana Souk Seum & Mme Henri Devin
runners.comment: Won her last two and stays this trip but this looks tougher
runners.spotlight: Supplemented for this; only raced over 1m2f and followed her Strasbourg maiden success with another at Le Mans eight days ago; this is a lot tougher and, for all that she is capable of improvement, others make more appeal

10:42.race_name: Curlin Florida Derby presented by Hill 'n' Dale Farms at Xalapa (Grade 1) (3yo) (Main Track) (Dirt)

runners.name: Light Infantry Man
runners.owner: Halo Racing Services Pty Ltd, A Kheir Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Halo Racing Services, Never Say Die Partnership Et Al
Halo Racing Services, Never Say Die Partnership Et Al

quotes.race: Prix du Haras de Fresnay-le-Buffard Jacques le Marois (Group 1) (3yo+ No Geldings) (Straight Course)
quotes.quote: Light Infantry's going to be a very exciting horse in Australia and he'll actually have one more run before and then go into quarantine in the second week of September. We waited from this race to Australia last year and it was too long. He will probably take in the Group 3 back here in two weeks' time [Prix Quincey]. The Moulin could be an option - David Simcock, trainer.

quotes.race: Queen Anne Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: We'll be governed by what Ciaron [Maher] wants to do and the timings of Light Infantry going down to Australia. Whether there's one more run in him or not, we'll see. He hasn't let us down and we'll enjoy seeing him in Australia - David Simcock, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Mile (Group 2)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with that and it is a good start. Light Infantry was a little rusty but he stayed on well and went right through the line. I'm really happy. He will go to the Lockinge next like most of the others. He will be going over to Australia at some point to race - David Simcock, trainer.

quotes.race: Prix du Haras de Fresnay-le-Buffard Jacques le Marois (Group 1) (3yo+ No Geldings) (Straight Course)
quotes.quote: We're very pleased.Light Infantry had a gallop to run at today which was good and a mile was always going to suit him better and he's run a personal best. He'll probably go straight to the Golden Eagle in Sydney in October and that'll be his last run of the year - David Simcock, trainer.

runners.name: Attrition
runners.owner: Halo Racing Services Pty Ltd, Ms D M Suss Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Halo Racing Services Pty Ltd, McGrath Racing Syndicate Et Al
Halo Racing Services Pty Ltd, Ms D M Suss Et Al

runners.name: Young Werther
runners.owner: D T Obrien, Mrs J Obrien Et Al

quotes.race: Hardwicke Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: I didn't want to be back at the field, but as I said before the race, Middle Earth is a bit of a slow starter. He travelled on and finished very well. He ran home the last three furlongs in, I'd imagine, the quickest time of the race, so you have to be grateful for that. He's probably run up to his rating. It wouldn't surprise me if he went to the King George, but it would be lovely to win a Group Two on the way to more difficult races - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Aston Park Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: The Melbourne Cup is the plan. We can run Middle Earth a couple more times here and then aim down there. The Hardwicke would be the most likely place to go [next] but we won't over-race him. He hated the ground in last season's St Leger, it was too loose, so if they get one of those downpours in Melbourne you might as well stay in the hotel - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Troy Asset Management Noel Murless Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Middle Earth seems to stay well but he's not one-paced and ran some decent sectionals in the Melrose and he's one I like. I would entertain coming back to a mile and a half next season but maybe something like the Sagaro could be a good starting point and see where we go from there - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

runners.name: Shaiyhar
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: B & F Thoroughbreds, A Stephenson Et Al

runners.name: Pride Of Jenni
runners.owner: A Ottobre, Mrs L Ottobre & M Ottobre

runners.name: Atishu
runners.owner: A J A Bosma, Mrs P J Clark Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Honeycomb Stud, J O'Rourke & G Fagan

quotes.race: Watch Irish Racing On Racing TV Novice Median Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: John Quinn said he quite liked Deny Knowledge. She was a bit gassy first time out over a mile so he dropped her to 7f. A bit of juice in the ground helped her and I'm sure there's plenty more to come - Kevin Stott, jockey.

runners.name: Feroce
runners.owner: Sutton Racing Pty Ltd, S Chappell Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Sutton Racing Pty Ltd, S Chappell Et Al
G D Thurlow & Mrs P A Thurlow

runners.name: Powers Of Opal
runners.owner: Think Big Stud Syndicate, Nearco Stud Ltd Syndicate Et Al

prev_owners.owner: J G Sargent, Think Big Stud Et Al

runners.name: Real Class
runners.owner: Australian Bloodstock Syndicate, J Falcke Et Al

runners.name: Declichy Boulevard
runners.owner: K J Payne & Mrs V M Payne

runners.name: Benagil
runners.breeder: Blue Gum Farm Aust Pty Ltd
runners.owner: P E & Mrs P A Campbell, R L Byrnes Et Al

runners.name: Verona Rose
runners.owner: Remy Racing Syndicate, Mrs K Colquhoun Et Al

runners.name: Canny Queen
runners.breeder: C C E & J W Thompson

quotes.race: Longines Hong Kong Vase (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour was just a little bit keen early and Tom [Marquand] was keen to get him to settle, so he was well back. He has run a hell of a race on ground faster than he really likes, so you've got to be thrilled - Maureen Haggas, trainer's wife.

quotes.race: Grand Prix de Saint-Cloud (Group 1) (4yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: The two Group 1s in Australia were fantastic but to win a Group 1 in Europe was important. Dubai Honour seemed to really enjoy himself today and looked to be travelling well all the way. The ground was probably a bit quick for him but maybe the trip [1m4f] on this ground is more suitable. He seemed to stay the trip really well which gives us another option. On the faster ground he gets this trip really well. William [Haggas] will decide where he goes but he's in lots of Group 1s all over the place. He's just a star of a horse and every time he gives his all. He's so good in his mind - assistant trainer Maureen Haggas.

quotes.race: Grand Prix de Chantilly (Group 2) (4yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour got rushed over ten furlongs in Hong Kong where there's a short run to the first bend. Now he's shown he can go a mile and a half we might look at going back to Hong Kong for the Vase, a race in which they have the whole straight before the turn - Philip Robinson, owner's racing manager.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Magnolia Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour was a bit fresh and I think the run will have done him the world of good. He's such a grand horse, a sweet one, and that was good. It's nice to get his head back in front. He won a Group 1 only a year ago, but when you do those foreign trips, it takes time to get them back in the groove again. He needs to go after the money and is a slow-ground horse, but did win on faster last year. I think the plan is a Group 1 in Hong Kong on April 28 - Maureen Haggas, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Longines Queen Elizabeth Stakes (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour relaxed very well, and I knew when he relaxed well, he would pick up and he picked up well. Anamoe is a great horse, take nothing away from him, but this horse has come forward for being here and he's won well. I think Tom was keen to track Anamoe. The horse was prominent in the Ranvet which is not normally his style of running. He likes to come off the pace - William Haggas, trainer, speaking to Racing.com.

quotes.race: Ranvet Stakes (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I was very much worried about the track, but they assured me it was on the five side of a good four and Chris Waller told me it was fantastic, so we decided to gamble and run, and that was a great result. Dubai Honour had a great year in 2021 but he wasn't quite himself last year. However, he had a very, very good winter and I've been really happy with him - William Haggas, trainer.

quotes.race: Longines Hong Kong Cup (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour ran a really good race and he was just a bit unfortunate with how the race unfolded, which often happens there. When he got out and hit his stride he really came home well. This trip will have taught him a lot and hopefully we'll have a smart international performer on our hands next year - William Haggas, trainer.

quotes.race: Qipco Champion Stakes (British Champions Middle Distance) (Group 1)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour ran a fantastic race. The draw didn't help and then he got a bit set alight. He came from quite a way back with a winning chance but the French horse was just too strong. We might now have a dart at Hong Kong - William Haggas, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour did that well off a gallop which was a bit stop start. He's going the right way and toughed it out - James Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour has probably been a bit of a slow learner and he did well to finish second at Chester, which is a tight track. He's improving all the time and is a nice horse for the future - Danny Tudhope, jockey.

runners.name: Vauban
runners.breeder: P Decouz & S C E A Du Bas Bugey
runners.owner: Australian Bloodstock, Ab Vauban Et Al

quotes.race: Lexus Melbourne Cup (Group 1 Handicap) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We're disappointed again. Vauban looked like a picture in the mounting yard and was ready to rock. William said from halfway he was flat out and I think we did well to finish eleventh. For whatever reason he just doesn't seem to travel down here well and we're puzzled. Maybe we should stay here, I don't know. I'll talk to Willie and we'll have to figure out what to do as I'm not sure what we can do in Europe with him - Rich Ricci, owner alongside wife Susannah.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Hamilton Lonsdale Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Two miles on the Flat is his optimum trip. Vauban got there so easily and I ended up getting there too soon. He was idling but he did enough. He's a class horse - William Buick, rider. The plan must be to go to Melbourne now. We said we'd work back from it and I don't know what we do next - he is in the Irish St Leger - but Australia remains the plan. He was very, very good today - Rich Ricci, joint-owner.

quotes.race: Gold Cup (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: I think we got plan A working very well; Colin got Vauban in a nice position settled on the rails. Everything opened up for him nicely and it looked like he didn't stay against that calibre of animal. Kyprios is probably special and in a lesser two-and-a-half-mile race he'd probably have his chance. I think we're going back. I was happy enough with that run to go back to Melbourne. It's a half-mile shorter and he goes on the ground. When you have a horse who goes on that ground, you take your chance. He'll have at least one run before, maybe two - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Yorkshire Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: I was delighted, they'll be very happy with that. Vauban is going to get further and he felt he was going to improve for that so there are plenty of positives to take from it - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Lexus Melbourne Cup (Group 1 Handicap) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Vauban was beaten too far out for my liking. When I saw him coming to the six-furlong marker and Ryan had to give him a squeeze, I thought 'that's not great'. He should have been cantering at that stage. He just flattened out and ran very disappointingly. He didn't fire on the day. Maybe it was the heat - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballyroan Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I wasn't worried about the drop in trip for Vauban as he'd won a Listed event in France a couple of years ago over a mile and a half and, although further suits him better, we were confident enough it wouldn't pose a problem. Colin (Keane) said it was straightforward. They went a nice even gallop, which suited him and a little bit of juice in the ground suited him well and he picked up well in the straight. He had to run in the first three today to tick that box to pass the ballot for the Melbourne Cup, so he's done that now. Willie will decide in the next few weeks what he's going to do with him - David Casey, trainer's assistant, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Copper Horse Handicap
quotes.quote: I didn't expect to be in front, but I got Vauban out okay and nobody else wanted to be in front. They told me he stays very well and I felt I had to keep building the pace. He got into a good rhythm and stretched all the way to the line. He's a very smart horse. He won a Listed race on the Flat in France and he was in a handicap here and he's done what he's done jumping. I'd say today was a bit of a shock to him making the running, but he got the job done very well - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Ballymore Champion Four Year Old Hurdle (Juvenile) (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Vauban is able to get down and hurdle properly now. He settled well and was able to change gear. He looks hugely exciting - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Hurdle (Juvenile) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'll have a word with Rich (Ricci), but I imagine what we'll do is hurdle this first season then give them the summer off, hurdle next season and then go Flat racing after that and I'd love to win the Melbourne Cup, but that might be in 2023. Punchestown could be next - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing TV "12 Euros Per Month This Weekend Only" Spring Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Vauban had a very good run at Punchestown. Paul got his jumping together and he has improved. That puts him in the Triumph picture. He put it all together today - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It's very hard for five-year-olds in their second season to compete with the older horses, so I'm hoping he'll be the finished article next season 14-2-23

He was the top juvenile hurdler last season, winning the Triumph and two other Grade 1s. The following season is always a tough one for five-year-olds and he has run with real credit in his two runs behind State Man. He's in the Champion Hurdle and will run well, but I'd hope next season, when he's the finished article, he'll be a serious contender for top honours. 08-03-23

runners.name: Arapaho
runners.owner: Bjorn Baker Racing, C E Holt Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.name: Duke De Sessa
runners.owner: M J Regan, S E C Duke Et Al

quotes.race: Paddy Power Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: That was a good performance on Duke De Sessa's first time over a mile and a half - Dermot Weld, trainer.

quotes.race: Eyrefield Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Duke De Sessa is a lovely colt for next year, he is still immature. There is lots to look forward to. Hopefully he can come back early next season for a Guineas trial and I see him as a horse for next year's Irish 2,000 Guineas - Dermot Weld, trainer.

runners.name: Zarir
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C

quotes.race: Prix Ganay (Group 1) (4yo+) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Zarir has confirmed he's as good as we thought. He's shown he's competitive at this level and we know he stays further. I think, with his turn of foot, he'll be even better on quicker ground - Francis Graffard, trainer.

runners.name: Circle Of Fire
runners.owner: M Johnston, Mrs A J Johnston Et Al

prev_owners.owner: HM The King & HM The Queen

quotes.race: Newmarket Stakes (Listed Race) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Circle Of Fire has run very nicely for only his third start and as you could see, he looks as though he will go up another gear if he goes another two furlongs. Ryan (Moore) thought they went slightly too steady for him early on and thought that had they gone a bit quicker it might have suited him all the better - John Warren, racing manager to HM The King and HM The Queen Consort.

quotes.race: Byerley Stud Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Circle Of Fire is big and impressive physically and for his size and scope Sir Michael has been seeing something at home. He had a nice introduction, partly because he wasn't so quick out of the stalls when he started. The penny dropped, he got into gear and Ryan was impressed. He's a nice horse for the future, he looks as though he's got exciting potential - John Warren, racing manager to The Queen.

stable_tour.quote: He is very progressive and following a gelding operation he came out at Newcastle last month and won with ease by five and a half lengths off his opening mark of 76. The handicapper raised him 11lb on the back of that impressive effort, which I can understand. Even after the gelding operation he still seemed very gormless at Newcastle until Danny [Muscutt] grabbed hold of him. He will progress with racing experience and there is more to come from him. 29-03-23

runners.name: Asterix
runners.owner: D Kelt, M J Greatbatch Et Al

prev_owners.owner: D Kelt, B Kelt Et Al

quotes.race: BetVictor Geoffrey Freer Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I think 16-1 for the St Leger is fair. There's a bit of time between now and then and I think that's the plan for Zechariah. We'll discuss it with everyone, but Dad and I are never shy of having a pop. He was disappointing at Newmarket, but I think we ran him back too quickly after his good run at Ascot. He won the Haynes, Hanson and Clark on good to soft, so goes on most ground - I just don't think he wants extremes. He's also in the Caulfield Cup and Melbourne Cup and he's got Australian connections so we'll talk to them with regard to that - Freddie Meade, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Martin Densham Memorial EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Zechariah is a nice horse and when he gets stronger he's going to keep improving. He'll stay further and will improve for going up to a mile. Martyn Meade's system works and he finds a good horse every year. He could well be the next one - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

runners.name: Waltham
runners.owner: Mcs Racing, M J Burns Et Al

prev_owners.owner: MCS Racing Syndicate, M J Burns Et Al

quotes.race: Hipodromo De La Zarzuela Rated Race
quotes.quote: Waltham is just a nice horse. I thought he had to be a stakes horse to do that and I'd say he's a stakes horse on that ground. You're not going to see the best of him until this time next year when he grows up - Ger Lyons, trainer.

quotes.race: Vintage Voyager Maiden
quotes.quote: Waltham is a horse we have always loved. We knew he would be green and we also knew he was only 70 to 80% cooked. We'll take baby steps. We would have been very disappointed today if he didn't do that - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Warmonger
runners.owner: Oti Racing, Balmerino Racing Partnership Et Al

runners.name: Kinesiology
runners.owner: A Kheir, N A Greenhalgh Et Al

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Vinnie Roe Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Kinesiology had a good look in front and as far as I'm concerned he was definitely the best horse on the day. The stewards made their decision and they are in charge. There was a bump close to the line, but I felt my horse had the race in safe keeping at that stage. He quickened up past Declan's mount and was just dossing in front. The best horse won but it was taken away from him - Shane Foley, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He progressed nicely to finish second at Leopardstown and has done very well since. He won't be appearing until the ground dries out. I'd say he could definitely stretch out to a mile and a quarter. 24-04-24

runners.name: La Crique
runners.owner: Mrs J K Cassin & J T Cassin

quotes.race: Qatar Lillie Langtry Stakes (Group 2) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: I think they go quicker in three-mile chases, don't they? River Of Stars ran a sound race and I'm really pleased with her. She's a tough filly. We'll probably go for the Park Hill now - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

quotes.race: Pontefract Castle Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: River Of Stars is very tough and she stays well. It was a good opportunity for her. I'm glad she held on. She kept finding. The second horse came very late but she kept finding all the way to the line. I wasn't sure she had held on but I was hoping. She deserved that - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: William Hill Bronte Cup Fillies' Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: It played out well. If it wasn't River of Stars's first run of the year I'd have let her roll along. I had to sit into everyone at the top of the straight as she was a bit lairy, but she knew where the line was and stuck it out well. I wouldn't be surprised if she gets further too. Ralph's been aiming her at this and it's worked out lovely. She had a lot to turn around - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: She's consistent and I'm sure something will fall her way again this year. She won the Bronte Cup at York last season and that is the obvious race for her in May. She likes the track and also ran well in last season's Lonsdale Cup. She'll need to improve again to step up in grade, which is possible given she's from a late-developing family. She's training well and is versatile. 15-04-24

runners.name: Honey Girl
runners.owner: T N Porter, Mrs B E Porter Et Al

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud Circus Maximus Irish EBF Athasi Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: Honey Girl had some very smart form last year, she won very well here last time and she looks an exciting filly for the future. She handles soft ground well and she is probably at her best on this surface so that is something we can keep in mind for the rest of the season. I thought she was impressive today. She was awkward at times last year and was tricky in the stalls, but Dylan gets on well with her and it's nice to see her back up a good run with an even better one - Joseph O'Brien, trainer

stable_tour.quote: I think she has come on a bit since she won her maiden at the Curragh, and she did well to win that day. She had a couple of very good runs last year at the top level. 06-04-23

This lovely filly joined us from Henry de Bromhead this season and I was delighted when she won on her debut for us in a 7f Curragh maiden on very soft ground last month. I would love to get a stakes win on the board and she will go back to the Kildare course for the Group 3 7f Athasi Stakes next month. 12-04-23

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Cooley Fillies & Mares Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Sakti has got the black type in the bag every race she has run. She is a stalwart, but it is just brilliant to get the number one on her back. From day one, she has been promising to do that and I'm just delighted that she has done it - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer
